Text: When I was told a friend's baby had been born with only partial á sight. This was her first child and she was not young (the mother á that is).
Label: sadness

Text: When I passed a very important exam.
Label: joy

Text: A \higher status\" colleague of mine despised my attitude and á
Label: anger

Text: One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car, á but I was too frightened to go and see.
Label: fear

Text: Saw my brother-in-law insulting my sister.
Label: disgust

Text: I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock á someone knocked violently on the door.
Label: fear

Text: When my father was involved in an accident.
Label: fear

Text: A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in á order to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting a á scholarship for an excellent grade.
Label: disgust

Text: In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members of á society for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids by á Police (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a á reflection of my own shortcomings.
Label: anger

Text: I was angry at my boyfriend who had promised to come to see me á but did not because he spent the evening with his pals.
Label: anger

Text: Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.
Label: joy

Text: I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic á ordinance. In fact I was innocent.
Label: anger

Text: I felt shame when I found that I was almost last in the exam.
Label: shame

Text: Going to a disco by myself to wait for some friends. We had á separated and hadn't planned where to meet. I wasn't sure if they á were even going to this place so I felt very conscious of being á alone.
Label: fear

Text: Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated á physically me and my mother.
Label: disgust

Text: Not being able to answer question in a seminar.
Label: shame

Text: When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after       á a long illness.  I had thought that this illness would never end.
Label: joy

Text: After watching the 49ers lose game after game, year after year, I á was finally rewarded with a Super Bowl victory which made me á extremely happy.
Label: joy

Text: When I stated sharply something I was not very sure of and a few á days later I was shown to be wrong.
Label: shame

Text: I was keeping a friend's Library book which went overdue. My á friend was charged for the delay in returning the book to the á Library. I felt guilty when I realised I was responsible.
Label: guilt

Text: Before important sports events.
Label: fear

Text: The discovery that one has only thought of oneself.
Label: shame

Text: I have experienced disgust with some people - usually double á dealers.
Label: disgust

Text: Class leader getting me to do things he did not want to do.
Label: disgust

Text: I got a present from a great friend (a dog).
Label: joy

Text: This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study á there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance á Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.
Label: fear

Text: I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car. á We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my á friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly á started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for á me to go to Carinthia.
Label: anger

Text: When some people, including me, are treated in a way which á equates them to an animal or a thing.
Label: disgust

Text: First time going out with a boy and other people laughed at us.
Label: shame

Text: A girl asked me why I didn't dance. I told her I was ashamed to á dance. I felt myself ashamed having to tell her this.
Label: shame

Text: When I received the acceptance letter from UNZA.  I had just á come home from work when my kind sister handed me an enveloppe á which I opened and was overcome with joy.
Label: joy

Text: The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to á my norms of behaviour.
Label: disgust

Text: I was very happy when I passed the B.A with first class marks.
Label: joy

Text: When I noticed obvious marks of old age (in a negative sense) on á a close relative of mine.
Label: sadness

Text: Once I had some homework to do and I did not do it.
Label: guilt

Text: When I heard that a 14 years old girl had been raped by four á rikshaw drivers in our town.
Label: disgust

Text: Someone told me that he would stay at my home for one night. á Therefore I made big efforts to make everything ok (food). One day á before he cancelled the appointment because he had to go to á church with his parents.
Label: anger

Text: When I attended the concert of a pop singer.
Label: joy

Text: While at primary school, I did not let a friend ring a bell á although he would have liked to do it.  Afterwards I felt bad.
Label: guilt

Text: Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to á back up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was only á about 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.
Label: fear

Text: I was very sad when I heard that my uncle had passed away á untimely at home.
Label: sadness

Text: I went to eat at my aunt's house and she served macaroni with a á horrible appearence. I felt the sensation above. The worst was á that I was practically obliged to eat.
Label: disgust

Text: I had a friend who was very kind to me.  I tried my best to like á him and understand him but when I was with him I could not help á rejecting, criticizing and blaming him.  I wanted to get away á from him as soon as possible.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was in a little fishing boat and we ran into hard weather á in the open sea.
Label: fear

Text: I tried to pass an examination particularly well, but I did it á worse than ever. I felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: First day back on the job.
Label: fear

Text: When I lied to my mum, who later came to know that what I had á been teling her was false.
Label: guilt

Text: Walking out from the biology building.
Label: fear

Text: When I was selected to the university of Zambia.
Label: joy

Text: My parents and brother came up over the weekend. We are a very á close family. This was my first year away from home. They brought á one jacko-lantern with a new design. That is the old joke that á we have a great new design - it's always the same.
Label: joy

Text: I felt that I contributed to a possible rift in the relationship á between a boy and girl soon to be married, in my flat after I á moved in. After stating my celibacy to him which she overheard á and didn't previously know about I suspect.
Label: guilt

Text: When I cheated my trusting girlfriend by telling her that I was a á qualified doctor and later she found out that I was only a á medical student at the preclinical level.
Label: guilt

Text: A boy phoned me at night and wanted to talk to me for 30 minutes á outside.  I thought that he would reveal what he felt and would á question me on our relationship.  I treated him as a friend and á did not want any misunderstandings.  Therefore I refused to meet á him and told him that I would see him the coming day.  I was very á unhappy as I feared having hurt him and got him into trouble.
Label: fear

Text: Before an examn.
Label: fear

Text: When I copy someone else's problem set.
Label: guilt

Text: A close person lied to me.
Label: anger

Text: When I wet my bed at boarding school.
Label: shame

Text: This is one feeling I never betray, but I must confess that the á last time I slighty felt happy was when I passed my M.A with a á high rank.  This was a few years ago when my friend told me about á the result.
Label: joy

Text: When I get a hug from someone I love.
Label: joy

Text: Pictures of Nazi extermination camps on a T.V program.
Label: disgust

Text: When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.
Label: fear

Text: I did not deliver a message on time.
Label: guilt

Text: Not to have studied enough when exams were near.
Label: guilt

Text: During my first week in Graz I met a girl who I had got to know á in the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had considered á her very sympathetic, we had seperated without changing our á adresses.
Label: joy

Text: My sister lost one of her twin sons (my first nephews) and then á the older one died a week later.
Label: sadness

Text: When one of my best friends commited siucide during these á holidays.
Label: sadness

Text: [ No response.]
Label: fear

Text: When I received the S.Y.J.C results, the marks I obtained were á not up to my expectations and I missed admission in engineering.
Label: sadness

Text: [ No response.]
Label: anger

Text: Hear my name on the list attending the English lectures.
Label: joy

Text: I heard of the death of a closefriend of mine.  I had gone camping        á with him shortly before his death and the whole thing seemed very  á sudden to me.
Label: sadness

Text: Felt it after I spoke terribly (got mad at) the person who is the á most important in my life.
Label: shame

Text: I received a phone call from a high school friend whose younger á sister studied with me at the University and gave me a lift every á moning. She was going to get married to a guy whom I knew too and á who had died when he fell from a building, I was afraid to lose á somebody since I had already lost a brother in an accident.
Label: fear

Text: My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some á problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything  á was all right.
Label: joy

Text: One night, my boyfriend expressed his love for me in the canteen in á the presence of my friends by giving me a present.
Label: joy

Text: A party I went to last Christmas.
Label: joy

Text: I had a very short term romance during the summer vacations.  When á we first met I felt excited but I wanted to avoid him after we had met á a few times and so I proposed that we stay apart, I felt very á sad then.
Label: sadness

Text: When a crawling child got burnt because of my negligence to keep á the child away from the fire.
Label: guilt

Text: The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted my á studies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! They á believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.
Label: guilt

Text: When I nearly got my fiancee pregnant.
Label: guilt

Text: [ Do not know.]
Label: shame

Text: I destroyed my step-brother's bedsheets by mistake, they were the á only ones he had.
Label: guilt

Text: When I saw a car run over a child, out of carelessness.
Label: anger

Text: The day my parents were involved in a car accident and had to be á operated  and before the operation the doctor said that it was á mater of life or death.
Label: fear

Text: When people next to me play the fool.
Label: shame

Text: During a meeting I said something wrong and the others laughed at á me.
Label: shame

Text: I feel disgusted with the bootlickers, with helpless people.
Label: disgust

Text: When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.
Label: disgust

Text: Emptied a bucket of water in a hospital.
Label: shame

Text: My father suddenly fell ill. He stayed for 3 months in the á hospital: the last month on intensive care of the Academic á Hospital, then he died.
Label: sadness

Text: With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanting to send the All Blacks to South á Africa.
Label: disgust

Text: In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence.  He tried á to force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but my á sister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down.  á There was a fight.
Label: anger

Text: I confused a girl with another.
Label: shame

Text: [ No response.]
Label: guilt

Text: Finding out that some students are getting good reports they do á not deserve.
Label: disgust

Text: When I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caught á me with them in my bag.
Label: guilt

Text: I am afraid if I'll finish the term.
Label: fear

Text: When my father's new fiancee treats me like a child.  She does á not trust me and constantly misunderstands me.  I get á particularly angry when she says nasty things about my boyfriend á with whom she works.
Label: anger

Text: When I realized that I was far behind the others in the language á course and I could no longer catch up with the others.
Label: anger

Text: The girl with whom I was going around had been forbidden to be á alone with me in the house.  We paid no attention to this á prohibition but one day her parents appeared and I jumped out of á the window.  They saw me.
Label: shame

Text: When people without my permission pry in my belongings and take á things out of it.
Label: anger

Text: I put on a lot of weight in a few months and every time I met á someone I knew would avoid them, usually by hiding because my á self image was low and I was ashamed of what I had done to á myself.
Label: shame

Text: Getting drunk and creating a lot of trouble at a place I respect á - my friend's home.
Label: shame

Text: When I was taking my girlfriend out, she seemed to have taken á her time.
Label: disgust

Text: Several good friends made me a surprise visit and this made me á happy.  They are my closest friends and we had not seen each á other for a long time.
Label: joy

Text: Finding out that life span in China is shorter than in the West.
Label: sadness

Text: When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.
Label: fear

Text: I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cutting á open their stomaches and taking out their bowels.
Label: disgust

Text: Once while walking along a hill; I fell down out of carelessness á and I broke my left arm.
Label: fear

Text: After an exam I was in a very bad mood as I had done it very       á badly.  At home, my mother took so long to ask me how things had  á gone that I lost my temper.  I overreacted and made my mother cry. á She still prepared lunch for me and did not scold me .  Suddenly, á I thought that it was my fault and I started crying.  á
Label: guilt

Text: It was the first time that I gave a birthday present to my friend. á   She wrote me a letter as she is my girlfriend.  The content of á the letter was so sweet that it made me feel very happy.á
Label: joy

Text: My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because á I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of á not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same á way.
Label: shame

Text: I called off a relationship with one girl so I could see another.
Label: guilt

Text: When I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, was á rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.
Label: anger

Text: Quarreling with classmates.
Label: anger

Text: [ Never felt the emotion.]
Label: shame

Text: The sadness came to me when I heard that my girlfriend whom I á loved so much got married to another man before a rebuff from á her.
Label: sadness

Text: I got into a tight pair of trousers and examined myself in the á mirror.  My back looked unpresentable and I felt ashamed at my á wanting to wear those clothes that day.  I quickly changed into á another dress.
Label: shame

Text: Failing an examn.
Label: shame

Text: When a guy chased me when I was out jogging.
Label: fear

Text: Before a hospital visit prior to a D&C under anasthesia for an á expected miscarriage.
Label: fear

Text: I have a fobic anxiety for elevators. This anxiety is worst at á the moment when the doors have to open. I have it often in the á elevator at our university.
Label: fear

Text: I have an adopted Aboriginal sister I felt disgust due to the á racism she has been subjected to.
Label: disgust

Text: Someone messing up the room we share.
Label: anger

Text: When I happen to witness some sadistic acts.
Label: disgust

Text: I had promised to lend something to my mother-in-law and I forgot á it a couple of times.  When she asked me about it the third time, á I was ashamed at my absent-mindedness.
Label: shame

Text: In adolescence I had a very violent fight with my sister I hold á her stong in her neck, she had a throat surgery what make me feel á guilty about the future reactions she might had injuring the á surgery.
Label: guilt

Text: I had an implicit agreement with my sister about meeting her, á however she had not understood the situation the same way so she á did not turn up.
Label: anger

Text: I went to a party and there were some cakes which weren't good á and had a bad smell.
Label: disgust

Text: Caused a family disturbance.
Label: sadness

Text: When my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in á the family after 19 years of baby boys.
Label: joy

Text: Not being a good host for a friend from a far away place.
Label: guilt

Text: I had to leave Den Helder and all friends and acquaintences, á after having spend two weeks there with my friends.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought á the cloth after months of hindrances.
Label: joy

Text: When I first came to the campus.
Label: joy

Text: When I was the South Koreans on the TV.
Label: disgust

Text: When I tried to steal a book from the bookshop and was caught.
Label: shame

Text: I thought that I could have avoided the above situation (the one á in fear) if I had concentrated more on my work, which I hate.
Label: guilt

Text: I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors and á asking for money, though I had some money I did not give him á anything.
Label: guilt

Text: With self at losing an important game that I should have won.
Label: anger

Text: I threw away an object, which belonged to a friend, because I did á not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that á and I felt guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: When my gradmother died.  I felt very sad then ... The feeling á started to be worse after a while.
Label: sadness

Text: When we were going to Nkhoma last Saturday the vehicle was moving á very fast, so I feared we might crash since the road was too á rough.
Label: fear

Text: When I imitated a teacher behind his back - walking very silly.
Label: shame

Text: A film on zombies.
Label: fear

Text: I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.
Label: disgust

Text: My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done.  It was á my sister who had done it.
Label: anger

Text: I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a á few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.
Label: anger

Text: Once I offended a friend, instead of her coming to me to ask and á discuss the matter she was just telling other people about it and á say all she could about me.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.
Label: fear

Text: I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a á form.
Label: anger

Text: Once again my parents distroyed a relationship.
Label: anger

Text: I had been watching a triller a dark night in the country and I á had to go the outside toilet on my own.
Label: fear

Text: My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).
Label: sadness

Text: I found I was pregnant and unmarried.
Label: shame

Text: I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a á great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the á large number of pupils who fail.
Label: joy

Text: When a friend told me a story and I stayed dumb because I had no á story to tell.
Label: shame

Text: I overturned in a canoe a few years back and I didn't know how to á swim. Although I had a life-jacket on I still panicked.
Label: fear

Text: After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had á got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he á feels glad.
Label: joy

Text: When I found out that the guy I was dating at a particular time á had a steady relationship going on with someone else for a long á time.
Label: anger

Text: When I was admitted to the University.
Label: joy

Text: When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of á medical uniform.
Label: anger

Text: Once my father slapped my mother for a small quarrel.
Label: anger

Text: I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to be á done in groups of two.  I was talking about it to my friends when á I said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning my á work partner.  I did not quite mean what I said and I felt á ashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is also á a friend of mine.
Label: shame

Text: While taking a short cut through the Vasa park, I was surrounded á by three people who tried to steal my money.  I was scared and á was saved only by the appearance of other people.
Label: fear

Text: When I went to town in a double dekker bus.  The bus was about to á fall on the way when the driver controlled it.  It had almost á fallen.
Label: fear

Text: Saw on TV China not winning more gold medals in the Asian á Olympics.
Label: shame

Text: When I promise to do something but I don't fulfill it.
Label: shame

Text: It was the time when I was in no position to secure a Ist class á in the M.Sc exam and this was likely to affect my career.
Label: fear

Text: I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furniture á of mine, but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of mine á took it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people some á unnecessary work.
Label: guilt

Text: My grandmother died over the summer. I knew her very well, she á baked great biscuits. She was in the hospital but expected to á improve and go home soon. She died in her sleep.
Label: sadness

Text: During the Christmas holidays, I went to see my parents and á stayed with them for two weeks. After two or three days, we had á the same conflicts we had had ten years before when I had lived á with them. They were glad when I left.
Label: sadness

Text: When I found my girl in bed with another man.
Label: disgust

Text: The first time that I had to go up on the stage to give a speech.
Label: shame

Text: I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8 á exams. The day I heard the news was the day I celebrated my á birthday.
Label: joy

Text: When I miss the train and I am late, and I have to wait half an á hour for the next one.
Label: anger

Text: I have a girlfriend, who is almost like a daughter to me.  She is á studying out of station and I get to see her only once a year.  á Her arrival is always a joyous one.
Label: joy

Text: A close friend first said he accepted an agreement, but later á used that agreement as a reason for attacking me.
Label: anger

Text: When I was in a religious school my teacher showed me up in front á of all my class-mates.  They were very sarcastic and cruel.
Label: shame

Text: I was complaining about calling people whom I didn't know. I á forgot that the purpose is to invite people for dinner and get to á know them.
Label: shame

Text: After much trouble getting together in the first place my á boyfriend and I celebrated our first anniversary.
Label: joy

Text: It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussed á Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because á I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not able á to join the conversation.
Label: shame

Text: When I had achieved a goal indirectly. I work for CAL Football á and our 2nd win of the season was very gratifying and brought á our joy because of the hard work involved and the fact that no á one expected we would win.
Label: joy

Text: Right before I went to a concert with my last boyfriend he told á me that although he told me he was going to take me to the á concert, he didn't want to see me anymore. After that we stayed á overnight and I said \well, when he leaves me I will be ruined á
Label: joy

Text: I lost a close friend.
Label: sadness

Text: I was once this week angry when soemone trying to compress my á mind due to his nonsense speech which himself could not tolerate á at all.
Label: anger

Text: Students on campus were unnecessarily creating trouble just to á heckle the authorities - not to achieve something concrete, but á to further their own interest.
Label: disgust

Text: When I have seen people very drunk and making fools of á themselves.
Label: disgust

Text: When my brother was born, everything went all right.  It had been á very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers á from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.
Label: joy

Text: It was when we were beaten or lost the football match by 5-1 and á then I scored the third goal to my own side.
Label: shame

Text: When I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.
Label: joy

Text: When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had á big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of á the night and shouted at me.
Label: disgust

Text: When I broke my leg I felt fear.
Label: fear

Text: Someone borrowed my textbook and deliberately did not return it.
Label: anger

Text: The same as in \shame\"."
Label: guilt

Text: Some colleagues decided to go out on a Saturday not inviting me á to decide either the place nor the time.
Label: sadness

Text: I had an accident in which I hurt my eye.  I was afraid of having á injured it badly.
Label: fear

Text: When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that the á boat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun would á accidentally go off.
Label: fear

Text: I worked together with another student on a computer-assignment. á She didn't do her best and didn't prepare herself for it. She á expected me to explain it to her.
Label: anger

Text: This feeling occurred to me when my colleague entered in G.V. á (University) and I didn't.
Label: anger

Text: When I felt I had let my parents down, especially my mother, by á having sexual intercourse for the first time, and a few times á after that. Also, when I went on the Pill.
Label: guilt

Text: I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed á towards the precipice along the road.
Label: fear

Text: When the mother of a good friend of mine died.
Label: sadness

Text: [ No response.]
Label: guilt

Text: When my friends did not ask me to go to a New Year's party á with them.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had á enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.
Label: guilt

Text: When two hyenas made crying noise on the window of my bedroom at á home when I was preparing for my MCE examination during the á night.
Label: fear

Text: A person misinterpreted what I had told her. I had told her that á I had failed to insert a NasoGastric tube but she went and á scolded the patient that she was being uncooperative.
Label: guilt

Text: When I go out with my friend with enough money and good sense to á our favorite dancing.
Label: joy

Text: The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.  Both of á us felt that we were right for each other in every way and we had á no doubts about our compatibility right from the day we got á engaged.
Label: joy

Text: When I could not complete my assignment on time.
Label: guilt

Text: I took my grandmother's money without telling her and when asked á if it was me who had taken the money, I denied it.
Label: guilt

Text: Finding that a girlfriend of mine was a prostitute and had been á seeing many others during our relationship.
Label: disgust

Text: I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself, my á homework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention. á Especially in learning another language.
Label: disgust

Text: One of my pupils escaped from school to the street.
Label: guilt

Text: My best friend could not get into university.
Label: sadness

Text: It was in a tramway-carriage: A stranger insulted a girl just á because she blew her nose. I detested his behaviour.
Label: disgust

Text: When my elder brother, who had gone abroad to study  for six á years, came back home safe and in good health.
Label: joy

Text: A woman picked her nose and spit right next to me.
Label: disgust

Text: I was ashamed with my biology lecturer when he asked me a á question and I could not answer it.
Label: shame

Text: When my mother betrayed me by obtaining money from my husband á when we were separated - pending divorce.
Label: disgust

Text: I like someone who does not like me and was rude to me.
Label: sadness

Text: I came home one day and discovered that my sister had borrowed my á car and had gotten into an accident with it. My entire front á bumper was destroyed.
Label: anger

Text: When my boy-friend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.
Label: shame

Text: I felt happy at the settlement of our marriage, even though we á are from different socio-linguistic backgrounds our parents á agreed to the wedding without any conflict or discussion.  We had  á thought that they would object to the wedding but it did not happen.
Label: joy

Text: Leaving home when my mother thought I had no reason to go and á felt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressed á person (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about having á given her this additonal problem.
Label: guilt

Text: Finding out that my grandfather had died. He lived in England and á I had not seen him for 10 years.
Label: sadness

Text: Having told a certain lie.
Label: guilt

Text: After having slept for a short time I woke up - I had the feeling á of someone standing beside me and was very frightened. I had to á turn on the light turn on the light for several minutes before I á was able to get to sleep again.
Label: fear

Text: I slipped and fell in to a puddle and people started looking at á me.
Label: shame

Text: This is difficult, since I don't remember feeling disgust towards á anyone.
Label: disgust

Text: [ When some people act very important in any situation.]
Label: disgust

Text: A too eager approach by a dirty drunken person in a bus.
Label: disgust

Text: A close friend of mine was leaving for graduate school out of á state. I had arranged to gather some people together the day á before he left to be with him and have a good time, but I didn't á pay as much attention to him as I should have.
Label: guilt

Text: When someone took my things without having asked for my á permission.
Label: anger

Text: When in a car accident where car was total wipe off (wipe out, or á write off).
Label: fear

Text: On my second plane trip, we ran into unexpected turbulence.
Label: fear

Text: My friend had many female friends and I thought that they were á his lovers.  I would scold him but he did not accept my advice.  á Later I learnt from his girlfriends that this was not true.  I á felt ashamed at having misunderstood him.
Label: shame

Text: When I won some coins in a small competion.
Label: joy

Text: When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste á my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological á investigation and then I got really angry.
Label: anger

Text: My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blame á bacause with her it is a stress disease.
Label: guilt

Text: When people remember us and shows interest about what we do.
Label: joy

Text: When I learned that two of my friends had had a serious car accident.
Label: sadness

Text: I was wearing a short skirt one day and someone told me my á underwear was showing.
Label: shame

Text: When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact á with my parents.
Label: sadness

Text: Talking to a close friend.
Label: joy

Text: Some time ago I was present at the wedding party of two close á friends of mine.
Label: joy

Text: My girlfriend wanted to breakup for an indefinite amt. of time. á She said that she couldn't commit herself fully to the á relationship without going out with other people. I was her first á boyfriend.
Label: sadness

Text: When I passed my Primary school leaving certificate and selected á to go to a Boarding secondary school.
Label: joy

Text: Before the department meeting my friend ate a dish that I had á prepared for this meeting.
Label: anger

Text: I once saw an old man up the road, fossicking through the rubbish á bins and the gutter. I was really disgusted at first but I've á seen him a few times since then and now I feel really sorry for á him and I often give him cigarettes when I see him, because he á mainly goes after cigarette butts and it is revolting.
Label: disgust

Text: Heard someone boasting his fortune telling and I knew he was á lying.
Label: disgust

Text: It was during a school holiday - I was found necking a girl in my á room by my father.
Label: shame

Text: The disqualification of two of my mates in the military service.
Label: sadness

Text: Not doing something I had promised.
Label: guilt

Text: During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother and á other family members crying.
Label: sadness

Text: I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after á we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it's á problems.
Label: sadness

Text: When my husband quarrelled with me for no reason at all.
Label: disgust

Text: I heard part of a conversation in which one talked very low about á women.
Label: disgust

Text: I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at á a distance of about four metres.
Label: fear

Text: When I went home alone early in the morning, I had to go through á a wood.
Label: fear

Text: My friend had written a letter to me, the contents of which I á misunderstood and I wrote back a very harsh letter to her.  On á realizing the blunder I had made, I felt like hiding my face in á the sand.
Label: guilt

Text: I was wearing a slit tight dress at a disco and it burst open.
Label: shame

Text: When I lost my father in a car accident.
Label: sadness

Text: An exam where questions about very specific knowledge were asked.
Label: shame

Text: Two days after the above incident, I was thinking about my á morally shameful act and I felt sorry for that incident, but it á was too late, however I did realize this.
Label: guilt

Text: When I did not get the salary increase that I had been expecting á and understood how little one's work was appreciated.
Label: sadness

Text: Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for á my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years á of my life.
Label: sadness

Text: When I dated a close girlfriend's boyfriend a few times. He told á me that it was over between them and I accepted it.  When she á found out she finished our friendship.
Label: shame

Text: When I do something unworthy.
Label: shame

Text: When my sister lost my favourite jumper at a party and failed to á tell me for several days after it happened.
Label: anger

Text: I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.
Label: fear

Text: When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices, á which my father also adheres.
Label: anger

Text: One day I took a packet of sweets from a certain Grocery at á Nathenje. Then later on I started to feel guilty and realised á that I had done a wrong thing to him.
Label: guilt

Text: Our Headmaster came to our hostel. The lights were off but there á was a lot of noise. We shouted at him when he knocked at our á door. We later saw that it was the Headmaster.
Label: guilt

Text: When I got really drunk on Norvegian Indipendence Day, and was á not allowed to participate in football (soccer) games for two á weeks. That was very unpleasant.
Label: shame

Text: I had just seen my pseudo-girlfriend and our conversation angered á me greatly.
Label: anger

Text: One of my very good friends came to me for advice as her á boyfriend had been hitting her and beating her quite harmfully.
Label: disgust

Text: I had a date with a boy, but I didn't feel liked, and didn't go, á I wasn't home purposely at the time we arranged.
Label: guilt

Text: I was wearing slippery shoes and I tumbled down in a place where á there were many people walking by.
Label: shame

Text: I was afraid of moving away from home and moving to Helsinki for á my studies.
Label: fear

Text: My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of á amidophen.
Label: guilt

Text: A man sexually aggressed a small girl in the bus but the girl did á not dare to speak out.
Label: disgust

Label: joy

Text: When I was walking at night, I saw fire suspended in the air and á it was split into several segments by something I could not see.  á I suspected that it was witch-craft.
Label: fear

Text: Our boarder burping after meals !
Label: disgust

Text: This person I know lied about how much income his parents made á and received money through grants which he did not need. Another á person is barely making it, did not lie, and did not receive á enough money.
Label: disgust

Text: When I decided to take a week s holiday without consulting the á family first.
Label: guilt

Text: When I read about Reagan's tactical decision concerning the á South African boycott.
Label: anger

Text: When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would miss á them.
Label: sadness

Label: sadness

Label: anger

Text: When after 10 months of national service I was \downgraded\" and á
Label: joy

Label: anger

Label: anger

Text: I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had á not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.
Label: joy

Text: When I was an evening school teacher it was my job to make the á coffee but I was not able to get the coffee ready on time and I á thus arrived half an hour late to the class.  On top of this the á coffee was undrinkable.
Label: shame

Text: When I received the news that my beloved grandmother had died.  I á was at the boarding school and was only 13 years old.
Label: sadness

Text: That my brother and father are into alcohol, two men with á priviledge. Not using it positively.
Label: shame

Text: At a friend's birthday party with some of my closest friends.  It á was all very pleasant and one could say that I was happy to have á such good friends.
Label: joy

Label: anger

Text: One evening, while going to meet a friend of mine, I had to cross á a meadow by a dark road.  There were bushes on the other side of á the road.  The weather was damp and a bit foggy.  I heard steps á behind me and kept speeding up my steps all the time.
Label: fear

Text: Not speaking to my sister-in-law due to lack of interest in a á relationship on my side.
Label: guilt

Text: I am going steady with a boy, but I had sexual intercourse with á another one, and I felt guilty about it afterwards.
Label: guilt

Text: In ward 2A there was a patient suffering from Syphilitic á Paraplegia and had pressure sores. The wounds had offensive smell á that only a few people .... the place.
Label: disgust

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: I feared that my dog's eye was infected too much. He had played á around in the weeds and a foxtail had gotten under his eyelid. I á took him to the vet and I feared that he may go blind because of á the foxtail.
Label: fear

Text: I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first steps á I took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoy á being alive.
Label: joy

Text: Two little children (5/6 years old) begging for money, and noone á gave them money.
Label: sadness

Text: Not being alowed on a school camp with the class I'd been in for á 11 years (I had stayed down due to illness)
Label: anger

Text: Jealous of my husband's old girlfriend.  We met her with her á husband and there was a lot of reminiscing.
Label: anger

Text: When my grandfather died.
Label: sadness

Label: sadness

Text: The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed, á hitch-hiking to work.

Label: joy

Label: joy

Text: I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude to men, the á way she talked and I compared her to an acquaintance of mine.  á Later, the same evening, my sister looked sad.  I felt guilty á about her sadness.
Label: guilt

Text: When my friend needed my help very much and I, at that moment, made á an end to our relationship.
Label: guilt

Text: [ Uncertainty about my own abilities in an exam.]
Label: fear

Label: guilt

Text: A few weeks back, as I was in a hurry to leave the house, I left á some of my things lying around.  This is something I never do. My á uncle,who lives with us, as we live in a joint family, remarked that á we were always doing things like  this.  This really got me mad.
Label: anger

Text: When my friend and I were discussing the good looks of a guy we á realized that he had been listening.
Label: shame

Text: Death of grandfather (unexpected).
Label: sadness

Label: fear

Text: Four weeks ago I felt very much touched to find an asciatic á patient who had asked the very morning to be tapped of the fluid, á dying in the evening. I was really disgusted because this was the á Medical staff's negligence. Had the Clinical officers done á something that very morning he might have been alive today.
Label: disgust

Label: shame

Label: disgust

Label: joy

Label: guilt

Label: joy

Label: disgust

Label: anger

Label: anger

Label: sadness

Text: I found a baby opposum on the road and took it home and cared for á it for a week. It had to be force-fed and carried in a fur pouch á under my jersey. My father had the vet put it to sleep as he said á they carried diseases.
Label: sadness

Text: [ I have always been very scared and tense before an exam and á before the declaration of the results.]

Label: disgust

Label: anger

Text: I was hitchhiking and was picked up by a stranger he drove into á the woods and wanted to make love with me, I refused and escaped á from the car. When walking in the wood and hearing the car I was á afraid.

Label: sadness

Label: guilt

Label: sadness

I felt this emotion when a neighbour of á mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very á loudly and threatened that with \connections\" she will expel me á
Label: disgust

Label: joy

Label: guilt

Label: guilt

Label: disgust

Label: fear

Label: sadness

Label: joy

Label: disgust

Text: I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.
Label: shame

Text: When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.
Label: anger

Text: When I lied last week. I lied to someone to get info. for a á paper I was writing. I told her that the info. was for a á newspaper article. I was afraid if I told the truth she wouldn't á help me.

Text: My mother died of cancer after a 4 year illness - I think the á most pregnant moment of sadness was the next morning, just as the á sun rose.

Label: guilt

Label: guilt

Text: I feel ashamed when I am praised.

Label: shame

Text: The first time that I \played with myself\" despite being a á
Label: guilt

Text: While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a á woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property - á via a flooded river !

Label: joy

Label: joy

Label: disgust

Text: My father caught me having sexual intercourse with my closest á cousin.  There was nothing wrong with it but the female was too á old for me.
Label: guilt

Text: My brother and I were at home watching a TV program when I á started to tease  him and in this joke I hurt him without á knowing the seriousness of it I went on. He got angry and gave it á back to me. At this moment I felt anger at him but knowing that á it was my fault.
Label: guilt

Text: Once I was caught by thugs aged between 20-35, they asked me to á surrender all the property I had and I remember feeling very scared.
Label: fear

Text: When I realized that I was directing the feelings of discontent á with myself at my partner and this way was trying to put the blame á on him instead of sorting out my own feeliings.
Label: shame

Text: An argument that grew out of an ordinary conversation with a á person very close to me, when we should have been having a good á time together.
Label: shame

Text: I saw a neighbour, from the same appartment block as me, lying    á on the road.  He could have been injured or ill.  I kept 20 á metres away and did not go to help him.
Label: guilt

Text: One time I felt guilty when I told one of my previous boyfriends á we were through just because I never felt like having one at that á particular time.
Label: guilt

Text: [ When mix was coming from column for several days.]
Label: disgust

Text: My parents failed to visit me as they promised.
Label: sadness

Text: Ever since I have been a child, the sight of any kind of wound.
Label: disgust

Text: I feel shy to show all my worth when I work for the first time á with a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.
Label: shame

Text: I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way. á My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slapped á my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.
Label: guilt

Text: Once late at night (around midnight) a person asked me to give á him a lift. He suddenly tried to attack me but I could escape. á After this he followed me for a little while.
Label: fear

Text: By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt á her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.
Label: guilt

Text: I stole 5c from my mother's purse for a choo-choo bar - I was 6.
Label: guilt

Text: When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of á mine.
Label: disgust

Text: I was driving my parents' car into a carpark in front of a shop á we own, and scraped the corner of the front panel on the back á corner of my father's utility. I didn't tell anyone, I lied about á the bump (later I had to confess).
Label: guilt

Text: I was disgusted with the behaviour of one of my fellow students á during my Secondary School life. He was a habitual noise-maker á and caused great conflicts with the teachers.
Label: disgust

Text: One time at the hospital I passed near the intensive care room. á The offensive smell that came out disgusted me in such a way that á I didn't even dare to enter the room.
Label: disgust

Text: My younger brother and I had been fighting over the TV/Video. He á kept on turning it on and off every 2 seconds and was not á listening to my authority and was being cheeky. We fought and I á ended up in tears - he'd won.
Label: anger

Text: When a close friend failed to live up to the expectations I had á of him - thereby causing pain to his spouse. I believe that my á anger was probably a reaction of fear that I wouldn't be able to á live up to my own expectations.
Label: anger

Text: It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy a á present together. However, now I had bought something together á with my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.
Label: guilt

Text: I wanted to take something from under my bed. While doing this I á felt a dead bird laying under my bed.
Label: disgust

Text: When my dog died.
Label: sadness

Text: Cueing for bath for a long time.
Label: disgust

Text: In some special circumstances l lied to my parents, then felt á guilty so I told them the truth and felt free.
Label: guilt

Text: When five of my friends at the secondary school found out the bad á things that I had been saying about them.
Label: shame

Text: Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every á school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left á each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now á I remember about it quite often.
Label: sadness

Text: Almost crashing my car, something which could have led to great á problems.
Label: fear

Text: When one of my closest friends died unexpectantly.
Label: sadness

Text: I was emotionally happy when I was in love with the girl I had á longed for.
Label: joy

Text: I live with my sister now and sometimes she angers me especially á when she thinks I don't keep the apt. clean enough.
Label: anger

Text: When I promised to visit my boyfriend and I didn't fulfil the á promise.
Label: guilt

Text: I once stole my father's money and denied having done it. Instead á father threatened my young brother and he was beaten. He was á innocent and I felt guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: Participating in a theft several years ago.
Label: shame

Text: I stole carrots and got caught.  I had to apologize to the owner.
Label: guilt

Text: I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark, I went very á fast. Behind me, there were some drunk men who shouted at me. By á chance, I met some friends who accompanied me.
Label: fear

Text: Before the certificate examination I was very poor in Biology á (the worst result in my class).  Ever since F.5 it had been á getting poorer and poorer.  I had tried my best and had spent á most of my time studying this subject.  Finally my results were á so bad that I thought that it was just not fair.
Label: anger

Text: When I \passed out\" a female friend of mine for no apparent á
Label: guilt

Text: My cousins were playing at home and one of them broke a decorative á object which was very precious to me.
Label: anger

Text: I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and á threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money. á  I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.
Label: fear

Text: I was travelling in the South of Brasil, near the end of the á year. I was well settled with 3 friends. At the evening of 31 M., á somebody, also with us, took from his purse pints of all colours, á and the 4 of us, and other friends, that were at the same beach, á painted each other and we went to the beach with champagne.
Label: joy

Text: I encouraged my brother to play football and he was hurt while á playing the game.
Label: guilt

Text: When I hurt my parents in one way or another.
Label: guilt

Text: When I came to know that my grandmother had died.  She was very á close to me.
Label: sadness

Text: I get angry with people who attain certain status without á deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of á other people.
Label: anger

Text: Found money on the road and returned it to the owner through á police.
Label: joy

Text: China cannot give your lectures bigger place and sound system.
Label: shame

Text: Receiving a very personal letter from a lady that I like, which á revealed that she was more enthusiastic about me than I had á thought possible.
Label: joy

Text: Hurt someone's feelings unintentionally.
Label: guilt

Text: I was hunting, and was lost in the fog in the mountains.
Label: fear

Text: Before I moved away from home, I feared leaving.
Label: fear

Text: When there was a fight at home and my father threatened to throw á a chair on my brother.
Label: fear

Text: When my sister took something that belonged to me without my á permission.

Text: I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day á in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold á for half an hour.
Label: guilt

Text: Before an exam in logics.
Label: fear

Text: Waking in morning (early morning) and having whole day to myself.
Label: joy

Text: In my opinion guilt is a feeling which goes together with shame. á Here then I refer to the situation of guilt.
Label: shame

Text: Disgust at a girl I know for continually feeling sorry for herself á and never acting positively to do something about her problems.
Label: disgust

Text: During a holiday in East-Germany I got aquainted with a boy who á lived there. We started writing, but I only wrote once. I felt á ashamed because I probably was one of his sparse contacts with á western Europe.
Label: guilt

Text: I was making very strong statements about infidelity in couples. á Then I discovered that one of my best friends, who had just been through á a very sad case of mutual infidelity, was listening.
Label: shame

Text: In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came to á wake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at the á highest volume into my room - it was the morning service at its á loudest.
Label: anger

Text: The birth of my child.
Label: joy

Text: When my grandmother was about 80 years old, she lived with us for á several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breath á the air that smelled of her presence.
Label: disgust

Text: I broke an egg, with which there was something wrong, into a á little cup. There was a thick white \wad\" in it. I tried to take á
Label: disgust

Text: The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for á a B.A at UNZA.  I felt happy because I had not expected to be á selected.
Label: joy

Text: Saw a mate bribing the leader.
Label: disgust

Text: I had a very good friend in secondary school.  The year after our á graduation I prepared to celebrate her birthday and I called off á all my appointments.  I got together the other friends and we á were ready to give the entire day to her.  However this friend á disappeared on her birthday.  When I phoned another friend I á didcovered thay she was busy, I did not call her anymore.
Label: anger

Text: At the pre-university, I was appreciated as an examplary á student by our pricipal.  This is something which made me feel á very happy.
Label: joy

Text: When I got my B.A degree with first class.
Label: joy

Text: Last year I was asked to look after my niece while her mother was á cooking.  Unfortunately the kid fell off the bed, I was confident á that she would not fall and had not been paying much attention.
Label: guilt

Text: Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My á life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it á disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.
Label: shame

Text: When my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked for á hours. She was in a good mood.
Label: joy

Text: I was angry at my brother over an argument we had together.  We á do have a few fights from time to time, and also at times I take á out my anger on him.
Label: anger

Text: When I caused needless anxiety to a person close to me because of á my lack of self-insight.
Label: guilt

Text: The same as in SHAME.
Label: disgust

Text: When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of á Zambia.

Text: I felt guilty when once I made my mother angry.
Label: guilt

Text: I was working in a job in which I could not work quickly enough, á and was told that my work was not up to standard.
Label: shame

Text: Being involved in a car accident and having my thumb caught in á the glove compartment. My sister and I had a Fear of finally á telling my parents, since my sister was the driver.
Label: fear

Text: The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sitting á on a boy's lap.  I tried to greet her but could not help á blushing.
Label: shame

Text: Not getting an airplane ticket fot my mother.
Label: guilt

Text: When I met another person I began to go out with him, and my á boyfriend (with marriage accorded) met us together he did a great á scandal, he broke the engagement and I began to go out with the á other, and it didn't work because my mind was all mixed up.
Label: guilt

Text: I was once raped (one year ago) by a man who was a lot older than á me and whom I just met. Maybe it wasn't rape but the man wanted á more than I wanted to give him since there were other people in á vicinity.
Label: disgust

Text: When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't take á him out to ride his byke, because I am tired.
Label: guilt

Text: I was driving along and saw this young guy urinating into the á gutter, in broad daylight.
Label: disgust

Text: At a choral concert I appeared as a solist. The concert5 was very á good, I forgot all the hard work that had been done before. There á remained only an undescribable joy and a feeling of warmth, á security etc.
Label: joy

Text: It happens to me quite often. I can't describe a particular case.
Label: guilt

Text: My mother was ill and asked me to prpare our lunch. I went to do it, á and while I was working, she stayed behind me telling what I á had, or not to do. I asked her to stop meddling, and to go to á bed. When I went to ask for help to my sister, my mother said that á I was proud, that I asked for help only when I wanted and that I á wasn't able to cook by myself.
Label: anger

Text: My Uncle was beaten by his troublesome son. He fell unconscious á and gained consciousness after some time. That time I was at á school; this news reached me through someone.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was selected to start Form I at Chilumba Secondary School á out of the 100 pupils I was among the 4 who were successful. á Family History showed that I had done better than all my brothers á who had passed after repeating for several times.
Label: joy

Text: My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all á very worried but it was successful.
Label: joy

Text: Parents finding out I smoked.
Label: shame

Text: When I failed my first biochemistry test.
Label: disgust

Text: When I try to lie.
Label: shame

Text: Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial á \explanation\"."
Label: sadness

Label: disgust

Text: Discussing psychology with my friends before the lecture.
Label: joy

Text: Staying alone in the dark.
Label: fear

Text: When I was face to face with my deceived friend after sleeping á with his wife.
Label: guilt

Text: An unjust refree decision at a sports event when I was the team á leader.
Label: anger

Label: joy

Text: When my mother died.
Label: sadness

Text: I had to unscrew something on my car. I didn't succeed after two á afternoons of trying. A feeling of anger built up itself.
Label: anger

Text: My brother came to see me and found me with a boy friend.  When á my boyfriend greeted him, he did not answer and instead started á shouting at me and scolding me in the prescence of my boyfriend.
Label: shame

Text: I stayed alone in the dark at night in the mountain, waiting for á my uncle.  I remember that I took a big stone and it calmed me.
Label: fear

Text: I \picked up\" a girl and I thought that I had misused my á
Label: guilt

Text: When I was in my village one of my enemies had written a á non-sense letter to a girl and he told the father of this girl á that I was the culprit.  When I got to know this I was scared as  á the girl's father was a worse man.
Label: fear

Text: The fact that I was pregnant. I was always considered level á headed and did not have sex until 18 and out of high school.
Label: shame

Text: Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this is á something I just can not tolerate.
Label: disgust

Text: When a girl that I liked didn't accept my curting.
Label: disgust

Text: My friend was so intoxicated that the police came and took him á away, and they later contacted his parents.

Text: If a close relative's life is in danger.
Label: fear

Text: Someone frightened me in the dark.
Label: fear

Text: I worked with several classmates on a project.  I was very á anxious about the project while my partners showed no concern  á and when we had meetings on the project my classmates  did not á pay any attention.  Some of them read books while the others á argued on irrelevant questions.  The meeting would go on for two á hours without the main theme being discussed.  We wasted time and á could not reach a compromise.  My classmates avoided doing the á work and the responsibilities, they seemed to value other á projects more than this one.
Label: anger

Text: Car accident. I let a 16-year old, incompetent parson take the á wheel and I feel very guilty about what happened even though I á suffered the worst injuries.
Label: guilt

Text: I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased á to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had á misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that á it was done by a \good\" acquaintance of mine."
Label: anger

Text: I found a human \treasure\" that I desired and got immediately. I á
Label: joy

Text: Some noisy guests arrived at the hotel.  I had been slightly á irritated earlier.  At night when I was trying to sleep they were á having a party so I went and yelled at them.  I wanted to sleep á as I had to get up early the next day.
Label: anger

Text: This condition accumulated in my mind when funeral news was á brought to my awareness, that a close relative had passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: After a party I spent the night with a friend. We both were á drunk, the morning was disillusioning. A friend was me leaving á the room and I felt shabby and immoral.
Label: shame

Text: I was sitting at a rock concert, listening to an extremely loud á band. A tiny baby in a crawler had been left by his young mother, á right out in the sun next to a speaker, and was screaming - á probably in pain.
Label: disgust

Text: When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard á gunshots.
Label: fear

Text: On one occasion whilst engaging in horseplay with my girlfriend, á I caused her to be physically harmed.
Label: shame

Text: One day I had sunned my favourite shirt and was putting it back á in the wardrobe when my younger brother snatched it from me and á wore it.  He had not had a bath and was very dirty.  I scolded him á but he answered back and locked himself up in a room.  I was very á angry so I starteed kicking on the door and abusing him loudly á and freely.
Label: anger

Text: Having a good trip on a boat with good friends.
Label: joy

Text: I felt anger of a friend when she met \a date\" and become nervous á
Label: anger

Label: guilt

Label: fear

Text: I was drunk one night and I insulted three ladies.  The following á morning they approached me and asked me the reason behind my á bahaviour, I apologized for my unruly behaviour.
Label: guilt

Text: Returning to school and rejoining my girlfriend after 3 months of á separation from summer.
Label: joy

Text: When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the á stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his á friends. They could not think about anything sensible, but would á fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of á other persons.á
Label: anger

Text: While dancing in a restaurant last week.
Label: joy

Text: When I failed an exam.
Label: sadness

Text: Nothing.
Label: disgust

Label: fear

Text: When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away á instantly.  He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to á wait at his home so that I could see his new car.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very á good and we were very satisfied.
Label: joy

Text: Once when I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I á would win , but at last I lost the game.
Label: anger

Text: One day my elder brother badly scolded my father.  This was the á first time that I heard such abusive language from my brother.  I á requested him humbly not to use this kind of language but he did á not care for what I was saying.  Finally I picked up an axe to use á against him, in the meanwhile people intervened.
Label: anger

Text: When someone lies to me.
Label: anger

Text: That I didn't want my friend to leave on holiday for 10 days á because I thought I would miss him. I was constantly trying to á persuade him.
Label: guilt

Text: I am ashamed of the way my father behaves with my mother and á sister, and with me too.
Label: shame

Text: I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely á partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and á anger.
Label: anger

Text: When for the first and the last time I tried to crib and the á teacher was with her back to me but right when I was taking the á materials out she turned round and saw me.
Label: shame

Text: When my brother was held up and robbed.
Label: anger

Text: A friend breaking up with her boyfriend.
Label: sadness

Text: When I complained to my mother about how untidy the kitchen á loooked, she boxed my ears ( this had never happened before).
Label: shame

Text: Having my luggage checked at Customs.
Label: fear

Text: Facing the possibility of having a child when it wasn't either á desired or permitted.
Label: guilt

Text: When I had to walk over three kms through a field which had wild bulls, á because my car had broken down.
Label: fear

Text: I watched a very terrfying film in LT2.  This film really pushed á my heart out of my body and I was forced to go out before the á second reel ended.
Label: fear

Text: When I heard about the way a parent of a friend had mistreated á him, and caused a great instability.
Label: disgust

Text: A friend of mine lent me his apartment for holidays and besides á this he was a fine person. Months later I knew that he died á tragically in a moto accident. He was very young, and I felt sad á and couldn't believe it (until today).
Label: sadness

Text: When I have suffered a terrible fit of eating, that frequently á occurs. Then I eat everything, I act like a glutton I eat big á amounts of food, sometimes even half a loaf.
Label: shame

Text: When I passed successive exams to enter the school of medicine.
Label: joy

Text: Meddlesomeness of my mother about the way I live. She thinks I am á to free in my behavior for instance when a boyfriend stays the á night.
Label: anger

Text: I had been searching for housing for Fall at UCB and I was á finally offered a place - then an ordeal followed, first I á accepted then refused - related to my parents judgment (they're á paying for me). Turns out that I was so upset at what my Dad said á to me that I hung up on him. He called back and threatened to cut á me off financially and emotionally.
Label: anger

Text: When climbing up the stairs to the top of a ski-jumping hill.
Label: fear

Text: At a certain person's lack of cleanliness, at home and á personally.
Label: disgust

Text: I cannot remember a situation in which I felt ashamed. I was á eating with some people and a little boy I took care of. I warned á him often not to knock down his glass of mild. When I took á out his chair I knocked down my own glass.
Label: shame

Text: A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not á as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She á implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time, á and taking 3 University exams part time).
Label: anger

Text: When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination and á I realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.
Label: joy

Text: When I hadn't studied for an exam, so I pretended to be sick so I á wouldn't have to go to school. I lied to my mother - she realized á I had been lying when she got home from work and found that I had á been over to a friend's place.
Label: shame

Text: When a student accused me of having stolen his textbook  as he á had found a form bearing my name in his other books and all my á explanations fell on deaf ears.
Label: disgust

Text: When a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.  I á was stopped from punching him for it.
Label: anger

Text: When we received  our academic result I learnt that my  results á were bad as I had not done my best.  The results of my á accquaintances were good and when they asked me about my results á I really did not want to answer.
Label: shame

Text: I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied a á policy of strict positive - negative reinforcement to the á children involved. Children who measured up to his standards were á made a fuss of - children who didn't were ignored.
Label: anger

Text: Failed to be elected to be a class leader.
Label: anger

Text: Getting a part-time job.
Label: joy

Text: My father who is very quiet discovered I was going out with a á coloured boy. He called me names and was really upset.
Label: shame

Text: When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide á how she hated herself for not having the will power to get out of á such a situation because it was convenient, according to what she á told me.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt guilty when I said bad things to my sister, I had not á intended to do so.  She cried a lot and later she fell ill and I á felt responsible for her illness.
Label: guilt

Text: When my mother scolded me for something, very insignificant, without á knowing the real cause of what had happened.
Label: sadness

Text: It was discovered that I had received a warning letter as my á G.P.A was very low.
Label: shame

Text: I had an interview for entry into college. The results were to be á announced on radio. After a long period of waiting the results á were released. I had succeded - tension was relieved by joy.

Text: During the lesson the teacher called me and asked me if I had á reported that I was late.  I pretended that I had but looking at á her eyes I knew that she knew that I was lying.  I thought that á it was really bad luck that she had examined the list of the á students who were late.
Label: shame

Text: To buy a car and didn't like the business and the car.
Label: sadness

Text: When my father told me that I should help my mother more often, á because she was so busy. And I realized that he was right.
Label: guilt

Text: Waiting for a bus not coming for a long time, and the bus drivers á were having a long lunch.
Label: disgust

Text: I may not be clever enough to understand your English lectures.
Label: fear

Text: Climbing a mountain, I got stuck and realized I could get neither á up nor down.
Label: fear

Text: Some days ago I fell down at a public place, I came into notice á but thank God I was not mocked at. Though it hurt badly, at the á first moment I felt shame, not ache.
Label: shame

Text: When a good friend of mine behaved in a very cool manner to me á for a very long time.
Label: fear

Text: A close friend died.
Label: sadness

Text: My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and á saw the scene and became angry.
Label: anger

Text: I was the reason behind the break-up of my friend's relationship á with his girlfriend.  She finished with him.
Label: guilt

Text: Can't remember exact example.

Label: anger

Text: When my father died I felt myself alone and the fear possessed me. á I was a child and all my sisters and brothers (8) were young.
Label: fear

Text: When they denied a job to a person that I propsed giving political á reasons that has nothing to do directly with the professional á level.
Label: anger

Text: I am a kindergarten teacher and I am thoroughly weary of my job.  á After having taken the university entrance exam I suffered from á anxiety for weeks as I did not want to carry on with my work - studies á were the only alternative.
Label: fear

Text: I am left-handed. When I attended the first form, we learned to á write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my á friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was á looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: [ No response.]
Label: disgust

Text: In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told á the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him á that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard á that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.
Label: shame

Text: At a party my best girlfriend got really drunk and went off with á a guy she knows I really like.
Label: disgust

Text: After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.
Label: shame

Text: When I inadvertantly entered the ladies room and met some girls á on my way out.
Label: shame

Text: Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna, three drunk á men thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene from á another carriage.

Text: As a child - accidentally stepping on a pet guinea-pig - it á dying.

Label: disgust

Text: My father is someone I disgust. So when he comes close to me á a feeling of disgust overwhelms me. When I stay a week-end at my á parent's place I will remember it for long time.
Label: disgust

Text: It was about midnight and I wanted to go to the countryside (I á was in town) to watch the stars in the sky.  My mother did not á like this, in spite of it I went out for a while.  My mother got á angry.

Text: When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend, she told me á she passed the examinations and that she had been admitted to the á study for speech therapy.

Text: I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to á leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole á new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and á traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I á wouldn't see many of them again.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was an auxiliary nurse at the hospital and I had to change á the nappies, for the first time, of a very old and sick woman.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt sad when I was told to walk out of the classroom because I á was within the row of students who were making noise.

Label: anger

Text: When I used to tell Mum I was going somewhere else than where I á was (going).
Label: guilt

Text: I was driving a friend's car, and I got close to the pavement to á ask my way and I struck a parked car.
Label: guilt

Text: [ The previous incident holds good here also.]
Label: disgust

Label: sadness

Text: On a road trip with a group of sorority and fraternity people, I á became intoxicated and basically raped. I don't remember the á actual event, but I know the feeling that I experienced later.

Text: The only guilt I considered reasonable was my reproval at the end á of the semester at the University.

Text: It is some years ago when my mother found me stealing relish in á the pot. It was fresh fish which was very appetising.

Text: [ Whenever I put myself in other's shoes and try to make the á person happy, comfort him or make friends and I am misunderstood á and rejected, especially when this person is a family member or a friend.]
Label: anger

Text: When I was in the sauna bath.
Label: joy

Text: Criticizing my mother when she refused to drive with the radio on. á I told her that I thought she wasn't intelligent enough to cope á with the radio.

Text: After a big fight with my parents.
Label: shame

Text: When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refused á because I wanted to go out with another guy.  I did go out and my á boyfriend found out.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was 5, a few of my friends and I would light matches for á fun. One of my friends confessed to her parents and my parents, I á guess, knew or suspected I was involved but I said I knew á nothing about it.
Label: guilt

Text: I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine á for my fiancT. But he stayed in another town and spent one á thousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.
Label: anger

Text: When a girlfriend left me.
Label: sadness

Text: Not being able to spend more time with a friend who was visiting á me.
Label: guilt

Text: I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, my á coevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreign á friends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then we á roused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I á didn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.
Label: shame

Text: I saw in a movie a block on which affluence and poverty existed. á I saw that the rich made no attempts to help the poor.
Label: anger

Text: Being sexually assulted and told my friends about it (we cried á together).
Label: sadness

Text: I got angry at my mother for something trivial.  We were in a á bad mood because my father was very ill and I knew that my mother á really needed support.  I had reacted wrongly.
Label: guilt

Text: China can not even give you good sound systems for an open á lecture.
Label: sadness

Text: [ No response.]
Label: fear

Text: My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we á had to get separated again.
Label: sadness

Text: I had had a farewell party at the place where I had been working á for a year.  That night I could not fall off to sleep.  I was sad á thinking that I would not see my nice fellow workers again.
Label: sadness

Text: I had a little cat which was very sick. As I liked it very much I á went to a veterinary with it. He told me how to tend it and it á really recovered its health. Everybody said that I had saved its á life.
Label: joy

Text: Observation of people lost in the profit motive - i.e. business á managers to their actions esp.
Label: disgust

Text: A close friend decided to stop with his study and to go back á home.
Label: sadness

Text: I experienced shame when I failed to keep a promise to meet my á friend at the bus depot. He later came and asked me why I had not á turned up.
Label: shame

Text: [ On days when I feel close to my partner and other friends.  á When I feel at peace with myself and also experience a close á contact with people whom I regard greatly.]
Label: joy

Label: joy

Label: guilt

Text: I was rushing home from school because there was a 49er game that á night. I got into a non-injury accident, which was all my fault, á but destroyed the front of my car. The truck I hit was undamaged.
Label: anger

Text: When I heard the bad news about the death of a close person.

Label: sadness

Text: When I started a relation with a girl, with whom I have fallen in á love already some time ago.
Label: joy

Text: I visited a place in Morocco where they worked the leather.  I á saw the skins emerged in a liquid which ressembled putrification.
Label: disgust

Text: [ When I feel that I have made a mistake.]
Label: sadness

Label: fear

Label: guilt

Label: sadness

Text: At our Senior dinner - separated from school friends, nothing á will ever be the same again.
Label: sadness

Label: anger

Label: fear

Text: Gave the wrong meal tickets to other people (my classmate).
Label: guilt

Label: anger

Text: I escaped from communicating with God for a long time.  I did not á read the scriptures and I did not pray.  I felt that I was á getting further and further away from God.  I felt guilty as this á was because of my laziness.
Label: guilt

Label: joy

Label: shame

Label: shame

Label: anger

Text: I failed to keep a promise and this had a serious effet on someone's á problem.

Text: Once while crossing a road I was overcome with fear.
Label: fear

Text: When I refused to fetch water for my aunty while she was busy.
Label: shame

Text: I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well á prepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and I á couldn't answer.
Label: shame

Text: In the real sense of the word I experienced fear in my first á months in the army. During my first night of duty. The cause for á all this was a bear. I became panic sticken (may be for the first á time) and even forgot that I had a gun.
Label: fear

Text: I used to have two boyfriends in the past. Then one of them á wanted to get engaged to me. I agreed but was guilt-conscious for á disappointing the other one.
Label: guilt

Text: I had been away from home for a long time and when I came home I á was delighted.  It was wonderful to see familiar, dear people and á I was rejoycing in advance.  I had been feeling very lonely.
Label: joy

Text: One night a very dear person said: \I hate you\". Of course it was á
Label: sadness
