Label: joy

Text: At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was á prevented from participating in several activities.
Label: shame

Text: Saw someone messing up our room.
Label: disgust

Text: I feel sadness when I only imagine that I could lose a close á person. Some time ago I lost a man whom aI greatly respected.
Label: sadness

Text: When a discussion resulted in an insult, which in my opinion, was á not justified.
Label: anger

Text: This was the worst incident of my hostel life.  I was insulted by á a close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totally á spoiled my New year's night.
Label: anger

Text: On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years) á cigarettes.
Label: disgust

Text: Did not finish homework.
Label: shame

Text: I quarreled with my boy-friend. He said it was unfair that I á always started crying so that he had to give in.
Label: guilt

Text: Insulted by somebody.
Label: shame

Label: joy

Text: Some students trying to please the lecturer.
Label: disgust

Text: One evening, in the tramway, I was afraid of two drunk men á molesting my girlfriend and me.
Label: fear

Text: When it became clear that a man had used many people sexually á and psychologically, despite the fact that many people looked up á to him.  I understood that one could not trust him and I was á forced to hide this for a while.
Label: anger

Text: At night when I was alone at home (all the family members usually á get together at that time) someone knocked vigorously on the á door.
Label: fear

Text: When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years, á had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been á quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes á me feel really sad.
Label: sadness

Text: Friends who torture animals.
Label: disgust

Text: I am not good enough to join any team to play sport for the á class.
Label: guilt

Text: It was on 9th January 1983 when I received a message from home á telling me that my father passed away on the previous day with a á history of cancer of the oesophagus. This time I was doing my á third year of my Secondary School.
Label: sadness

Text: A murder.
Label: anger

Text: On New Year's Eve I went in a disco with friends. I amused myself á and got to know many other people.
Label: joy

Text: When I received the best actor award at the inter-college drama á competition.  It gave me tremendous joy and satisfaction which á lasted for several days.
Label: joy

Text: I was very angry with a girlfriend for interferring a little too á much with my personal affairs. I told her so rather strongly and á she started crying.
Label: guilt

Text: Winning a race that I had been training for, for many weeks. á (Running Race).
Label: joy

Text: When my friend ended up pregnant by a gentleman whom I considered á to be good and faithful but he ended up neglecting her and not á bothering about her.
Label: guilt

Text: My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the most á expensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drove á home and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her state á and her actions.
Label: disgust

Text: A parking fine.
Label: guilt

Text: I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.
Label: anger

Text: I read a newspaper article about dogs being stolen in order to á use them for fighting purposes.
Label: disgust

Text: When one of my parents insinuates something about the other á (they are divorced).
Label: guilt

Text: I never failed my examinations since Standard 1 but I experienced á sad moments when I sat for Standard 8 Examination and I was not á selected for Secondary School education in 1978.
Label: sadness

Label: anger

Text: Once when I was babysitting for some neighbors children I found á roaches in ther bathroom. I had never seen a roach before but I á called my mother to make sure that's what they were. And she came á over and checked.
Label: disgust

Text: I was angry about several drivers who showed an aggressive and á dangerous driving habit.
Label: anger

Text: I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents and á education.  I said something and then realized that I did not á know my friend's parents, their motives and education.  I felt á ashamed at having talked about something I did not know anything á about.
Label: shame

Text: I planned to travel a distance of 20 kilometres on my bike. I á planned this when I was working in the hospital. When I went to á the house I found that a friend had taken my bike without my á consent.
Label: anger

Text: In a public swimming hall I saw a very aggressive man who á practically attacked the children who got in his way when he was á swimming.
Label: disgust

Text: Car accident in the middle of the night.

Label: sadness

Text: When I heard about the death of my aunt.
Label: sadness

Label: anger

Text: My nephew's mother just left one day (my brother and she were á not married). My nephew, Anthony, was shaken. I was sad for him á because a similar situation happened to me.
Label: sadness

Text: When I get home late my father scolds me and this makes me angry.
Label: anger

Text: I remember that once, a friend did not co-operate with me due to á some unavoidable reasons.  Unaware of this I treated her unjustly á till I realized everything, and then I felt ashamad of my deeds.
Label: shame

Text: A friend came for dinner with me at home. His parents are á ordinary people. My mother, however, used the very expensive á porcelain dinner-service and the silver cutlery. I felt very á ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: 4 years ago my family decided to move from New York to á California. From the time we decided to move until the time we á left, I realized how much my friends cared for me. When we left á and for a long time after that I was very sad.
Label: sadness

Text: Before the examn.
Label: fear

Text: Once, my friend and I went to the Tai 60 to cycle.  My mother had á told me not to go.  Unfortunately I broke my pectoral girdle and á had to go to hospital.  When my mother  came to see me I felt á guilty as I had not listened to her and I had to soon sit for a á public examination.
Label: guilt

Text: Reading a letter from a close friend who said he missed me and á cared for me.
Label: joy

Text: I couldn't fulfill a request of a girlfriend of mine, though I á categorically promised her and I believed there wouldn't be any á hindrance. It was partly for objective reasons but also because á I couldn't organize myself.
Label: guilt

Label: disgust

Label: disgust

Label: sadness

Text: When someone ignores what I am saying or doesn't let me have my á point of view and they monopolise a conversation.
Label: anger

Label: guilt

Label: disgust

Text: I felt it when I saw a colleague of mine eating like a beast. At á the same time he was making gestures, speaking and making the á hell of a noise.
Label: disgust

Text: There was an earthquake for several minutes and I was on the á eight floor.

Label: guilt

Label: sadness

Label: sadness

Label: fear

Text: When I cancelled an appointment with an idle story. Afterwards á it appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reserved á time for it.
Label: guilt

Text: When I am walking on the streets and see a gang of thugs.

Label: shame

Text: When I had broken a piece of glass of the refrigerator by putting á a hot pan in it.
Label: guilt

Label: sadness

Label: disgust

Text: My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell á me if they were visiting me or not.

Label: fear

Text: I was disgusted when my little sister had been hit badly by her á friends.
Label: disgust

Label: shame

Text: [ Depressions.]
Label: sadness

Label: anger

Label: sadness

Label: shame

Label: disgust

Text: I did not quite succeed in breast feeding my baby.
Label: sadness

Text: Some boys deliberately played tricks on me in the experiments.

Label: guilt

Text: An hour before receiving the certificate results I was very á frightened.  When I saw others crying I felt very tense and as á time went by my fear grew.
Label: fear

Label: guilt

Label: shame

Text: In an important situation for me, my father behaved inadequately.
Label: shame

Label: joy

Text: When I noticed that my little sister was sulking, because I could á not meet her because of a misunderstanding.
Label: guilt

Text: When I didn't bring my girlfriend home one night. Later she told á me that a cardriver solicited her.
Label: guilt

Text: When I failed the twelveth standard exams I was ashamed at á having to see my parents later.

Label: guilt

Text: A few weeks back my daughter had very high fever and I was scared á that it might lead to brain damage or convulsions.
Label: fear

Text: I was alone at home and I could hear odd noises coming from above á our bedroom.  I knew that nobody lived there since it was an á office.  I got frightened (later I was given a \natural\" á
Label: fear

Label: sadness

Label: disgust

Text: When I offended my parents without wanting it.
Label: guilt

Text: When I made the acquaintance of a certain person.
Label: joy

Text: Sitting alone in a quiet room concentrating on things happening á around me which pleases me.

Label: joy

Text: I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parking á place, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncoming á traffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placed á his car on the place.
Label: anger

Text: I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy.  He was á probably an imposter.
Label: disgust

Text: My mother always evokes feelings of guilt in me. For instance á when I miss the last bus I know she will be concerned for me and á stay awake till I arrive.
Label: guilt

Label: sadness

Text: I promised a friend that I would return a book to it's owner for á him , but I forgot to do it.
Label: shame

Text: When someone whom I trusted, disappointed me terribly.
Label: disgust

Text: I took Pharmacology books from my friend's desk without á permission and I was found guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: The day I learnt that my girlfriend had been going around with  a á close friend of mine.
Label: shame

Text: A whole crowd of us went to a folklore festival. The instructor á of the cast where my boyfriend played was traveling with us. We á decided to catch the train that leaved early in the morning á because we had business on the following day. The instructor á tried to get the upper hand and made us catch the train in spite á of everything, all the time he made me angry.
Label: anger

Text: I was dishonest to my boyfriend concerning something that is á important to our relationship.
Label: shame

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: When my brother got very low marks in the exams, I was very angry. á I put my studies aside to help him, as every time my brother does  á badly at school, my family members blame me as well.á á
Label: anger

Label: joy

Text: After I had made my debut at Ullevi against IFK, Gottenburg and á got a good write up in the paper.
Label: joy

Text: I took some money from my parent's house without asking them for á it, and I was caught red handed.
Label: guilt

Text: When my husband and I spent a night by ourselves in a house which á was in an area on the outskirts of a large town with which we were  á not familiar.  We  heard strange noises outside the house and the  á house had glass walls so the whole thing was even more á frightening.
Label: fear

Text: I had some sort of a stomach virus last week and  I vomited in á college in the morning, then in the cake shop, three times during á the trip home and again when I got home.
Label: disgust

Text: I had promised to help out with domestic chores and I forgot á about it.
Label: shame

Text: I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to á find out and I had to tell her I had lied.
Label: guilt

Text: I had received bad news informing me that grandmother and á grandfather had passed away. The first one to die was my á grandmother and after two days grandfather died too.
Label: sadness

Text: Earth crake.
Label: fear

Text: I had a dream : I had a very close friend who had several stone á houses in the New Territories (villages) but they did not have á much furniture.  He took me to see his fields (I had never seen á them before) and there were several inches of clear water on á which the sunshine was reflected.  I wanted to sit among the á short green plants in the fields but was afraid of treading the á plants to death.  My friend said \They will not die\" and I sat á
Label: joy

Text: I was living in a flat where things did not go very well for me.  á Finally, they threw me out and this prejudiced people I esteem a á lot.
Label: anger

Text: I stayed for several weeks with a friend of mine before she moved á to live with her husband. One evening he came drunk and made an á awful scene, which I still remember.
Label: disgust

Text: I had found out that I was pregnant. I talked it over with my á boyfriend and he was unsupportive - yet encouraged an abortion - á I did.
Label: guilt

Text: I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with á whom I had previously discussed the assignment.
Label: anger

Text: The holidays come to an end, and the next day we had to go back á to University and to the exams.
Label: sadness

Text: When it appeared that I was not pregnant when I was several weeks á overtime.
Label: joy

Text: When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film á marathon I wanted to see.
Label: joy

Text: Cleaning the bathroom of my apt. and realizing my roommate who á had lived there all summer by himself had never cleaned the á place.
Label: disgust

Text: At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered; á blood was dripping on the floor.
Label: disgust

Text: The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.
Label: fear

Text: At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality is á not treated decently.
Label: anger

Text: Almost had a bicycle accident.
Label: fear

Text: We hitch hiked our way back from a town rather drunk.  We were á dropped in another town which was unknown to us.  I needed to á urinate, so I did it on a wall which turned out to belong to the á military headquarters.  They arrested me and made me pay a fine á of 500 pts.  We had to go home on foot (6 km) since it was too á late for anyone to give us a lift.
Label: anger

Text: I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.
Label: guilt

Text: When I discovered that I and my friend would be licensed at the á first call. This emotion was accompanied by a great relief. It á was the coronation of a year of sacrifice and extrene discipline.
Label: joy

Text: My girlfriend who had been very far away from me came to my á place. She saw me and ran after me. I didn't know that she had á come. I couldn't see her. She held my shoulders standing behind á me.
Label: joy

Text: I felt so afraid when dad fell ill, he had never suffered from á that disease since and I had never seen him as he was.
Label: fear

Text: I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. á Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come á home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.
Label: anger

Text: When I come home in the evening, the first thing I do is to sit á down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally á desolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had not á finished.
Label: anger

Text: When I passed the university entrance exam.
Label: joy

Text: When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.
Label: joy

Text: When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister. á Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried á and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.
Label: guilt

Text: Our association had Polish visitors and when they were going back á by boat I did not go to see them off (I am the chairman of the á association).
Label: guilt

Text: I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left á alone in this unfamiliar country.
Label: fear

Text: When one of my lovers told me that I was a flirt.
Label: guilt

Text: A person whom I had not seen for a long time called me and á invited me for a party.
Label: joy

Text: When my mother returned from a holiday, I told her a lie i.e my á father had brought another woman home while she was away.
Label: guilt

Text: A few lies that I had indulged in, a few years ago, while raising á loans from my friends.
Label: guilt

Text: That day I was alone at home after coming home from school.  I did á not know where everyone else had gone, I kept waiting for them to á come back and nobody came.  It was getting very late and I was á terrified.
Label: fear

Text: My child passed away after a short illness when he was just á eleven months old. I was only told about his death without á knowing that he had been ill.
Label: sadness

Text: When I talk to silly, petty-minded and unmanageable people.
Label: anger

Text: When another fellow worker decided to leave the company. We had á been very close and we would not be able to work with eachother á any longer.
Label: sadness

Text: One day when I came back home, I found my favourite dish broken.  á I blamed the servant for it, later I found out that it was not á the servant but my daughter who had broken it.
Label: shame

Text: I was in a train when a woman started talking loudly and á attracting everybody's attention.  The worst thing was that she á was discussing something, about which she knew nothing, with another person.
Label: disgust

Text: When a close friend of mine who was with me in first year could á not make it to the second year.
Label: sadness

Text: When the car I was driving skidded on an icy road and landed in   á a ditch with one side against a rock.
Label: fear

Text: I felt guilty of revealing a secret to my in-law. I told her that á my brother and I had gone to disconight which is a thing my á brother didn't want to let her know. Later my brother was accused á of spending a night out.
Label: guilt

Text: I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretended á love and affection to be able to sleep with her.
Label: shame

Text: I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.
Label: shame

Text: One of my friends kept criticizing me about everything I did. I á thought she was kidding, but later I found out that she was á serious.
Label: anger

Text: When people around me did not understand me the right way.
Label: disgust

Text: On the cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a á bird.(swans of the bay)
Label: joy

Text: Before knowing my marks I was not sure that I wanted to go to á that class.
Label: fear

Text: Fearing the use of power or reprimands when I belong to the á minority.
Label: fear

Text: Dead rat in the kitchen of the university.
Label: disgust

Text: Found my name on the list of attending the English lectures.
Label: joy

Text: When I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice, á and his attitude made me glad.
Label: joy

Text: [ I have never felt this emotion.]
Label: guilt

Text: I was at home alone, and heard noises on the roof, and doorknobs, á and drawers.
Label: fear

Text: At my summer job, I was responsible for making various orders.  á It was not me who had ordered some seasonal merchandise, but when á much of it was left over and had to be thrown away in the Autumn, á I felt partly responsible for the much too large order.
Label: guilt

Text: When some seniors tried to scold and insult some juniors on á account of what the juniors were supposed to have said at á secondary school.
Label: anger

Text: When my mother and father split up I was angry: I felt deprived á and \different\" from other children at school."
Label: anger

Text: When I entered the dissecting room for the first time. I think I á felt disgusted mainly because of the bad smell of formaline.
Label: disgust

Text: Staying alone in the biology building after the dark.
Label: fear

Text: [ No response.]
Label: guilt

Text: This monday I took a Math 1BS test and flunked for the second á time.
Label: sadness

Text: Sleeping alone in a tent, while hearing several noises such as á rustling etc, I am afraid that there are people who are up to no á good.
Label: fear

Text: My sister was afraid of her husband.
Label: shame

Text: When a friend, who has been with me at school, failed to make it á to UNZA.
Label: sadness

Text: Watching TV about china is behind in winning gold medals.
Label: shame

Text: The first day that I was close to a dead body, in my third year á at UNZA, school of medicine.
Label: fear

Text: I was told that a friend of a friend committed suicide.
Label: sadness

Text: When I first had a sexual intercourse.
Label: shame

Text: Two guys were fighting murderously and I feared that one of them á would be killed.
Label: fear

Text: Day before yesterday my mother bought me a new pair of shoes, á without my having asked for them.  She told me that when she saw á the pair of shoes she felt like buying them for me.  I really á liked the shoes and they made me feel that my mother cares for á me.
Label: joy

Text: Saw my class leader acting like a God when he chose people to go á to your English lectures.
Label: disgust

Text: When I received a beautiful birthday gift form my parents.
Label: joy

Text: I asked someone to bring some present to my father and found out á that he is not a reliable person. I was afraid if my father would á not get the presents he would be angry with me.
Label: fear

Text: It was August 30th when I heard on the radio that I passed my á M.C.E. exams and I was really happy and joyous because of the á event.
Label: joy

Text: A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent á way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about á something.
Label: anger

Text: When I called my boyfriend he asked me if I would live with him.
Label: joy

Text: When I came home late one day. I was afraid I would be shouted at á by my parents.
Label: fear

Text: A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.
Label: fear

Text: I thought that someone was angry with me but, by hindsight, that á didn't appear to be the case, he even liked me.
Label: joy

Text: During a lecture six students (including me) were asked to leave á the class as we had not prepared for the lesson.  I felt ashamed á and angry.
Label: shame

Text: Misunderstood by a close friend for the wrong reason.
Label: anger

Text: When my husband lied to me, tricked me and when I had to leave my á home.
Label: sadness

Text: Attitude to some manners of dealing and some \sanctioned\" á
Label: anger

Text: Some boys told me your nickname is \Little Girl Doctor\", I did á
Label: guilt

Text: Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which I á had made for myself. It was during a long telephone call after I á had just made it and put it in the oven warming drawer.
Label: anger

Text: I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher, á because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.
Label: anger

Text: I was in a bus with my school material when I fell and sat on the á lap of another passenger.
Label: shame

Text: At school I was talking to a classmate about mathematics.  I had á grown weary of it and said : \I would like to throw the book on á
Label: shame

Text: I was disappointed by a girlfriend when I visited her at her home á in Woodlands.
Label: disgust

Text: I had a very pleasant conversation with one of my friends.
Label: joy

Text: I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I á realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never á see eachother again and none of it mattered.
Label: sadness

Text: One day I was with my girlfriend and other friends were behind á us, I fell down because the place was slippery and I really felt á ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: When there was a bomb threat in Tolman Hall. This was the first á time that I felt my life could be in danger.
Label: fear

Text: I entered the wrong room, and got into a bed where someone á already was sleeping.
Label: shame

Text: I was disgusted with the hypocrisy of my colleagues from the á group.
Label: disgust

Text: A few years ago my mother suffered from canccer and died within á two years.  We had not finished our studies then and could not á bear our responsibilities as her children.  My mother had tried á her best to take care of us but she lived in pain these two á years.  Neither the doctor nor we could do anything for her as á cancer is incurable.  I was very eager to replace her in á suffernig , even die instead of her.
Label: sadness

Text: Having moved into a flat within the last week I felt some disgust á that a bathroom tap had been left to drip with a faulty fawcet.
Label: disgust

Text: I helped someone to do something and was found out.
Label: fear

Text: When I went home on holidays I found that my niece and nephew had á passed away I was very sad for the children were not even sick á before death but suddenly died.
Label: sadness

Text: Anatomy lesson and told we have to do it at night sometimes.
Label: fear

Text: Watching a TV documentary on seal clubbing.
Label: disgust

Text: When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.  á A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see á him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.
Label: anger

Text: A certain man went to my parents and told them that I was married á here, when I am here at school. When I went home for holidays my á parents asked me about it and I was angry with that man.
Label: anger

Text: When I was a child, I heard the floor cracking and I thought á there was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket and á trembled.
Label: fear

Text: I slammed my little brother into a wall because he was bothering á me.
Label: guilt

Text: [ Never experienced.]
Label: shame

Text: I slept in a tent at the Barracks which caught fire at night and á my best possessions got burnt in there.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt much anger and perhaps I feel it till now, against my á girlfriend's sister who incited her to betray me just when I á needed her very much. She didn't think of anything, simply á passed over everything.
Label: anger

Text: In the evening, while I was watching TV, my little brother came á in and started eating food he had brought from the kitchen while á I was trying to concentrate on the program.
Label: disgust

Text: Motorcyclistic accident where for some minutes I didn't know if I á was alive or dead, I remained \cold levered\" during the situation á
Label: fear

Text: When they changed my office to another room without my agreement.
Label: anger

Text: Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations á most of all. I remember I was horror stricken before my á microbiology exam, because it was a decisive one.
Label: fear

Text: I went for a walk on the beach with a friend whom I had not seen á for many months.  The weather was very pleasant, we had some á ice-cream and lots of fun on the beach.
Label: joy

Text: In the student's union there was someone who took the photocopies á of two large volumes.  I asked him to let me take a few, he refused á it for an acceptable reason.
Label: anger

Text: People not cueing in the dining hall.
Label: anger

Text: I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me á and he lost it.
Label: anger

Text: Once as a school girl I was copying at a class work and my á teacher spotted me.
Label: shame

Text: When my sister was born.
Label: joy

Text: When I found out that my girlfriend would not be coming back to á UCB for one semester, but would be living in San Jose.
Label: sadness

Text: I reachad home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.
Label: anger

Text: A friend of mine felt bad because of something I had done to á something that belonged to him.
Label: guilt

Text: I went to a fair where a guy who was drunk kept bothering me and á in the end I got really angry.
Label: anger

Text: One day I found an incontinent man in the ward. This patient had a á guardian who couldn't give him a bath. So I just left him like that á but felt guilty until I went back to give him a bath.
Label: guilt

Text: 3 years ago I served in the army. Once a collegue denounced me á because of a delict, which is usually committed. I was arrested á for 3 days. I still detest this man.
Label: disgust

Text: I'm crazy about football. When my team lost a goal in the Paulist á championship, and so it lost the classifications.
Label: anger

Text: Guilt after fighting with my sister (for) telling her how bad she á was.
Label: guilt

Text: A woman I know is slowly dying from cancer. Observing this á process makes me sad.
Label: sadness

Text: An old woman was violently thrown down the stairs of the tube by á a group of louts.
Label: anger

Text: A reoccurring fear that something will happen to my relatives.
Label: fear

Text: When I saw a big spider from very close.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.
Label: joy

Text: Easter holiday - I had been working weekends and had just left.
Label: joy

Text: When someone told a secret I told them not to tell.
Label: anger

Text: When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.
Label: sadness

Text: When I made acquaintance with the parents of my boyfriend for the á first time. They spoke Limburgian (a dutch dialect) and one of my á first remarks was that I disliked Limburgian dialect.
Label: shame

Text: My girl-friend did not understand me; I was angry with myself á because I had problems when we seperated - I could not resign á myself to it.
Label: anger

Text: I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house. á I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and there á was a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.
Label: fear

Text: We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently used á hard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friends á also used them. While we agreed we would help the big user to á stop using it.
Label: disgust

Text: Breaking the left hand indicator box by moving too close to á structure.
Label: guilt

Text: When I felt alone and without love.
Label: sadness

Text: I bought a new bed for my apt. and it squeaks when you move on á it. I tried to fix it but could not.
Label: anger

Text: My cousin knocked on the door, looking for me to get her watch á back.  I had given it to my girlfriend, Lizzy, as a present.
Label: guilt

Text: When I recently got an appartment in central Gottenburg.
Label: joy

Text: I had an argument with my boyfriend.  It was my fault but my á pride would not let me admit it.
Label: guilt

Text: I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made, which á I should not have made.
Label: fear

Text: My father died 4 years ago, 18 months after my mother died. I á feld my sister was responsible for his death, in that she \hadn't á
Label: shame

Text: In a playground I was playing at the seesaw with a little niece. á I wanted to stop but nobody came to help me. When I got off, all á alone the seesaw fell down with a big smash. My niece got hurt á above her eye. Now there is a scar.
Label: guilt

Text: I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it and á had certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me, á played cards with other people.
Label: anger

Text: When I realized that I belonged to a country which is amongst the á poorest in the world and that inspite of having the resources we á do not utilize them.  I was ashamed at myself and my country, á shame at the lack of parity between the lifestyles of the á citizens.
Label: shame

Text: My friend was badly hurt.
Label: sadness

Text: At the railway station, while waiting for the last train at night á I noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in a á purposeful mannner.
Label: fear

Text: When my elder brother died.
Label: sadness

Text: When I talk to my friends.
Label: joy

Text: A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded to á show pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most people á had had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading, á unmoral manner - especially females exposing and flaunting á themselves with no shame or embarassment.
Label: disgust

Text: [ During a certain period, I felt successful and extremely satisfied.   á When I found that any tasks or decisions that I had made were better  á than expected.]
Label: joy

Text: When I saw someone eating live worms.
Label: disgust

Text: Not doing well in the examn.
Label: shame

Text: I can not think of any incident when I have felt very ashamed.  á There are small incidents that I am ashamed of, for instance, á not sending money to the children in Ethiopia.
Label: shame

Text: Finding out that I was deceived by my friend.
Label: shame

Text: I heard that a friend had died in an accident; group situation: á suddenly a friend came in and said \Have you already heard á
Label: sadness

Text: While skiing in Squaw Valley, I was riding up a chair lift and á right when the chair was above a sheer cliff of rocks, the chair á lift stopped and all the chairs sagged and everything seemed to á creak loudly.
Label: fear

Text: Doing anatomy alone for the first time.
Label: fear

Text: When I beat up a first year student at my secondary school in á my capacity as the deputy head boy.  He had woken up late in the  á morning for manual work.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was put into a tennis team below my standard.
Label: anger

Text: The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad á then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.
Label: anger

Text: After one year of searching, my friend and I have found a flat we á are able to pay for.
Label: joy

Text: When I was young I was told to to the shop to buy a dozen eggs.  á I went and asked for one egg and the people in the shop laughed á at me and so did my family when I told them what had happened.
Label: shame

Text: I was diving below the ice, in a cave, at a depth of 26 metres.  á Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreased á threateningly.  There were three of us divers on one safety rope.
Label: fear

Text: Succeeding in helping others.
Label: joy

Text: When I had an argument with a friend.
Label: sadness

Text: When I went to the clinic for a medical check-up and saw the way á the lecturer was conducting the lecture and the kind of responses á he got from the patients.
Label: disgust

Text: When I sat in the wrong discussion section in the beginning of á the semester. I insisted on being in the right section and the á TA's list should have included my name. When I found out that I á was in the wrong, I apologized, turned red and left.
Label: shame

Text: When I hurt my sisters for no reason at all.
Label: guilt

Text: I was living with my brother and one day he went away on business á and I was left alone to look after the house and the property. At á night thieves came and wanted to break into the house.
Label: fear

Text: Someone told me I was chosen for the English lectures because I á am good looking.
Label: disgust

Text: My anger is with men, their inability to be human (not all men).
Label: anger

Text: Not being able to have a party at home with friends.
Label: shame

Text: We had friends to dinner and one of them threw a beer bottle in á the air, and it bounced on an expensive table and damaged the á table .The person did not apologise.
Label: disgust

Text: When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.
Label: joy

Text: Arguing with a friend over politics. She was more informed on the á issues and made me feel very ashamed of my political ignorance.
Label: shame

Text: Being mistreated by my former primary school teacher, Mr Zalu.
Label: disgust

Text: When a man who had a knife grabbed me and threatened me with it,   á during my holidays in Monze.á
Label: fear

Text: This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.
Label: guilt

Text: When I learnt that my brother-in-law had been poisoned by his á friends and that he was dead.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt shame and I couldn't look into my teacher's eyes, after á not attending his lectures.
Label: shame

Text: When my son was born.
Label: joy

Text: When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited for á her all night, not knowing where she was.
Label: joy

Text: First day at University (I didn't know what to expect).
Label: fear

Text: About my girlfriend's sister who is a viper as I discovered some á time ago.
Label: disgust

Text: South Korea cheating for gold medals.
Label: anger

Text: When I finished my exams after 12th Grade, I was worried about á getting a T.E. Score high enough for Physiotherapy. When I found á that I had been accepted I was ecstatic, or more appropriately, á could jump for joy.
Label: joy

Text: I felt sad when my dear friend was needed from training school á due to his failure in a number of subjects and simply didn't know á what he had to do.
Label: sadness

Text: During a meeting.
Label: shame

Text: When I was detained one day in school, by the vice-principal, for á indiscipline.
Label: shame

Text: A colleague's 17 year old daughter is seriously ill with cancer á and has only a year to live.  I  heard about it 6 weeks ago.
Label: sadness

Text: My paternal grandmother had died. We weren't close but she was á blood. I didn't cry but I was sad, partly due to her death and á partly I think, due to the fact that I couldn't/didn't cry.
Label: sadness

Text: I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, this á was the second time.  One had a negative attitude towards the á lecturer.á
Label: anger

Text: Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.
Label: fear

Text: That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my á Mum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 and á didn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adopted á at 14.
Label: fear

Text: When I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad and á up to this moment my sadness is still on.
Label: sadness

Text: One afternoon, helping at home on the property, I was á (mustering) getting in cattle and a bull turned and came for me.
Label: fear

Text: I was the compere at a party and all my efforts to get the show á rolling were thwarted by the immobile, non co-operative guests.  á I felt frustation - bordering on anger.
Label: anger

Text: During the exam period I studied in the library alone.  A close   á friend of mine, who is also a classmate, told me that my á application for a Japanese inter-cultural exchange programme had á been accepted.  I was not very sure as I did not know that the á list had been declared.  I ran to the board and saw that I was á really included in the list.  I was so excited that I smiled all á day long.  When I met my classmates and friends I told them the á good news.  I was so happy that I could not concentrate on my á studies. á
Label: joy

Text: One day I was walking with my boyfriend. We met my ex-boyfriend á and out of jealousy he started calling me names.
Label: disgust

Text: When I broke the piggy bank of my brother and my mother á discovered that.
Label: shame

Text: When I came back from my holidays.
Label: sadness

Text: Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and á wine.
Label: joy

Text: When I was left alone one week-end without being prepared for á it.
Label: sadness

Text: My best friend had failed Exams. She had to leave and so we got á separated.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was accepted at UNZA.
Label: joy

Text: Last night, I dreamt that things that looked like monsters were á trying to kiss me.
Label: fear

Text: On May 20th I got a summon to appear in court on May 28th 1985 on á the subject of impregnanting a school girl. I really feared of á standing in the court in a few days time after this notice. I was á also embarassed due to formal approach that was expected of me to á the Principal.
Label: fear

Text: In a warm bus full of people, someone vomited and the whole bus á stank.
Label: disgust

Text: I slapped my sister's daughter and after several hours, she had a á high temperature and she ended up being admitted in hospital.
Label: guilt

Text: When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did not á have a raincoat on me.
Label: anger

Text: Teacher suspected me stealing money.
Label: shame

Text: We had come back from a programme and we were all (three girls)    á staying over at another girls placce.  One of them started á passing very nasty and outright bitchy remarks at me.  It was á brought on by a male colleague's compliments to me, this girl was á herself interested in this guy.  Bitchiness and catty remarks á made by women never fail to disgust me.  I can particularly á remember this incident as she knew that I had not encouraged the  á guy.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt guilty because I stole some sweets from my father's á grocery. When he asked me who stole the sweets I told him it was á my brother who stole the sweets and he was scolded.
Label: guilt

Text: A co-worker and I had to rush a project. I was only working there á for one month and he for some years. Instead of letting me know á that he wanted to do the project himself, he went to the á superviser and let the superviser tell me to let the co-worker do á it himself since he was quicker at it.
Label: anger

Text: I am sad because some relations to friends are not very good.
Label: sadness

Text: Beating my brother up.
Label: guilt

Text: China winning the Asian Olympic.
Label: joy

Text: Relatives visiting me.
Label: joy

Text: When one has been unjust, stupid towards someone else.
Label: shame

Text: When a girl said in my back that we were in love, and she had á actually refused me.  When I confronted her she started insulting á me.
Label: disgust

Text: I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable á of, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat in á the tram.
Label: disgust

Text: I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot á licence. I can remember it was gorgeous day and I was on a á natural high, cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses á and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck á and it was a real adventure.
Label: joy

Text: I felt sadness when I notice that I'm not important for a á determinate person. We do many things for a friend, and we see á soon after, that he doesn't do anything for us, nor thinks of us.
Label: sadness

Text: A few days back I had to ask a professor a ridiculous question á because I had lost at a game of cards and had to pay a forfeit.
Label: shame

Text: When I wished secretly and lied to a friend of mine because I á didn't want her to stay in my house on the beach (as she always á does), and wouldn't stick on me.
Label: guilt

Text: When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I á had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.
Label: sadness

Text: In August,1983, the long awaited \big envelope\" (a document for á
Label: joy

Text: My sister said I am not a stable person, and I think she is á right.
Label: shame

Text: China winning the Asian Olympic games (TV).
Label: joy

Text: My academic result was poor and I had to repeat the second year.  á I felt sad about the coming several years.
Label: sadness

Text: Talking about someone behind their back.
Label: guilt

Text: When an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen á carpet.  It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in, á this acquaintance had helped her move in.á
Label: disgust

Text: A kitten had wandered into our office, and I was told to take it á back across the street. When I crossed back, the kitten followed á me and was run over and killed by a car.
Label: guilt

Text: When I am alone at night after having read horror stories, and á then I heard unexplainable noises.
Label: fear

Text: I felt unfairly treated at an airport, being told to use a á different counter (for domestic traffic only).
Label: anger

Text: Because I was lazy and unthoughtful I did not get into contact á with a very close friend when she shifted from the Gold Coast to á Brisbane, for a month, despite her efforts to contact me. I felt á shamed when I finally confronted her again.
Label: shame

Text: My elder sister forced me to do a few things which I did not like á to do.
Label: disgust

Text: Reading a horror story alone.
Label: fear

Text: When somebody despised a friend of mine.
Label: disgust

Text: When I read racist slogans on the walls.
Label: disgust

Text: Saw in TV that China had the most gold medals in the Asian á Olympic.
Label: joy

Text: I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to my á student lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which had á been planned by taking people's comfort into account.
Label: disgust

Text: When a thief entered the house in which I was sleeping.
Label: fear

Text: When my cousin passed away during the holidays at home.  He fell á ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.
Label: sadness

Text: I met a friend I had not seen for a long time on the street.
Label: joy

Text: After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.
Label: joy

Text: When my dog ran out on thin ice last spring.
Label: fear

Text: Heard some ghost-like noise at night.
Label: fear

Text: When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after I á had learnt all the lines.
Label: disgust

Text: During the military service, I lost a part of an equipment; I á accused another person and he was rebuked and punished.
Label: guilt

Text: When in the end of a semester I got the approval in a matter that á I judged very difficult.
Label: joy

Text: When I saw a film where a black was rapeing a girl while another one was á filming it for a pornographic movie.
Label: disgust

Text: The murder of two girls on a school trip to Berlin (and sexual á crimes generally) a couple of years ago.
Label: disgust

Text: One evening when a boy who was drunk made a pass at me by trying á to kiss me.
Label: disgust

Text: The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused á a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.
Label: sadness

Text: I had a schoolmate who went to the hospital as her brain was á bleeding.  She fell unconscious for three days and when I went á to see her I saw the miserable state the family was in.  Moreover á I could not do nothing for her.  I was very sad.  Finally, she á died.
Label: sadness

Text: My friend and I planned to search for old documents and utensils á in the cellar. It was very late at night when we arrived in the á cellar. He indicated the place where the police (40 years ago) found á two dead bodies. I got very scared when he told me this story.
Label: fear

Text: At one point in a relationship, my boyfriend was seeing an old á flame more than me. At our confrontation tears were shed.
Label: sadness

Text: My mother accused me of not visiting her enough when she was in á hospital for an eye operation.
Label: guilt

Text: When I boarded Yanu Yanu bus I sat near a man who was smoking á tobacco.
Label: disgust

Text: Came back from surfing to find car broken into and gear and money á stolen.
Label: anger

Text: My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed á at night.
Label: fear

Text: Because of the examination I had to study night and day.
Label: disgust

Text: A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before, á did not pass the final examination and had to take it again half á a year later.
Label: sadness

Text: I was at the University dining room, alone, and at a table next á to mine thre were several professors.  One of them asked me to á join them.  I refused but she insisted.  All the others started á looking at me and I had to move to their table.
Label: shame

Text: I gave tutorial to a student and I found that he was lazy, he did á not pay attention to what I taught.  He did some easy questions á wrong deliberately.
Label: anger

Text: One of my friends came to know through some other friends that I   á had applied for some course in an institute.  He asked me \why á
Label: guilt

Text: I heard a broadcasting programme about parapsychology. The people á in this programme used very difficult words which I couldn't á understand. They acted exaggerated without showing any feeling.
Label: disgust

Text: I got to know that I had been accepted at university.
Label: joy

Text: After a party in which I made love with a boy in public. Later on á I heard that others were talking about me and called me a slut.
Label: shame

Text: I had an appointment with a friend. I promised him to meet with á him, but at last I did not without having informed him.
Label: guilt

Text: We had fixed time for practice as we had to participate in the á inter-department song contest.  I arrived and found that there á was nobody there.  When I went to the canteen I found them eating á lunch.  I was so angry that I aired my greviances to one of them á and then left.
Label: anger

Text: When I was working, I got treated in a way which I felt was not á democratic.
Label: disgust

Text: I had borrowed some money and I exceeded the time-limit.
Label: shame

Text: I was living in rooms in a very lonely, quiet neigbourhood. á During the night it was very silent and this frightened me. The á fact of being alone in that house frightened me.
Label: fear

Text: I was accused of having drunk a bottle of liquor and then á refilling with water.
Label: anger

Text: When the others did not do their bit of work on a group á assignment task, and I had to do all the work.
Label: anger

Text: The first time that I saw a dead person.  This was when I started á my gross anatomy practicals.
Label: fear

Text: [ No response.]
Label: guilt

Text: Hearing a strange noise in the biology building.
Label: fear

Text: My article not chosen by the college newspaper
Label: shame

Text: When a good friend with whom I had an intimate relationship made á clear that he didn't want to continue in the same way. He choose á his girlfriend (also a friend of mine).
Label: sadness

Text: I felt guilty when I learnt that some of friends found the á finished at the Cafeteria because I took food which was more than á my share.
Label: guilt

Text: My friend took me to Civo Stadium to watch and listen to the á music of the International singer Sam Mangwana. I had no hope of á going there since I had no money so he gave me the money for á admission.
Label: joy

Text: I could not find my monthly tickets for the bus when I was on the á bus.
Label: anger

Text: Forgot to collect post for a friend.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was accepted for further education, here at the á university.
Label: joy

Text: When I inadvertantly made some close friends and relatives feel á bad.
Label: guilt

Text: China cannot buy your reference.
Label: shame

Text: Being harrassed for being gay; suggestions of being physically á beaten - acting as informal bouncer in a gay bar.
Label: fear

Text: Salo, a movie film by Pasolini. People were misused and tortured á for the fun of a few elder Italian authorities, during World War á II.
Label: disgust

Text: Girl I was fond of did not initiate conversation as I expected in á tutorial.
Label: sadness

Text: When I got into an argument with someone and was very abusive, á but they were a close friend and I later regretted it.
Label: sadness

Text: Lost my girl-friend.
Label: sadness

Text: When an acquaintance of mine beat up another person for no just á reason, and thus showed off his power.
Label: anger

Text: I spoke to my mother on the phone.  She had skin cancer and was á waiting to be operated.  I forgot to ask her the date of the á operation and just before finishing our conversation she gave me á the date in passing.
Label: guilt

Text: My boyfriend with whom I had a longlasting relationship, fell in á love with another girl, then he asked me something which implied á that he loved that girl more than he loved me.
Label: sadness

Text: Saw on TV China winning the gold medals.
Label: joy

Text: During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit á suicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, she á looked miserable.
Label: sadness

Text: I was not chosen for the All English class.
Label: sadness

Text: When a person whom I do not want to see is continously present.
Label: shame

Text: I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an        á operation.
Label: disgust

Text: When we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards my á mother I did not admit that it was my fault.
Label: guilt

Text: On New Years eve I drank too much alcohol, so much that I had to á vomit in the presence of other people.
Label: shame

Text: I scolded my sister without waiting for her explanation.
Label: shame

Text: After yelling at my girlfriend, I felt bad because she was ? á crying and upset.
Label: guilt

Text: Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as a á friend to some members of my family, and my niece Yavanna who's á six was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was really á silly and at first it was ok, but it went on and on - yukky pooh! á You eat your snot, etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. But á she had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'd á accepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better - á it was partly having my friend there.
Label: disgust

Text: I feel fear when I only imagine I could lose confidence in my own á abilities and powers. A similar feeling I feel sometimes before á an exam.
Label: fear

Text: Just before I started my study I had to move, I was very afraid á to be left alone and that I could not manage it.
Label: fear

Text: When my brother gave me a watch.
Label: joy

Text: When I was a child I used to play with my cousin gushing wather á to each other in front of the door of my house. One day we á decided to gush with on a passing car. The driver stopped and á went to discuss with my mother and my aunt that were there.
Label: guilt

Text: My sister was impolite to my father when the family was having á lunch together at a restaurant.  She thought that our parents had á been prejudiced against her, this was an extreme thought.
Label: sadness

Text: When I first heard that Tage Dannielsson had died.
Label: sadness

Text: Got a package from my parents, without even a small note á enclosed.
Label: sadness

Text: Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They á were special people to me.
Label: joy

Text: I received the mid-term exam paper of one of my major subjects á and I found that I had failed it.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was teaching a student started making silly remarks in á class.
Label: disgust

Text: My friend replying to my letter and again saying he was attracted á to me and suggesting we write, talk and get together and see how á things went and his suggestion that I could ring and doing that it á was really good - though really insane conversation.
Label: joy

Text: We were at secondary school and I was making a lot of noise.  The á teacher came to ask us as to who was making all the noise.  I did á not own up so the  whole class was punished.
Label: guilt

Text: The stories about my aunt who was beaten and humiliated by my á uncle.
Label: disgust

Text: My mother's death.
Label: sadness

Text: When I took the first year university exams and made a lot of á mistakes in the P110 exam.  I was afraid of failing and thus á being unable to go to the school of medicine.
Label: fear

Text: I was running in front of a crowd when I slipped and fell on a á wet lawn.
Label: shame

Text: When I used an adjective for a person without knowing what it á meant.   When I got to know the meaning, I felt guilty as it was á a clear and unfair insult.
Label: guilt

Text: I prayed unfaithfully.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was in a bus on my way to the examination centre, a man    á sitting opposite me kept looking at me continously.  I did not know  á what was wrong.  When I reached the  centre I started strolling around  á as I still had a little time.  Suddenly a man came and whispered \You  á
Label: shame

Text: When I first came to the UNZA I did not know the kind of people I á would find here and the kind of behaviour they would have towards á me.
Label: fear

Text: When an uncle of mine, who was close to me, passed away after á having had a stroke, before his first daughter could be named.
Label: sadness

Text: When I encountered not only with my father's lack of á understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as á a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be á right are concerned.
Label: anger

Text: Walking along with a dog barking at you and following you.
Label: fear

Text: I lied to a friend.
Label: shame

Text: I felt joy when I came to know Christ.  That is when I became a á Christian.
Label: joy

Text: I was sitting on the bus coming back from school. A man from á nearly forty years sat beside me. After a while I looked at him á and saw that he was looking at me with opened throusers and á holding his penis.
Label: fear

Text: When I heard that my father had been involved in a car accident á in Lusaka.  This happened when he had gone to get the car which á had been stolen in Lusaka.
Label: sadness

Text: When they broke the artistic work of several weeks.  Changes were á made and it was broken without permission, they had no right to á do this.
Label: anger

Text: I felt sad with the two situations I described before. The cat á and the school. Sadness was intermingled with the other feelings.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was 20 years old, I fell severely ill and was bed-ridden for á 6 months.  I felt very scared for my health and my studies.
Label: fear

Text: When I first saw the state of a cafeteria in the grounds of the á university. Due to students own lack of concern for the á environment in which they eat and drink. Rubbish and spilled tea á and coffee left everywhere.
Label: disgust

Text: Being refused to attend the neuropsychology lecture in the á medical university.
Label: anger

Text: By mistake I took a book from the library which was not supposed á to be loaned out.
Label: guilt

Text: This happens to me when I am not prepared in a given subject.
Label: shame

Text: Disgust of drunkers and of blood.
Label: disgust

Text: I was playing in a football tournament and saw the rules openly á disregarded.
Label: anger

Text: A boy in my class talking too loud in the lecture.
Label: disgust

Text: When at times unconscienciously I speak to my mother in a high á tome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost á my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.
Label: anger

Text: Did badly in an examn.
Label: sadness

Text: I had stolen a bottle of rum from a person who knows me well. He á threatened to call the police if I did not pay 500 Shillings.
Label: anger

Text: In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating á up his old father.  He claimed that the father was responsible á for his guardian's failure.
Label: anger

Text: When I was accepted at UNZA.
Label: joy

Text: While watching a film of an experimental operation on a cat's á brain in which the cat had metal pieces protruding from its eyes, á mouth etc. to keep the head stable while being cut open.
Label: disgust

Text: Fights that I see in the middle of the street, robberies, fear of á darkness when going home.
Label: fear

Text: A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderly á visitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.
Label: shame

Text: I am disgusted with my sister's husband. On an early Sunday á morning after having knocked at my door, he suddenly rushed in á and finching me still in bed he began quarrelling about á something. I could not understand. I heard his last words: \Don't á
Label: disgust

Text: Taking a chemistry midterm.
Label: fear

Text: Got ill.
Label: fear

Text: When my mother told things to my sister, which I told my mother á in confindence.
Label: anger

Text: I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him á but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.
Label: disgust

Text: I passed on some gossip that was untrue and cause two friends to á have a fight who were already experiencing difficulties with each á other.
Label: shame

Text: I was attacked by a man at a bus stop at night.
Label: fear

Text: When my brothers were being cruel to my boyfriend, because his á flat-mate bent back one of my brother's fingers. It wasn't his á fault.
Label: anger

Text: When I had my four children.
Label: joy

Text: One day my colleague misbehaved with me.  I felt disgusted and á thought to myself that he could only do this because I was a á woman.
Label: disgust

Text: When I tried to put up a tent some years ago, I was teased and á hindered by my cousin.
Label: anger

Text: One night I had a sexual intercourse with another man.  My sexual á desire and my curiosity had made me jump into bed with him.  I am á ashamed of myself now.
Label: shame

Text: I was disgusted at the existing red-tape in the government á offices.  I accquired my passport three months after having applied for á it and I had to go back five times to them to correct a minor á error.
Label: disgust

Text: Guilt - because I had not written to my sister for months before á she died.
Label: guilt

Text: When I made a mistake at work and when questioned about it á pretended I had nothing to do with the problem.
Label: guilt

Text: A friend of mine had said something about not liking to come to á my place just before coming to my place.   In the meanwhile I got á to learn about this from another friend of mine and when she á arrived at my place I really treated her badly.  I was later á ashamed of the way I had treated someone when the person was at á my place.
Label: shame

Text: When I was travelling by tram, I tripped and fell against the á door.  I thought that I was going to fall out.
Label: fear

Text: Being very close to having an auto accident, almost driving off á the road.
Label: fear

Text: When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for á my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of á childhood.
Label: sadness

Text: I feel anger when things don't come out as I wish.
Label: anger

Text: That a friend had been badly beaten and stabbed many times and á the person that did it got away without any punishment from the á law.
Label: anger

Text: I feared that I was pregnant.  It was not planned and I would á have been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not have á liked at all.  Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to know á that I was not pregnant.
Label: fear

Text: When I was young I was playing football near my parent's house á and while playing I fell on the ground. At first I thought I was á not seen by anybody, but when my mother laughed I felt very á ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: Quite unconsciously I offended a girlfriend of mine. It was á really worthy to pass this fact over in silence, but I acted so, á because I believed I was right. In fact it often happens to me to á feel guilt, after I have already done the deed.
Label: guilt

Text: Found out that my grandmother might have been misdiagnosed as a á psychiatric patient because the doctor did not know about á neurologism.
Label: sadness

Text: One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I á did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had á a bad conscience and felt guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: I tried my level best to care for my client, I took an á appointment with a doctor and before meeting the doctor he á expired - a poor small boy from Uttar Pradesh.
Label: sadness

Text: I was to meet a friend at the bus-stop (he was coming to visit á us) and he did not turn up.  After having waited for him for some time     á (about an hour) I called him up, to be told that he did not á intend to come as he was feeling tired.
Label: anger

Text: When an event took place in another's life and which I thought I á could have avoided.
Label: guilt

Text: My sister marrying a bad man. He is cruel to her.
Label: sadness

Text: When criticizing something about a person and then realizing that á the person whom one is talking to is similar.
Label: shame

Text: I was happy to hear that my sister had won a prize at running á competition.
Label: joy

Text: When I slept with a guy because my best friend wanted me to.  á He had never had intercourse with anyone and had a terrible á complex about it.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I á had wanted to.
Label: guilt

Text: Saw a selfish person doing a selfish thing.
Label: disgust

Text: Getting slightly intoxicated at the 1984 I.C.C. Ball.
Label: shame

Text: On the train a drunk person touched my baby and I reacted very á disapprovingly.  I felt ashamed later as the person had not been á aggressive though he could have been.
Label: shame

Text: The death of my twin sister - suicide.
Label: sadness

Text: I was driving on to a busy freeway during rush hour and it was á slightly raining. A diesel truck was coming very close behind me á and I was close behind a pick-up. I changed lanes and barely hit á the truck and ran a Honda of the road. I was scared to death to á go back and see if I caused him to crash.
Label: fear

Text: My roommate liked to listen to some meaningless songs which had á melody but had no content.  We lived together so when he played á the recorder I was forced to listen to them.  I could not tell á him that I did not like to listen to the songs, as I had no right á to disturb the freedom of others.  So I would find a pretext to á leave the room and go somewhere else.
Label: disgust

Text: I was in grade seven and my class was planning a protest against á a rude and immoral teacher.  I sneaked out and told the á headmaster about it and so the plan was foiled.
Label: guilt

Text: My mother was stuck by an apoplectic fit, was hemi-paralyzed and á suffered an aphasia.
Label: sadness

Text: When I wore a grotesque figure hanging down my back.
Label: shame

Text: Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual family á friends dinner. Told \Not to Speak\". The attitude by him was á
Label: shame

Text: Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw á another one, as if out of control of the driver.
Label: fear

Text: I remember when I was in Standard 6, I failed one of the terminal á tests and I told my parents that I had passed but after they á found out from the class teacher that I had failed, I was proved á a liar.
Label: shame

Text: I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down, á was slightly injured and cried vociferously.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was not chosen to go to your English lectures.
Label: sadness

Text: When I thought that my high school love and I had a mutual á emotion.
Label: joy

Text: When I heard that there had been some women raped at uni, just á near where I usually park my car and walk by myself at night. á Although I wasn't in danger it unnerved me for days and I was á fearful whenever walking through the area.
Label: fear

Text: When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could go á there, if I wished, in Summer.
Label: joy

Text: When I learned that my former boyfriend had become engaged - á although I was glad that he had found what he wanted, I was very á sad at my own personal loss, since I had always hoped we might á one day reconcile.
Label: sadness

Text: In the army, an acquaintance of mine tended to use his position á to advance his own interests.
Label: disgust

Text: Being miserable in a party when other people are friendly and á happy.
Label: guilt

Text: After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was á very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.
Label: joy

Text: When I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.
Label: fear

Text: [ When bad and disgusting language is uttered by people, or when á someone tries to show what is beyond his own capacities.]
Label: anger

Text: When I watched TV and saw a performance of \Prince\" (a popidol). á
Label: disgust

Text: When I noticed that my parents were not in such a prosperity as á most people in my surroundings.
Label: sadness

Text: We are repainting rooms in my house. My mother started to enact á plans to paint my room without consulting me.
Label: anger

Text: [ No response.]
Label: guilt

Text: When I was small, I would always fight with my younger sister and á one time I hit her and knocked the wind out of her. I felt real á bad about it.
Label: shame

Text: Yesterday, when the final whistle blew at the final match between á OIS and IFK and it was certain that OIS had won the Swedish á title.
Label: joy

Text: My friend told me in a fairly loud voice the blunders she á committed last night.
Label: shame

Text: Did not finish homework.
Label: shame

Text: When I was found urinating, behind a toilet instead of inside it, á by my class mates and the teachers.  I was told to pick up my own á urine from the wet soil, I did it.
Label: shame

Text: I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.
Label: sadness

Text: I was about to share lunch with my aunt's husband when she told á me that I would have to wait and eat with my cousins.
Label: shame

Text: I once watched the series called \Dynasty\" on TV, and I detested á
Label: disgust

Text: I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.
Label: sadness

Text: Meeting a male friend with whose wife I was having an affair.
Label: guilt

Text: It was winter/spring and the ice was melting.  I was far out on a á jetty and I poked the ice with a long branch to try and break it. á  The branch went through the ice and I fell in, the water closed á in over my head.
Label: fear

Text: When I was admitted to the Sofia University.
Label: joy

Text: When I was selected at TISS X.
Label: joy

Text: On a trip to Santander we wanted to stop at a curve because a á friend was sick, and the car skidded of the gravel.
Label: fear

Text: I had lunch with my ex-boyfriend and did not mention it to my á fiancee.  I felt guilty despite the fact that I felt nothing for á my ex-boyfriend.
Label: guilt

Text: At a party, on New Year's Eve, I met on old friend whom I had not á seen for some time
Label: joy

Text: After masturbation.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was unable to respond to a welcome in my indigenous á language of Maori at an important function where I was the only á woman in the group and it was expected of me.
Label: shame

Text: When I realized that I loved someone of the opposite sex.
Label: joy

Text: Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what I á was the witness of, caused anger in me.
Label: anger

Text: When the cast general election resulted in Norway getting a á conservative government.
Label: shame

Text: My first kiss.
Label: joy

Text: I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace á when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves á that I have fallen in love with him.
Label: anger

Text: When I was very young, one day, I kicked my grandmother and á caused her an injury which took a long time to heal.
Label: guilt

Text: I was with a group of people and everybody told me to do or say á something.  It was a confusing, strong and traumatic situation á for me.
Label: shame

Text: They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.
Label: anger

Text: [ No response.]
Label: guilt

Text: When I watched a film about the problems of abandoned children á (PIXOTE).
Label: disgust

Text: When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not á know.
Label: anger

Text: When my B.A results had not come.
Label: fear

Text: When I heard about the disaster in Bophal (India).
Label: disgust

Text: At the seaside, when a wave suddenly came and took off my bikini.
Label: shame

Text: I felt fear when my mother was heavily ill.
Label: fear

Text: Reading a nice book and talking about it to my friend.
Label: joy

Text: When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him á understand I felt miserable.
Label: sadness

Text: When I just took a shower with a girl down the hall. I felt that á I had let my devotion to God go out the window. Although nothig á happened I felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: Going to Chico to visit a friend.
Label: joy

Text: I won the first prize at the science fair, the first of the kind á at school and I was only in form II then.
Label: joy

Text: While quarreling with my brother I broke the glass door of the á cupboard and a china doll.  We were scolded by my father for á breaking the door but we did not tell him about the door.
Label: guilt

Text: Receiving notification that I had made a successful application á to the Speech Therapy course at Uni, gave me a very good feelig á of achievment and joy.
Label: joy

Text: Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friends á was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming á in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and á prevent the accident.
Label: fear

Text: My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway á if I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back I á start thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and are á perhaps dead.
Label: fear

Text: When I was reprimanded by the manager of the hotel where I á worked during Autumn 1984.
Label: fear

Text: A month ago when one of my fellow workers got a promotion over á me. It was just a small promotion but recognition was involved.
Label: anger

Text: When I felt the smell of industries that pollute.
Label: disgust

Text: When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and á which I had listened before together with friends.
Label: sadness

Text: It was when I failed standard 8 exams while all my friends á passed and went to secondary school. In class I was always á getting more marks than they did.
Label: sadness

Text: Passing by a good friend's home without coming in to visit him.
Label: guilt

Text: My father suddenly fell ill and died.
Label: sadness

Text: [ No response.]
Label: disgust

Text: I was very sad when I heard that my Auntie had passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: When I got 1 mark in an Abnormal Psychology exam.
Label: shame

Text: In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of the á opinion that we were not involved and she misjudged our reactions á as negative. We however only posed several questions which she á couldn't answer.
Label: anger

Text: When I was young - 14, I pinched from a store and was caught.  á The store then contacted my parents.
Label: guilt

Text: When other people refuse to do their house jobs and give the á work to someone else.
Label: disgust

Text: Not doing well in the examn.
Label: shame

Text: My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and á sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and á when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad á about that.
Label: guilt

Text: When I had not prepared my contribution to the group as á thoroughly as the other members, with the result that the á overall result was poor.
Label: shame

Text: A close friend of mine was to get married in a weeks time when á her father died of a heart-attack.  I knew him well and felt bad á on hearing of his death.
Label: sadness

Text: I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.
Label: sadness

Text: I was very ashamed when I failed a test in Standard 7. The á teacher told the other students to shout and laugh at me.
Label: shame

Text: When I passed my MSCE Exams and was selected to go to college.
Label: joy

Text: When a person whom I loved and admired a lot died.  I felt empty, á lonely, helpless, without support, not knowing what to do.
Label: sadness

Text: I was very sad when I was shouted at by Uncle and was told that I á was not to be given school fees because I didn't go to work in á the garden since I had gone to escort my sister to the bus depot.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was operated on the knee and had to go through rehabilitation.
Label: fear

Text: Had fear of losing husband.
Label: fear

Text: A father helping his kid to fight other kids.
Label: anger

Text: At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I had á to learn all on my own.
Label: anger

Text: I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics. á Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained and á started to cry. I grew angry.
Label: anger

Text: When the girl with whom I am in love smiles at me.
Label: joy

Text: When I forgot to cook something that my mother had told me to, á and at supper time the food that I was supposed to have prepared á was not there.
Label: guilt

Text: When my boyfriend openly let me down, preferring another girl.
Label: sadness

Text: When you kill yourself with work and see the number of slakers á wandering around, doing nothing.
Label: anger

Text: I did not do well in one of the subjects last term.   I was á afraid that I would fail.  My result was a grade D, though it was á not good I still passed.  I felt more comfortable then.
Label: fear

Text: Whenever I see poverty and starvation. I live in an affluent á society and am privileged to have many opportunities.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was young I got lost on the street and the police found me á after a day.
Label: fear

Text: In 1977, my grandfather, to whom I had a very close relationship, á died.
Label: sadness

Text: When I stole a book in class and the teacher caught me, the rest á of the class laughed at my attempt.
Label: shame

Text: I felt it when I felt that I was being observed as an object of á pleasure (sexual) when I opened and took off a shirt in a á classroom at P.V.C.
Label: shame

Text: I felt guilty about talking negatively, and agreeing with a á person who was doing likewise, about a non-present third person.
Label: guilt

Text: I once caught a letter in my girlfriend's handbag from a certain á man. I felt anger.
Label: anger

Text: I made dinner for some friends and they appreciated it very much.
Label: joy

Text: I hate the behaviour of my so called friends, they use bad á language, spit, boast and treat the youngsters badly.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was working in Delhi, I had gone alone to see the hostel á where I would be residing.
Label: fear

Text: A new gas connection was to be installed and the mechanic who came á to do it was very rude to my mother and me.  I rushed to thhe á dealer with my mother and had a fight with the dealer as he á seemed to be unreasonable and was taking the mechanic's side.  á Ultimately the matter was resolved after my father went and spoke á to him.  The mechanic was asked to apologize.
Label: anger

Text: When I was in primary 6, my father died.  I was very young then á and did not know what had happened.  The weeping of my relatives á and my tears made me sad.
Label: sadness

Text: My friend often played a joke on me and sometimes I thought that á he was a nonsensical person. Once when we went to a friend's á house he walked in first and shut the door firmly behind him.  I á felt that he did not respect me and moreover I was his friend so á he should not have behaved like that.  I was very angry (as it is á I was in a bad mood then).
