Label: anger

Text: After studying a lot for my H.S.C exams, I could not make it to á the medical stream and I felt sad about this.
Label: sadness

Text: Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her á for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking á \the same language\"- meaning an inspiring discussion and á
Label: joy

Text: When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and á soul.
Label: joy

Text: When I as a Pakeha (white) new Zealander, was just as racially á prejudiced as other people whom I had condemned.
Label: shame

Text: When someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore and á that she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchange á for the ones I had given her.
Label: sadness

Text: Arguing about price with private shop-assistant.
Label: shame

Text: When I boxed my child's ears.
Label: shame

Text: I went to see a friend. There were other people, too, and á everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought á nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything á - although I knew how he felt.
Label: shame

Text: When I got through the examination for my driver licence, and á when I finished I knew I had passed it.
Label: joy

Text: The exam was drawing near and I wanted to prepare for it.  But I á had a lot of other things to do so I did not have much time to prepare  á for the exams.  Whenever I sat down to study I was scared that I would  á not be able to finish it.
Label: fear

Text: When I was deputy manager during the Summer, certain deputies á took liberties, more than what was normal.
Label: anger

Text: When I went up the stairs in a high, dark house full of shadows, á passed a door and had the feeling that someone or something was á behind me, although I knew I was alone.
Label: fear

Text: There was a time when my room looked terribly untidy; just at á that time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent her á from entering the room.
Label: shame

Text: Not doing well in an examn which was easy.
Label: shame

Text: I was coming home from a relative's place and it was about á 9.30/10 P.M.  I felt slightly apprehensive when I got off the bus á and started walking towards my place.  I was confident that á nothing would happen to me, yet there was this slight feeling of á fear.
Label: fear

Text: Inventing a fictitious series of events, as a result of which I á ended up in a conflict with my two closest friends.
Label: guilt

Text: When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the á thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had á thought.
Label: joy

Text: A friend of mine that is abroad undertook recently an axam to á enter on University in Dallas, and was approved.
Label: joy

Text: Death of a close friend.
Label: sadness

Text: After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I á passed my last exam.
Label: joy

Text: Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue á duty as a soldier.
Label: fear

Text: When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend our á holiday together.
Label: joy

Text: We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.
Label: sadness

Text: Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.
Label: guilt

Text: When a friend wouldn't speak to me and wouldn't tell me why.
Label: anger

Text: One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story, nobody á took it seriously but I got frightened.
Label: fear

Text: The weekend after I argued with my parents I went home again and á they couldn't have been nicer. As soon as I walked in, Mum kissed á me, then Dad, and thanked me for the birthday presents I'd left á for him, including a very sentimental birthday card.
Label: joy

Text: My apartment has had three robberies in the last month. The guy á upstairs just got robbed making it the fourth.
Label: fear

Text: [ I had, by being silent, disapproved my love and made him á unhappy.  He had not been able to keep his promise.  I thus was á thinking about my own conduct towards another person.]
Label: guilt

Text: When I went for the first time in my life to a nudist-beach.
Label: shame

Text: When I was stopped by plain clothes policemen because the car I á was driving had overturned on the Avenue.  I had been driving too á fast, and I was afraid when I was stopped, questionned and then á toild to go.  The situation ended happily since there were no á consequences.
Label: fear

Text: A \near-accident\" in a car, driving too fast on an icy road."
Label: fear

Text: When I received the mark well above requirements for the course I á wanted to enter, yet I was not accepted - anger at the injustice á of it, because I didn't receive early release of H.S.C. marks.
Label: anger

Text: When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I should á do something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped. á Then she threatens: I'll do it myself.
Label: anger

Text: In a sexual experience with an unknown woman where after the á sexual act I only could go away without looking backwards.
Label: disgust

Text: When I found a letter addressed \To Mum\" by my son, 6 months á
Label: shame

Text: That was what I felt when I was finally accepted in the Bulgarian á Conservatorie after I had applied a couple of years.
Label: joy

Text: When my sister left home to go and live with her husband.
Label: sadness

Text: General Ye Jianying died.
Label: sadness

Text: Breaking an implicit promise.
Label: shame

Text: When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home á because she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by a á man. But it remained undone.
Label: guilt

Text: When I heard a rumour that the 1st year exam results were out. I á had fear that I might be one of the failures.
Label: fear

Text: Failed to recagnize a friend on the street.
Label: shame

Text: A few days back my mother was not feeling too well and still did á all the house work.  I felt guilty as I had not offered to help.
Label: guilt

Text: A certain friend evokes positive feelings, when I am with him but á negative feelings when he is not present. I feel the need to á express those negative feelings. However, when I speak about him, á I always think: Why do I like this, he does not deserve this, but á still I do so.
Label: guilt

Text: When my boyfriend was changing his behavior there was something á wrong, I felt sad, because it's desagreable when a relationship á is ending.
Label: sadness

Text: Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.
Label: sadness

Text: Getting terrible meals, but paying heaps for them.
Label: anger

Text: I felt disgusted when I was in a helpless position at the loss of á my fiancee.
Label: disgust

Text: When, after a long time of searching I got my first job.
Label: joy

Text: When my boyfriend was away, I flirted with his best friend; I á felt guilty the next day.
Label: guilt

Text: When I saw an accident where the man lost his head.
Label: disgust

Text: Finding myself alone in a public toilet block with a man known to á have had great psychological disturbances.
Label: fear

Text: I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant, á since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.
Label: anger

Text: Swearing in public.
Label: shame

Text: I felt a sense of shame when I compromised a colleague of mine. I á got an information from him which I quite out of place shared á with another colleague of mine and it resulted in an unpleasant á consequence for him.
Label: shame

Text: When a friend of mine told me a horror story.
Label: fear

Text: When I was just to be divorced.
Label: fear

Text: I can't remember ever feeling shame.
Label: shame

Text: Once I worked as a designer. A fitter was hard hit in a damage á that occurred at the building site I had designed.
Label: guilt

Text: Someone smoking on Electric train (Electric trains are á non-smoking) with alcohol smell coming from person.
Label: disgust

Text: When going out I am threatened regularly by two punk-girls.
Label: fear

Text: When I was a child, I was sometimes forced to eat things that á disgusted me.
Label: disgust

Text: I told my boy friend not to park in a certain place because the á car would ger towed away - he didn't listen and it was towed away. á At that stage, our finances were below the poverty line & it á cost us $10.00 - all the money we had to get us through that week á (including rent).
Label: anger

Text: Two years back someone invited me to be the tutor of her á grand-daughter.  The grand-daughter asked me some questions in á mathematics so I taught her.  However she did not listen to me á and this made me feel unhappy.  The second year it was the same.  á When I entered university the girl's parents suggested that I be á employed as their daghters tutor.  They told me that at university  á there was no homework and I would have a lot of time so they á made a time-table  for me which required me to be the tutor five á days a week.  They did not respect me and anyway I had another á child to teach.
Label: anger

Text: T.V features showing the violation of defenceless people.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was 10/11 years old my father travelled very much for his á work (he passed three months away from home).
Label: sadness

Text: A month ago I turned in an English paper in late after I had á already had a previous paper late and promised not to do it á again.
Label: shame

Text: The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those close á to me.(blaming us and lying)
Label: anger

Text: At an anti-pornography meeting, when samples from films and á magazines were shown.
Label: disgust

Text: Now that the 49ers are winners, the fans are coming out of the á woodwork and jumping on the bandwagon and that disgusts me.
Label: disgust

Text: Recently, I left my bag in the car of someone who picked me up á while hitch-hiking. I spent some effort to find out where he á lived (I succeeded).
Label: shame

Text: A friend of mine called me when I was not at home.  I phoned her á back to know what she wanted and she told me that she had dialled á the wrong number.
Label: sadness

Text: A teacher giving a test was called by a student by his first á name. He (the teacher) said that he didn't give him this liberty.
Label: disgust

Text: Walking in the dark and thinking about ghost stories.
Label: fear

Text: It was in 1983 September when MCE results were being announced on á the radio. When I heard my name that I had done well I just kept á quiet. I was so happy that I couldn't even talk.
Label: joy

Text: I met my best friend's husband with a prostitute.
Label: disgust

Text: Once I was very frightened at night as I had a very fearful and á terrifying dream, I could not go back to sleep for a long time.
Label: fear

Text: When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was á necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing á him because he is so dear to me.
Label: fear

Text: I suffer from a disease of my muscles. Therefore, I am only able á to attend lectures for half a day. So, sometimes I miss á obligatory lectures. However, the teachers do not take into á account my disease, and punish me with detention work, resulting in á an overload.
Label: anger

Text: In Ward 1A was an epileptic patient who was burnt the whole body á and was stinking very much such that the whole ward was affected. á Few people could come near him.
Label: disgust

Text: I had fixed a meeting with my classmates and I missed it as I was á tired.  Besides everyone at the meeting was a stranger to me and á I did not want to make friends with them.  Whatever the reasons - I  á felt guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: Being told that I have not got a personality.
Label: anger

Text: Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent á as they are when you are young.
Label: sadness

Text: A professor was going to read aloud in class a composition of á mine in which I had criticized some political attitudes and also á some class-mates.   I was ashamed at having written that.
Label: shame

Text: I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did not á accept my Visa !
Label: shame

Text: After my marriage I received the B.Sc results by post, I was very á happy to learn that I had got very good marks - first class.
Label: joy

Text: When I failed the grade seven exams.
Label: shame

Text: When I made love with someone who I didn't really love. Sometimes á I even considered him unlikable.
Label: disgust

Text: I did not reply to my friend's letter in time.
Label: guilt

Text: When caught shoplifting and the police were called in parents á also informed.
Label: shame

Text: A child was admitted in hospital with Meningitis. I was asked to á do lumber puncture to obtain Celebral Spinal fluid for diagnostic á purposes. Since the condition was already bad, the child died as á soon as I finished the procedure.
Label: guilt

Text: I had to terminate a training because I wasn't suited for it. I á was very sad about this, because I very much wanted to finish á that training.
Label: sadness

Text: Recently a good friend only called me when he needed something. á He never said \please\" or \"thank you\" or any other kind word."
Label: anger

Text: When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed á only helplessness and indecision.
Label: disgust

Text: A few weeks ago I thought about an exam I had to take soon. I á remembered this just before I had to go to sleep. I felt guilt á because at the beginning of the year I planned to succeed.
Label: guilt

Text: I am ashamed at myself sometimes when I am working with á handicapped people and don't wish to be seen in public with them.
Label: shame

Text: In a certain book I read about cruelties and violence in prison á and souteneur circles; I felt especially disgusted when I read á detailed descriptions of physical and mental torture of less á powerful people.
Label: disgust

Text: The death of my mother-in-law after a long sick-bed. at the á moment of dying I was with her.
Label: sadness

Text: When my dress and a few other things were stolen from my á wardrobe.
Label: anger

Text: When my grandfather died.
Label: sadness

Text: A meeting and a conversation with a woman (somewhat elder than á me) who considers me as her child (she also has one child of her á own). Last two years I lived with her (no relationship).
Label: joy

Text: A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, and á therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.
Label: anger

Text: Flicking through a magazine showing pictures of homosexual men á committing various acts.
Label: disgust

Text: When I passed the B.A exams and my parents allowed me to carry on á my studies and do a M.A. , I was very happy.
Label: joy

Text: Felt ashamed when in a group conversation and could not á understand words or comprehend the topic of discussion.
Label: shame

Text: Not getting on with someone of my classmates in high school.
Label: sadness

Text: When an earlier friend was spreading negative rumours about me.
Label: sadness

Text: When I went to the pub with a large group of friends, we drank á and danced.
Label: joy

Text: Birds had made nests in our thatched roof and they were flying á and flapping their wings in the bedroom at night.  It was very á dark and I could not even see my nose.  I did not know that it á was the birds till my mother told me so.
Label: fear

Text: When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His á legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I á came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few á days later he died.
Label: sadness

Text: A close relative of mine underwent a difficult operation, and everything á turned out fine.
Label: joy

Text: [ Never experienced.]
Label: disgust

Text: Finding out some people had been talking about me at my back.
Label: disgust

Text: I didn't keep a promise I had made to a man, and in this way I á lost his esteem and confidence in me. I caused him a lot of á trouble.
Label: guilt

Text: A girl whom I hadn't seen for a period of time told me that she á had been pregnant and had an abortion - I was the father.
Label: guilt

Text: After seeing an \uncertain\" child work on a model for several á
Label: anger

Text: Our teacher had invited us to lunch and once at the canteen we á started introducing ourselves.  Two of the boys showed a lot of á interest in knowing personal details and then they started á talking about some activities held in the college.  I had little á interest in those activities so I talked to another student á sitting next to me as I was afraid that they would ask me á questions on those activities.
Label: shame

Text: I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry á examination.
Label: joy

Text: I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problems á and failed attempts at reconciliation.  My sadness was caused by á the irreversibility of the decision.
Label: sadness

Text: Someone not responding to my criticism.
Label: disgust

Text: Caught cheating on a diet.
Label: shame

Text: When I sit for examinations.
Label: fear

Text: When I was twelve I was babysitting some children but I did not á act very responsibly and one of them was injured.
Label: shame

Text: A situation where we were the center of attention, and things á happened without my control on them, that showed our disagreement, á and ignorance.
Label: shame

Text: I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me, á that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually her husband could á not stand that any more and wanted to kill me.
Label: fear

Text: I had an exam and I had it well prepared.  I did the first part á very well but did not know the second part.
Label: anger

Text: When I was molested by an old drunk man.
Label: disgust

Text: I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I had á trusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father. á I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this á emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can á happen in this world.
Label: disgust

Text: When my cousin passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: As a child I suffered of nightmares. Even since than, I have á never been so anxious and fearful.
Label: fear

Text: Family discord and uneasiness due to something I did not á communicate on time.
Label: guilt

Text: I was disgusted when I was told to dress a big rotten stinky á wound which, coming closer, made me feel like vomitting.
Label: disgust

Text: I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed by á the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly á small distance.
Label: fear

Text: When my mother found me in her bedroom \stealing\" sugar in her á
Label: guilt

Text: A certain night during initiation.
Label: fear

Text: Asking someone to give me back the money I once lend him because á I needed it myself.
Label: shame

Text: I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking about á our problems, I told her lies.
Label: shame

Text: When my uncle died.
Label: sadness

Text: When I met a girl and asked her for a date and she agreed, (I á thought this girl would never like me), this was an emotion of á joy.
Label: joy

Text: A friend had promised to call me at a certain time. I expected á his call impatiently but in vain.
Label: anger

Text: When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many á people about my applying for this institute and I decided to á prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any á preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.
Label: joy

Text: A friend of mine told me that I had passed the entrance exam to á the university.
Label: joy

Text: Having passed the exam required to be an authorized Radio/TV á dealer.
Label: joy

Text: Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a á few days before and then one morning it was gone.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt joy most strongly some years ago, when I took part in a á NH Competition and I was the first.
Label: joy

Text: When I was very young, one day, I was in the street with my á father and brother.   While my father was talking to some á friends, I saw a dog and began to pat it.  My father told me á sharply to stop doing it because the dog had mange.  Then my á brother told me that I would die and I could not stop crying á after this.
Label: fear

Text: When I was pointed out as a problem child in primary school and á my mother took the teacher's point of view.
Label: anger

Text: I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed, so I was depressed    á at every menstruation.
Label: sadness

Text: I learnt from the newspaper that I had been accepted at the á Chinese university of H.K.  It was 7 o'clock in the morning.  á Later I told my family and relatives about it and had tea with á them very joyfully.
Label: joy

Text: I was really hoping that I would pass the examination, but I á failed and so I felt very sad.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was walking down the street, some boys showed me a knife á and stole all my money.
Label: fear

Text: My elder brother often criticizes my mother's cooking.  Once he á did it very impolitely and lost his temper.  This made all of us á very sad.  I was very angry and I scolded him.  He asked me not á to interfere with what was his buisness.
Label: anger

Text: When my father's car got stolen from me. (A 1966 Ford Mustang - á very hard to replace).
Label: guilt

Text: I had to pay a fine because of speeding.
Label: shame

Text: When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty of á medicine.
Label: joy

Text: Someone vomited on the street.
Label: disgust

Text: [ No response.]
Label: guilt

Text: I feel disgust towards those who are responsible for the death of á others.
Label: disgust

Text: When my dog died.  I had reared it for nearly three years.  It á had been ill for several days and had not eaten anything.  One á morning I found it dead.
Label: sadness

Text: Feeling inadequate in a group situation, being unable to convey á my own thoughts and feelings.
Label: shame

Text: This week I was phoned by an old friend with whom I lost contact á a few years ago.
Label: joy

Text: A girl who also hires a room in the house where I live always á tries to make a quarrel with everyone available she disgusts me.
Label: disgust

Text: Bad food in the students' dining hall.
Label: anger

Text: When I lost my grandmother.  She had been my guardian after the á death of my father.
Label: sadness

Text: I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the end á of my bed coming up my bed at me. I was really angry, told him to á get out. He was surprised, hesitated; I started to move towards á him and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly, but firmly to á go. Because I'd got the initiative, I succeeded. A very powerful á message.
Label: anger

Text: Hearing of a filthy situation over the phone.
Label: disgust

Text: When my grandmother died.
Label: sadness

Text: Defying my parents and staying out all night when I wasn't á supposed to.
Label: shame

Text: Receiving a much wanted letter from a very good friend who lives á abroad.
Label: joy

Text: I went out with my sister, her boyfriend and his friend. I did á not like this young man. But suddenly he overcame me and kissed á me. He was very strong so that I could not defend myself.
Label: disgust

Text: When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to á approach me.
Label: disgust

Text: When my behaviour was immoral - thinking about sex.
Label: guilt

Text: One day I addressed my husband in an abusive manner in front of á his friends.  Later on I realized this myself and felt ashamed of á myself.
Label: shame

Text: When I left all my friends at school (break up) knowing we would á probably all go our separate ways, and none see one another for a á long time.
Label: sadness

Text: After a jogging session I had severe abdominal cramps and this á lead to my wanting to empty my bladder.  My friends gathered á around me and two of them had to help me to the toilet.  I was á ashamed at having to go to the toilet in the presence of my á friends.
Label: shame

Text: When I was back home after a long time, meeting beloved people á and close friends.
Label: joy

Text: Saw something stupid and ignorant happening in the countryside.
Label: shame

Text: When unjustified hurting other people.
Label: shame

Text: I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague á of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good á notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know á why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was á on the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.
Label: guilt

Text: I went to the school library and asked for a book, but the á librarian told me that there wasn't such. However when an other á colleague asked for it she gave it to him.
Label: anger

Text: When I was caught going out with another girl by my girlfriend.
Label: guilt

Text: When my present boyfriend asked me initially to go out with him I á had waited a long time for this to occur.
Label: joy

Text: I had studied for almost one week for my physics-examination. á With difficulty I passed the examn. I was angry about the teacher á and also about myself because I had not remembered enough during á the examn and because the time that I spent studying was wasted.
Label: anger

Text: My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise á birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along á too.
Label: joy

Text: Managed to run 30 Km on skis fairly simply.
Label: joy

Text: Being chosen to do your experiment with aphasia.
Label: joy

Text: I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost á for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the á hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I á felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to á me, of the unknown.
Label: fear

Text: Being in a Malaysian city with my girlfriend coming out of a á picture theatre - seeing her rush up to a taxi that a very old á sick man was trying to get to. Seeing her take over the taxi.
Label: disgust

Text: When my mother met with a serious accident and there was danger á that she would not survive and if she did she would loose á her memory.
Label: fear

Text: Not finishing homework in time.
Label: guilt

Text: When I went to report a stolen good at the police station, the á woman-officer-in-charge was very rude and did not seem to have á respect for anyone.
Label: disgust

Text: Car accident. Travelling as a passenger along narrow bitumen road á at night - trying to overtake semi-trailer. The truck pulled over á onto our side and we hit the wet dirt, swerved back into the á truck, back onto the verge, over a guide post and into a ditch.
Label: fear

Text: When I was little - Mum caught me telling a lie about who broke á the cup.
Label: shame

Text: A condition in which I was disgusted followed when I lost money á on my way home from the college.
Label: disgust

Text: When a soppy poem that I had written to a boy was found and every á one read it and started teasing me about it.
Label: shame

Text: I went singing with a group of young people on January 6th (The á three Magi), a local custom called \star singing\". One of the girls, my á
Label: anger

Text: When I went to visit a friend in the hospital. She had to undergo á an operation for rupture. I was glad to hear that the operation á succeeded and that she was relieved of her pain.
Label: joy

Text: When I was starting in romance with my husband, we went out to á curt, and we stayed in the car \making love\". At the time I was á
Label: guilt

Text: When I was mistakenly accused of being a thief when I accidently á gave a fake coin at a counter.  I realized this before I handed á over the coin, but the man called me a thief and called a á witness.
Label: anger

Text: When I failed my Primary school leaving Examinations. I never á thought I would fail. When I heard I had failed I really felt á ashamed of myself.
Label: shame

Text: When someone I trusted very much, disappointed me.
Label: anger

Text: Disappointed by a friend.
Label: sadness

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never my á mother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feel á when we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I felt á I'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid and á guilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.
Label: guilt

Text: When I woke up after a night of drinking I couldn't remember and á discovered several untoward things had occurred.
Label: shame

Text: I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and á directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it á rolled by and hit me.
Label: fear

Text: I went to practice in Sweden during summer, and I was afraid that á I would not do well.
Label: fear

Text: A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.
Label: joy

Text: The death of my grandmother.
Label: sadness

Text: I flet shameful when I learnt that I cooked Nsima which was full á of lamps in it.
Label: shame

Text: I had a quarrell with my boyfriend and decided to finish with him á and and my Easter holidays.
Label: sadness

Text: Saw a man dressed as a woman.
Label: disgust

Text: A large german shepherd dog ran and barked at me (he didn't bite á fortunately).
Label: fear

Text: I felt very guilty when a student, sitting in front of me in the á exam, asked me a few questions and I did not show him the answers, á  though I knew them.á
Label: guilt

Text: Following heavy stirring / ridiculing a close friend who was á very vulnerable to such attack - inspiring fierce, defensive á counter-attack.
Label: shame

Text: After making a joke about a friend's marriage that was too á personal.
Label: shame

Text: I was in love with a very beautiful girl and when I went back for á my holidays I found her wth another guy who she said was just a á friend.  Later I found them together and was convinced that there á was something fishy.
Label: anger

Text: When I was robbed in a bus.
Label: anger

Text: Nearby the end of the year my wife and I were having a car ride, á when it appears another vehicle, driven by a drunk driver and á provokes an accident.
Label: anger

Text: Was caught stealing apples in a neighbor's garden.
Label: shame

Text: Can't remember any such feelings now.
Label: disgust

Text: Betraying someone's trust.
Label: guilt

Text: I was in the house at night and I heard a hyena crying outside. á It cried for almost an hour and I feared it might break the á window and enter inside the house.
Label: fear

Text: It was at Malawi Army, Dormer Squadron, when some of my workmates á got promoted to Seargents (sgts); we were having similar á Ranks.
Label: anger

Text: My boyfriend finished our relationship when I started studying á psychology in Nijegen, because then we would not be able to meet á frequently anymore.
Label: sadness

Text: I feared that I would have to describe my sexual life to an á older, strange woman.
Label: shame

Text: Looking for the toilet in a dark place.
Label: fear

Text: When I had an argument with my best friend and I thought that I á was right and she was not.
Label: anger

Text: We had arranged a beach party with 20 people. There my father got á drunk I felt very ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: When I was at school, no one thought I could pass my MCE so at á the end of the year my name was announced on the radio that I had á passed. I was the happiest person.
Label: joy

Text: Was threatened with a knife ... in the military by soldiers form á another unit. The reason was girls.
Label: fear

Text: An acquaintance of mine revealed himself in a light unexpected to á me.
Label: disgust

Text: My father was very angry with me, and I locked me up in the á shower. Then my father knocked his fist through the door, I was á scared to death.
Label: fear

Text: After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of á support and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.
Label: sadness

Text: I remember when I was a child of a storm that made me terribly á afraid. I thought that the house was coming down and that in the á next day I would be dead. Everybody was awake and I stayed all á night in bed without falling asleep.
Label: fear

Text: When biking and I felt very bad (problems with heart and á respiration).
Label: fear

Text: A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.  I was sad á when I realized how easy it is to forget something that one had á once regarded as great and significant.
Label: sadness

Text: Next door nieghbour ran over his cat in driveway, he tried to á finish it off with a flat shovel. I would have taken cat to á veterinary to either kill humanely or cure.
Label: disgust

Text: I was very sad when I heard that my brother had failed the á standard 8 exams for the third time.
Label: sadness

Text: When our dog died.
Label: sadness

Text: [ When I acted against my mind or conscious.]
Label: shame

Text: That afternoon I received two messages informing me, one that my á brother was in a coma in the U.T.H suffering (kidney disease) and á two, that my uncle met with an accident on his way to the hospital á  to see my brother.
Label: sadness

Text: My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drank á an enormous amount of spirit.  This was dangerous  and he did á not understand that he had done anything wrong.
Label: anger

Text: [ No response.]
Label: disgust

Text: When I had a psychical crisis, I met a girl, who told me that she á had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome á them.
Label: joy

Text: My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them á in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I á couldn't play them again.
Label: anger

Text: Bus conductor insulted me for not buying a ticket (I forgot).
Label: anger

Text: During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing an á ear-ring.
Label: shame

Text: I was drinking a glass of wine and eating something when there á suddenly appeared pictures about the famine in some parts of á Africa.
Label: shame

Text: My boyfriend didn't turn up after promising that he was coming.
Label: sadness

Text: When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he á knows needs doing.
Label: anger

Text: When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.
Label: shame

Text: [ This emotion has never been an intense one, that makes it á difficult to recall it.]
Label: anger

Text: When my grandmother passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: It made me very sad to hear that some construction company was á going to build houses on the beautiful hills by my house.
Label: sadness

Text: When people would tell me that my ex-girlfriend was playing á around on me.
Label: anger

Text: I tried after months to begin talking to my boyfriend again. He á ignored me. I felt I had lowered my pride and became his á \doormat\"."
Label: shame

Text: Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 other á friends.
Label: joy

Text: I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and having á an argument. I was being stubborn and proud, and selfish, because á my friend let me down, through no fault of her own.
Label: guilt

Text: I had promised to do a task for someone that was close to me, and á from the outset I knew it was important that I do it, but when it á came to it, I let them down.
Label: guilt

Text: My father dying.
Label: sadness

Text: Someone who always took care for the key of the sportshall stayed á away without letting us know. Next time he did as if nothing had á happened.
Label: anger

Text: When I had to undergo the final examination of secondary school, á I lived together with a girlfriend. We both were afraid to fail, á but it appeard that we both had passed.
Label: joy

Text: While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of á cows.
Label: fear

Text: Stranded in the north of Fraser Island with a submerged 4 WD hire á vehicle.
Label: fear

Text: After having quarelled unnecessarily and without any reason, and á having been stupidly cross in every way.
Label: shame

Text: I wrote a letter to my boyfriend but he couldn't answer it in á time so as a defence mechanism I just found that I felt so sad á about it and couldn't talk to anyone.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt disgust after watching a picture on television about á torturing political prisoners in India (this happened in the á India of Indira Ghandi).
Label: disgust

Text: When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was á unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not á surpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.
Label: joy

Text: Not collecting homeworks in time to give the teacher.
Label: shame

Text: It was last week on Sunday that I was walking with my girlfriend á along Kawale road going to town so I tried to stop a car for a á lift and the driver didn't stop and I felt shame because people á were looking at us.
Label: shame

Text: I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, but á I realized that I was not wanted.  I felt hurt, disappointed, á lonely and deserted.
Label: sadness

Text: I insulted my friend for a small reason and after time I realised á that I was wrong and felt ashamed; everytime I meet her I feel á ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: When I impregnated a certain girl, I thought that I would be á forced to marry her or go to court.
Label: fear

Text: I took an exam which I failed terribly as I had not studied.
Label: shame

Text: I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers á dropped out.
Label: anger

Text: As a passenger in a vehicle travelling from the steep side of á Arthur's Pass in the middle of a sleet-storm, icy roads, sheer á chasms to one side, sheer face to the other.
Label: fear

Text: I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at a á social one night, which one of my relative was involved. My fear á was greatly for him because he was being assaulted badly.
Label: fear

Text: Once I arrived two hours late to my work place (a bank) and I was á still feeling feeble and tired.
Label: shame

Text: The shooting started and we all lay down to protect ourselves á from the flying bullets.  This incident occured on our way to á Feira, during the Zambia army patrols in the Rhodesia war.
Label: fear

Text: I missed the last tram home and had to walk in the pouring rain.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was in Bombay one of my good friends was getting married á and he had not informed me about it, this made me sad.
Label: sadness

Text: The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosis á to my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL á (A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.
Label: anger

Text: My best friend betrayed me and told other people my secrets.
Label: anger

Text: A girl, who is a friend of mine was having an affair with a boy á who is also a friend of mine.  I got to know that this girl was á also seeing another guy.  Later on, she just broke off with this friend á of mine without giving any explanations.  This made him sad and á depressed, and I felt disgust for this girl.
Label: disgust

Text: I was disgusted at the university wanting some of us to travel á from our homes to the lectures here every day.  The way the whole á thing was handled disgusted me.
Label: disgust

Text: A conflict with a pupil and there were probatory teachers á present.
Label: shame

Text: It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with a á boyfriend, I had broken the relationship for some reasons. á Meanwhile, as I felt it, I had most sorrow.
Label: sadness

Text: When I walked to church with my roommate, a bum told us to call á the police and he started following us.
Label: fear

Text: When I was insulted by a man.
Label: anger

Text: When I first heard \I like you !\" from my boyfriend."
Label: joy

Text: I had just masterbated with another boy.
Label: shame

Text: I had a discussion with my wife about an over-weight acquaintance of á our's, about her eating habits and the scars caused by her á pregnancy.
Label: disgust

Text: Borrowed someone else's towel without asking.
Label: guilt

Text: In a rather important exam, when they caught me red handed á copying.
Label: fear

Text: A person I really like left for overseas for a few months, I had á hoped to go out with her soon.
Label: sadness

Text: When my grandmother died of cancer.
Label: sadness

Text: I had an intimate relation with my boyfriend, but unfortunately á we had sexual problems; therefore I deceived him, but I was á ashamed when I told my friend about it.
Label: shame

Text: The day I heard that I passed the high school exam.
Label: joy

Text: When I saw a man who hadn't the lower .... in a car á exhibition. He was passing a handkerchief from inside to outside á of his mouth.
Label: disgust

Text: When my father was imprisoned for burning the house of his á younger brother.
Label: sadness

Text: Once, before I had learnt to swim, I stepped on a slippery slope á where there was a lot of moss and I slipped into the water.  The á water was very deep and I could not stand on my feet.  I sank á and had to use a lot of energy.
Label: fear

Text: The day my boyfriend saw and touched my breasts when I was á without my shirt, only with my pants.
Label: shame

Text: Sometime back, my boyfriend and I were having a walk nearby my á parent's house. Suddenly we met my grandfather and I was á afraid that he would report to my parents.
Label: fear

Text: When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have á been right.
Label: anger

Text: I wrote a difficult Exam at one time while in my Secodary School. á When the results were announced on the radio, I came second out á of 80 students hence I felt joy.
Label: joy

Text: I said something which was against my conscience.
Label: guilt

Text: I was returning from the Universtity at night when I was accosted á by a boy who molested me, passing his hands on my body.
Label: disgust

Text: As I was in a ward one man died and I was instructed to watch the á last offices. But this was my first time to see a dead person - á fear came.
Label: fear

Text: One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer and á took a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter and á used it for her business without my knowledge.
Label: anger

Text: Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with á baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk á convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the á police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.
Label: guilt

Text: When they put the blame on me when I scored the third goal at the á match.
Label: anger

Text: When my grandmother died. She stayed with us until I had the age á of 10. When she died I was 13 and I remember the moment after the á funeral: I sat on the table and cried.
Label: sadness

Text: I had called a boy who had dated me, and told him that I was ill, á while, actually, I didn't want to go out with him, later on, he asked á me if I was feeling better, then I felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: Once at midnight, I was working alone at office and the phone á suddenly rang.
Label: fear

Text: Meeting best friend at the airport (boyfriend) who I had missed á terribly.
Label: joy

Text: Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.
Label: anger

Text: I was catched when, as a little girl, I played tricks. I was very á startled then and wet my pants.
Label: shame

Text: When after a lot of provocation my child threw a plate on the á floor.
Label: anger

Text: It happened that one of my best friends just took my shirt á without my knowledge, I hadn't put it on for many days and I was á short of clothes.
Label: disgust

Text: I talked to my boyfriend on the phone when I was in high spirits á and had a lot to tell him.  I had been looking forward to this á conversation and he did not listen to me to the extent that I á had anticipated.
Label: sadness

Text: I was looking after my father's sheen in the forest. One day á while playing with friends from neighbouring villages the flock á escaped me and went into a far place. It became dark and I was á afraid of father. I went home and hid myself.
Label: fear

Text: My father told me in the letter that my mother is ill.
Label: sadness

Text: A neighbour's girl had disappeared and many people were looking á for her.  Someone had gone to notify the police.  Something had á certainly happened to her.
Label: fear

Text: I was in the living room at home with an ex-boyfriend, it was á nearly a year that we had separated, during the talk he began to á remember our courting and gave me a long kiss.
Label: joy

Text: When I passed the driving test already on the first try, although á I felt more and more uncertain as the day came near.
Label: joy

Text: Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I á trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly á feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in á our fate.
Label: joy

Text: After the fact that made me ashamed I felt sadness.
Label: sadness

Text: Sometime back another girl who was in terms with my ex-boyfriend á came to shout at me at twelve midnight. It was because she á thought I was still interested in the boy.
Label: anger

Text: I found out that someone that I knew had someone else taking á tests for her.
Label: disgust

Text: I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay, my á father took his purse and payed.
Label: joy

Text: I got my driving licence after they had frightened me with it's á difficulty.
Label: joy

Text: This was when I saw, for the first time, a naked woman á (prostitute) run away from a house after having been discovered á by the guardian.
Label: disgust

Text: With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come á with me to an occasion (she was from another town).
Label: anger

Text: In 1972 I failed my Examination because of my own crooky á behaviour of dodging from Examinations.
Label: shame

Text: I felt ashamed when I was confronted by a teaching assistant that á a close friend and I were accused of cheating on a math exam.
Label: shame

Text: Alone in the house (late 8pm) I heard noises. Sounded like someone á was trying to get in our back door.
Label: fear

Text: I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and á companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately á neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.
Label: fear

Text: My room-mate locked up our room without specifying where I would á find the keys.  I had to spend several hours in my other friend's á room.
Label: anger

Text: When I misled a person: I said that I would do her a á favour and didn't.
Label: guilt

Text: I have been thinking of changing my major for a few months.  My á original major was Chinese language and it blocks my way.  I have á to face many problems at the sametime and I do not know what is á real and virtuous.  I do not know if I am not interested in á Chinese or if there are other factors which make me sad.  I am á not very clear on what I can do for the study of Communication á and Journalism.  I am not clear about what I can do.  What are á the limitations ?   I hesitate but I feel more adjusted now.
Label: sadness

Text: A great friend of mine travelled with the intention to change his á life. He didn't succeed and returned depressed. I had not power á to support his frustration and his behavioral change.
Label: guilt

Text: I was on a farm with a few friends and during the talk I á discovered that a friend of mine, was being betrayed by her á boyfriend and a 3rd friend of ours.
Label: anger

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: I do not help out enough at home.
Label: guilt

Text: Not being accepted by classmates in university.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt very lonely, was very dissatisfied with myself when I á realised that I could feel very jealous of other women because á of my boyfriend.
Label: sadness

Text: I read in the newspaper about a 21 yr. old woman who was found á naked and dead along a roadside. It turned out she had had two á relatives 14 and 19 who were kidnapped, raped and killed earlier.
Label: disgust

Text: For example, to feel bad because of one's attire, to be among á people who do not belong to the same social class, to give a á wrong answer in class, to be surprised in particular situations.
Label: shame

Text: I quarrelled with my brothers (twins) at home on saturday.  One á of them studies in a private school and the other one is á repeating his form five.  They do not know what they are doing.  á They follow every word of their teachers, books and systems.  á They always try to rationalize their bad acts by some game and á they are satisfied with their awkward life.  I have tried to á persuade them very often but have failed.  This time I had a á fight as they have no voluntary spirit (they did not polish the á floor).
Label: anger

Text: I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty á days.
Label: joy

Text: One day before Christmas, I went shopping with my brother and his á friend. We had a good time. But on the way home we were almost in á an accident because the weather was bad.
Label: fear

Text: The day that there was a black-out in the city, and I was in an á exposition, I felt fear that something more serious was á happening, like a revolution for example.
Label: fear

Text: When the person that I was very fond of, returned to me.
Label: joy

Text: I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited á because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam á very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.
Label: joy

Text: Two years ago, somebody I like very much wanted to give up his á studies. I tried to make him understand the importance of what he á was going to do, not only of the difficulty to find a job but also á because he will decrease his culture etc. This person made the á test to the college entrance examination and to our great joy we á found out that he succeded in entering at the University.
Label: joy

Text: Someone being arrogant to me.
Label: disgust

Text: When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due á at 1400 hours.
Label: anger

Text: Not beeing able to stay with my mother for the National Day á holiday.
Label: guilt

Text: In the student kitchen that we share, somebody drank from my á juice pot (one litre) so that I only got one glass out of the á whole pot.
Label: anger

Text: Being rude to someone I do not like.
Label: guilt

Text: I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but I á kept forgetting about it.  When they asked me about it, I á promised to do it immediately.  However, I got started only after á a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.
Label: guilt

Text: I happened to see the video-tape movie \This is America - Part á
Label: disgust

Text: Getting a terrible exam mark, which I couldn't understand the á reason for, and trying to see a lecturer or tutor, but being á given the runaround.
Label: anger

Text: When I left my boyfriend. I found another girl at his home but he á did nothing to relieve the situation.
Label: sadness

Text: Crossing a street of several ways the cars began to move and I á thought that I was going to be trampled.
Label: fear

Text: After having been told not to take the car, I took it anyway and á felt guilty about having taken it.
Label: guilt

Text: My boss on the job failed to keep his promise about something he á knew was extremely important to me.
Label: disgust

Text: I came across a girl at the school bus-stop, I had seen her á several friends as she was a friend's friend.  However my friend á had never introduced me to her and when she got off the bus I á smiled at her but she did not respond pretending not to have seen á me.  Her arrogant behaviour made me sick and angry.
Label: anger

Text: When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.
Label: anger

Text: One of my good friends had to migrate to America.  Our friendship á had developed quite well and it was a pity as our friendship would á fade.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt guilty after stealing a cookery book from my colleagues.
Label: guilt

Text: Can't think of any.
Label: shame

Text: When I was accused of something I had not done.
Label: anger

Text: My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years. á His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).
Label: sadness

Text: My room-mate was drunk, he vomited on the floor and fell face á down on the vomit nearly choking himself to death.  Then he á fainted and so I called the first aid.
Label: disgust

Text: When I saw a horrible movie - Alien.
Label: fear

Text: I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informed á about it, I felt joy.
Label: joy

Text: When my wife died in hospital, she was pregnant and had undergone á an operation.
Label: sadness

Text: I was present when they found a shop-keeper dead in his shop.  á He had been shot with a shotgun at close range.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was appointed to position of trust in a group set up to á change the working environment.
Label: joy

Text: Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for á the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas á Years ago.
Label: sadness

Text: [ Cycling in the spring sunshine gives me such delight.  á Happiness is to be healthy, my wonderful finance.  Simply being á here on earth.]
Label: joy

Text: I was bitten by a dog.
Label: fear

Text: I have chosen to put my son in a private school were the á examination marks are low.  Every time that he gives me his term á results I am left with a sense of guilt.
Label: guilt

Text: When a drunkard, in town yelled at me saying that I was a á prostitute.
Label: disgust

Text: I'd just got the top mark in an exam.
Label: joy

Text: My mother, my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and á watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to á turn off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and á started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid á that he would do us a harm.
Label: fear

Text: It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble about á the young people just because I had not immediately left my seat á to them.
Label: anger

Text: I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something á wrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was not á serious and I need not worry.
Label: fear

Text: An invitation to spend 5 days at the seaside with all expenses á paid.
Label: joy

Text: A friend started to insult another person without reason and I á felt ashamed of her behavior.
Label: shame

Text: A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.
Label: disgust

Text: When my uncle gave me my first year's results.  I opened the á envelope and my eyes ran into two \B+\" - in EC110 and M160, this á
Label: joy

Text: I was walking quite quickly and unthinking through a children's á playground, when a toddler ran in front of me I knocked him over á and he hit his head quite hard and began crying.
Label: guilt

Text: I had lunch in a restaurant with a friend and I paid the bill.  á The change was that of a two dollar and a ten cent coin.  As I á was talking with my friend I took the two dollar coin and forgot á to leave a tip.
Label: shame

Text: I had been having a heated argument with a lover - whose á intention was that we should marry in the near future - and was á rejected by her when I started to cry. When I stopped crying for á a moment she said \There, have you got it all out now ?\"."
Label: anger

Text: I felt vvery happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies.  á I had not expected this as I had been ill during the exams.
Label: joy

Text: After confronting the person who stood me up, I blew up and said á all the wrong things.
Label: guilt

Text: I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me á when I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.
Label: shame

Text: I loved a person and he went away. It wasn't necessary that he á left me to reach his goals.
Label: anger

Text: News was spread that I had been found doing sexual intercourse á with a small girl. At first this annoyed me but later on I became á ashamed because many people seemed to believe it.
Label: shame

Text: After blowing up and saying all the wrong things, I realized what á I had done and hurt that person and myself.
Label: sadness

Text: Getting a D in a class last semester and knowing it was because I á didn't study.
Label: guilt

Text: Listening to my roommate boasting about her new clothes.
Label: disgust

Text: Saw my roommate messing up our room.
Label: disgust

Text: I had intercourse with someone and then I realized that what I á had done was wrong and it disgusted me.
Label: disgust

Text: Because I had not studied.
Label: guilt

Text: At the age of 16 I had gone to see a film in a nearby village, á about 8 kms  from my home.  I started walking as there was no á bus.  I had to cross hills and as it was dark I could not á identify the path.  Half way through it started raining and as á there was no shelter I ran four kms to reach home.
Label: fear

Text: When I said good-bye to my girlfriend.  I had spent two years on á developing this relationship and it was unsuccessful, I felt very á sad.
Label: sadness

Text: When I could not attend the college picnic due to some á difficulties.
Label: disgust

Text: I lived alone in a repulsive area in the city of Rotterdam. I was á annoyed, heard a lot of Burglary and assaults. Especially in the evening á and the night I frequently felt anxious.
Label: fear

Text: During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, his á girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my á brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place á for dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if I á had never asked her.
Label: anger

Text: I had gone camping with my old classmates and there was a storm.  á We were in a flurry but at that time I felt the love and concern á of my friends.
Label: joy

Text: Aticle published.
Label: joy

Text: One day when I was a little boy, my friends asked me to play á with them outside and to catch some boys.  However our parents á did not know that we were out and when I got home it was very á late and I feared being scolded by my parents.
Label: fear

Text: I was to meet a girl in a discotheque.  She was very pretty and I á was very happy.  But she did not turn up.  Thank God, there were á some other friends there and I was able to have a more or less á good time.
Label: sadness

Text: Saw the village I come from still pay money to buy wife.
Label: sadness

Text: I thought of myself as being clumsy when I made love for the á first time with a girl.
Label: shame

Text: I promised to fulfill an errand. Later I understood it was á impracticable. The explanation I gave was accompanied by a sense á of guilt.
Label: guilt

Text: At the moment when I heard the result of an examination and it á proved that I succeeded the second year of my study.
Label: joy

Text: I was the last among the list of failures in my class of Biology.
Label: shame

Text: One night we were having a barbecue on the beach and I needed to á go to my car, which was far away from the beach.  It was very á dark as there were no street lamps.  I ran in the dark, very á scared, I ran as fast as possible.
Label: fear

Text: I've always defended my sister when needed, at the expense of my á brother. This has led to feelings of guilt towards him.
Label: guilt

Text: I can't give one description here. I often feel joyful when I á have done things good in relation to other people especially when á my friend says he loves me and I also tell him that I love him.
Label: joy

Text: To have a friend who I didn't see for months, and under the á circumstances that I met him made me feel happy, and perhaps á because it has been one of the good things that I learned with á this friend.
Label: joy

Text: When I got very drunk and really misbehaved at Christmas.
Label: guilt

Text: I did not go to help a friend of mine, though she probably needed á me.
Label: guilt

Text: Bisshop Ter Schure intoduced himself on TV to the Dutch Nation. á He spoke as if he was God himself, and didn't discuss the way he á had achieved this position.
Label: disgust

Text: I was going to go on a vacation to Texas this summer but was á unable to go because of registration.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt sad after having had an argument with my boyfriend.  I felt á that he did not understand me and that there was no point in á carrying on with the relationship.
Label: sadness

Text: Close relative is dying of cancer - found out last week.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt happy at the end of a 10 day student camp.  We had shared á our hopes and aspirations and in the open situation so generated, we á had made strong frienships and experienced our own worth as well. á
Label: joy

Text: When I went to my boyfriend's house for lunch and saw his á parents, I felt that they were watching me all the time.
Label: shame

Text: A dear friend was removed from the division whre I work.
Label: sadness

Text: My baby sister was 2-3 months old and when I was trying to get á her on my back, she slipped and fell.
Label: guilt

Text: The first time I saw a pornographic film, all that in practice is á so beautiful but on the screen appered as something mechanical, á irrational, disgusting and dehumanizing.
Label: disgust

Text: When my mother decided to clean out my room and throw out what á she thought was junk, without my knowing about it, so I returned á home to find half my stuff gone.
Label: anger

Text: Found out that someone I knew well has been misunderstanding me á for 2 years.
Label: anger

Text: When I found out the CIA was mining Nicaraguan harbors.
Label: disgust

Text: I had quarelled with a friend of mine and I later realized that á it was also my fault.
Label: guilt

Text: A few months a close relative of mine died.  I had never expected á this to happen and was sad for a few months.
Label: sadness

Text: When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.
Label: anger

Text: The elections of 1982 and 1985.  The thought of what a social á democrat and communist majority could achieve, especially \worker á
Label: sadness

Text: When I was 17, I told Mum I came in at midnight, when really it á was 3.30.
Label: guilt

Text: South Korea winning more gold medals in the Asian Olympic (more á than China).
Label: anger

Text: My friends and I were sitting at a restaurant. We were talking á and a few of them said awful things about women. I became á disgusted by their narrow-mindedness.
Label: disgust

Text: When I quarrelled with my boyfriend.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was a child, I was always afraid of my father. Just when á he looked at me, I felt frightened.
Label: fear

Text: When I was walking around all alone at night.
Label: fear

Text: Fear to come and live in Nijmegen.
Label: fear

Text: When I realized that I had a hole in my trousers after having gone á for a walk.
Label: shame

Text: My father had a complicated operation. A long time before and á also a long time after that, we did not know how he would get á over it. During all that time I felt very sad.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.
Label: guilt

Text: I have high expectations for my future but if I pursue the á subject in this manner I will not attain this.
Label: sadness

Text: I had undertaken to help my sister for her class work but some á unexpected circumstances prevented me from doing that.
Label: guilt

Text: At a concert an old man arrived and began to danse, sing and do á silly things.
Label: shame

Text: Helping older people on the toilet.
Label: disgust

Text: I had always been first in my class and in the preliminary board á exams I scored the highest marks.  Then the exams were á postponed and I neglected my studies as I was confident.  However á when the final results came out I felt ashamed as I had scored á less than 60% marks and my rank in the class was fifth or sixth.
Label: shame

Text: My girlfriend let me down badly 3 times in one week. These á instances summed up all the negative aspects of our relationship á which at the time seemed doomed to fail.
Label: sadness

Text: [ I feel angry when somebody is unjust to me.]
Label: anger

Text: [ No response.]
Label: guilt

Text: Being aggressive against members of my family.
Label: guilt

Text: One of those days when I was going to school with my brother and á he annoyed me.
Label: disgust

Text: A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Once á she had a child she had a better relationship with them.
Label: joy

Text: When a girl did not answer a question, concerning my love for á her, put forward to her.
Label: sadness

Text: Given duty by the leaders which I do not like to do.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was feeding a premature baby (7 months), the baby chocked. á This was when I was working in children's ward I thought I had á killed the baby.
Label: fear

Text: When I did not get admission in M.Sc after my B.Sc, I felt really á bad.  When I started my journey to Bombay, after having accepted á my uncle's offer to come to Bombay, I was afraid, wondering if I  á would succeed or not.
Label: fear

Text: In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite á intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest á future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I á couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them á threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my á luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was á quite  disappointed and disgusted.
Label: disgust

Text: I told some acquaintances of mine something that I regretted á later.
Label: shame

Text: A and I were walking along the new Asia stairway to the Chung Chi á college for our lecture and I saw him with her.  He put one arm á around her shoulder and laugher brightly and joyfully.  I did not á dare and did not want to look, just walked by them quickly.  The á interest of talking to A disappeared and I just wanted to remain á silent.  But I did not want A to know and so I left him and went á to F.  I should have expected this to happen.
Label: sadness

Text: I hit my little sisiter on the head with a stone while we were á fighting.
Label: guilt

Text: At an office an application that I had made was turned down á because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.
Label: anger

Text: In the past I used to think that my mother was a very nagging á person.  When I started living at the hostel we had little time á to meet each other.  Whenever I went home she would take care á of me.  I gradually realized that what she had done was for my á own good.  So very time I saw her I felt guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: [ I have never felt this emotion.]
Label: shame

Text: When there is danger nearby.
Label: fear

Text: My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.
Label: sadness

Text: Being insulted by my roommate.
Label: anger

Text: They wanted something to happen but I didn't.
Label: anger

Text: When I met an elephant in the bush.
Label: fear

Text: A friend told me about his cousin who is my girlfriend. He said á she had treated him in a mean and nasty way. I was surprised á because in front of other people she had always treated him in a á friendly way. I am very sad about it.
Label: sadness

Text: When someone made me a compliment after an examination just at á the moment I needed it. It was amicable, hearty and sincere.
Label: joy

Text: When they found out that I was absent from school, I had gone to á the girl's secondary school.
Label: guilt

Text: When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a á student like me.
Label: sadness

Text: I had a car accident.
Label: fear

Text: When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.
Label: disgust

Text: My brother lost his temper and started smashing things in the á house.  I was quite scared, that something terrible might happen, á till the situation was brought under control.
Label: fear

Text: When I was a child, I had a terrible nightmare with St. Nicholas' á Devil Servant. I asked my mother if he really existed and she á said yes. The following nights I could not sleep and a á light had to be left turned on.
Label: fear

Text: When I was told that the form five results were out.
Label: fear

Text: When my term paper was evaluated.
Label: joy

Text: I was severely reprimanded for a trivial offence in front of á members of my peer group while still at school.
Label: shame

Text: In neglecting some work that had to be done around the house and á telling my roommate I would get it done.
Label: guilt

Text: When I flew from Athens to Copenhagen after a holiday.  The plane á was caught in a storm and it began to shake and I thouhght that á we were going to crash.
Label: fear

Text: Fear of doing well on a midterm.
Label: fear

Text: I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting á I forgot to take the minutes.
Label: guilt

Text: I wore a dirty dress a certain day I was going to town I met an á old friend who made a comment about my dress so I felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick á caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars á and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on á my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.
Label: fear

Text: The time when my sister had her first baby I was so happy and á joyous because she stayed for two days after marriage before she á had a child.
Label: joy

Text: When I was going to bring back my girlfriend to LA to meet my á parents.
Label: fear

Text: I felt fear some months ago of losing the person whom I loved á when she said to me that she didn't love me.
Label: fear

Text: Motor failure on a boat outside Gottenburg when we were in heavy  á seas and the wind was strong.  As we could not steer the boat we á drifted towards the rocks.  We did not succeed in attracting the á attention of any passerby until 4 hours had elapsed.
Label: fear

Text: I was ashamed when my classmates discovered that I fell in love á with an uneducated girl.
Label: shame

Text: Insulted by a woman in public.
Label: shame

Text: Having had a very heated argument with my sister - I began á hitting her about the head with a newspaper I was holding.
Label: shame

Text: When after having had sexual intercourse with a friend, I thought á that he had told about it to a friend of his.
Label: shame

Text: When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation and á urine for some other examination, he told me that something bad á would happen to me as he would play magic on me.
Label: fear

Text: When we complained about the uncleanliness of the work place, the á authorities agreed to have the place cleaned.  Even after 2-3 á days nothing had been done.  I felt disgusted at the whole á situation.
Label: disgust

Text: I remember that my form 2 teacher was very fierce and dogmatic.  á My feet would tremble whenever I saw her but I had to face the fact that á I had to go for her class.
Label: fear

Text: I was walking home late at night from lectures and someone á deliberately started following me. It was dark and I was scared.
Label: fear

Text: I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could á not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the á University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it á finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home á she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her á boyfriend.
Label: anger

Text: When I forgot to take out money for my mother. She asked me what á she would do, because I had messed up her program for the á following day.
Label: guilt

Text: I was out with a friend in a place where it was very, very busy. á When we wanted to go I bumped a person, who dropped his glass á beer I offered a new one but he didn't accept it.
Label: guilt

Text: Passing an examination, although I felt sure I had failed.
Label: joy

Text: The day I went to eat dinner in the dinning hall and found a á dead fly in my gravy.
Label: disgust

Text: When employer made a pass at me whilst I was at work.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt it at the same time when I felt disgust.
Label: fear

Text: I was rock-climbing and absailing & felt OK, but suddenly as I á was going over the cliff I was hit by fear - I couldn't go on á absailing down the cliff and had to be actually hauled back up á it.
Label: fear

Text: Christmas Eve: there was a tension between my parents, they did á not even try to restore a harmonic atmosphere. Mother stayed in á her room almost the whole day. I felt alone and was very sad.
Label: sadness

Text: Coming to this lecture and listen to you talking about feelings, á I am so happy that foreigners have the same feelings as Chinese.
Label: joy

Text: At the airport, eighty beer cans that I was carrying in a á bag spread all around while I was going through the metal á detector.
Label: shame

Text: Saw a classmate knocked down by a motorcycle.
Label: fear

Text: I was coming home from an exam and I supposed that I had á passed it so I ran to a restaurant for a beer.
Label: joy

Text: [ No response.]
Label: disgust

Text: When it suddenly appeared that our dog was dangerously ill and á probably would die. We had not expected this because he á was always very healthy. Fortunately he survived because we, in turn, á gave him medicines during the night.
Label: sadness

Text: I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long á time.
Label: joy

Text: [ Generally when I am shopping I feel like I were guilty of all á the thefts through the year (I have never stolen).]
Label: guilt

Text: About a dozen girls laughed at me and I was sure that there was á nothing wrong with me.
Label: shame

Text: During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. This á led to friction in a lot of situations.
Label: anger

Text: When I was faced with writing an essay and I didn't want to do it á I was angry that I had to write an essay and angry at myself for á not having the time to write a good essay.
Label: anger

Text: A close relative was at odds with a very powerful firm.  All his á things had been taken, His dad had died a little before this á event.  He gathhered his children and vowed to give them a good á life with a new start - the words were hollow, he bit back his á tears .....I asked to be excused and then went and cried in the á loo.
Label: sadness

Text: When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and died á later.
Label: sadness

Text: The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the á Zambia closed badminton championships.
Label: sadness

Text: One of my best friends was hurt by a girl he loves.
Label: sadness

Text: On my 18th birthday I passed the driving-test. I was glad because á I had had to study very much, because I had been lucky and á because - as a proof that it was really difficult - not everybody á had passed the test.
Label: joy

Text: I think that I am rather shy and do not mix with people as I á would have liked to, out of shyness.
Label: shame

Text: When I was going downhill on skis, and fell down twice the first á time.
Label: shame

Text: Finding out that I made a stupid mistake in the examn.
Label: fear

Text: A friend had a quarrel with the mother of her boyfriend because á she and her friend decided to go and live together. She needed á money for removal, then she made a great effort to reconcile.
Label: disgust

Text: It was at the time of my M.Sc exam, when I was not in a position á to take the exam after having studied seriously.
Label: sadness

Text: My elder brother and I have not always had a good relationship á and I feel ashamed of myself as I do not call him to talk to him á nowadays.
Label: shame

Text: I felt something akin to shame after a heavy night of drinking, á along with waking up with a woman I had just met whose husband á was an epileptic. I was later to know that she knew my mother.
Label: shame

Text: When I was admitted to a certain school as a student.
Label: joy

Text: On the occasion of assignment of tasks and responsibilities in á which such an assignment, dispropotionately carried with it high á responsibility and low ability of organisation and resolution.
Label: anger

Text: Birth of children.
Label: joy

Text: I was afraid when my first boyfriend threatened to make an end to á our relationship because he didn't love me enough while I loved á him very much.
Label: fear

Text: I had spent the weekend visiting relatives and friends and didn't á study for Anatomy class on Monday.
Label: guilt

Text: After having quarelled with a relative of mine about politics.
Label: anger

Text: My younger sister was almost run over by a lorry.
Label: guilt

Text: The landlord had selected a new lodger on her own, while we used á to do that it was not what she had done, but how she did it that á made me angry.
Label: anger

Text: Doing unexpectedly well in an examn.
Label: joy

Text: That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal á marks.
Label: anger

Text: Not helping other people to do their homework.
Label: guilt

Text: We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to a á restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without á finding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give up á the idea.
Label: guilt

Text: This last August when my parents dropped me off and moved me into á college I didn't know anybody here; I was 17 and Berkeley really á scared me.
Label: fear

Text: I felt the above condition when I was found in a house playing á with another man's wife where I was asked questions and I was á unable to answer.
Label: shame

Text: I was late meeting someone for an appointment.
Label: guilt

Text: Finding out that China does not have enough foreign currency to á buy books.
Label: shame

Text: I was on this amusement park ride at Marriots Great America. It á went way up in the air and then around and around. Heights are á not my favorite spots in life.
Label: fear

Text: When a friend carelessly broke and object in my parent's house á and did not apologize, or pay, or anything.
Label: anger

Text: My daughter was a baby and was crying to be taken on my lap. I á felt very nervous and moved her away and went out. As soon as the á feeling of nervousness passed I was taken by an enormous feeling á of guilt, for having rejected my daughter.
Label: guilt

Text: A very drunk person.
Label: disgust

Text: Went to a lecture about Chinese history and hear about the Opium á War.
Label: shame

Text: I sensed this feeling when I passed successfully the second tour á of a competition.
Label: joy

Text: I was hitch-hiking when a man stopped and gave me a lift to á Nijmegen. During the ride he asked me whether I was in for fun. á The man was fat and tatooed.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I would á have liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on the á letter.
Label: anger
