Text: I once drank too much alcohol and became very ill. This was in the á presence of my friends.
Label: guilt

Text: As a child - having a dog - it getting a disease and dying.
Label: sadness

Text: After having considered it for hours I was able to overcome my á scruples and to call a friend with whom I had fallen in love. I á realized that my decision was right - and was very glad.
Label: joy

Text: I read a book whose plot and expressions were obscene and in very á bad taste.
Label: disgust

Text: At the age of 12 (or so) I stole from a Ranger's fruit tree an á apple. (And eventually was compelled to confess - Dostoersky á would like this).
Label: guilt

Text: When one of my cat died of a disease.
Label: sadness

Text: Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his nose á and glass-eye, rattling breath.
Label: disgust

Text: I was afraid of a certain examination although I was relatively á well prepared.
Label: fear

Text: When parents of a certain girl refused to let me marry their á daughter because I was not fit to do so yet the girl accepted á everything and later she followed what her parents insisted and á she told me never to talk to her again.
Label: shame

Text: Foreign students playing loud music in the night before the á biology examn.
Label: disgust

Text: When an unknown person provoked me verbaly and physically.
Label: anger

Text: In our flat the bath-tub is in the kitchen. At the beginning I á had very intensive feelings of shame when I had a bath and people á were in the kitchen.
Label: shame

Text: Before going to the dentist.
Label: fear

Text: I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood á I saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).
Label: disgust

Text: I had to go to the dentist's. When he touched my tooth with his á drill, I was terribly aftaid of the pain I would feel any moment.
Label: fear

Text: Yesterday when I received a B on a history midterm. I felt á overjoyed after having received C's previously.
Label: joy

Text: I was most angry when India lost the Triangular Cricket trophy á held in Australia.  I was so angry that I fought (orally) with my á friend.
Label: anger

Text: The weather is very bad (fog and slipperiness) the newcast á reports many traffic accidents and my boyfriend is driving home á and still has 60 kilometers to go.
Label: fear

Text: I left a boy with whom I was going around without giving him any á explanations.
Label: guilt

Text: I bought something and the shopkeeper gave me more change, I á realized this after I had left the shop and was on the bus-stop - á and I then needed the money.
Label: guilt

Text: When someone I was close to became a paranoid schizophrenic and I á was unable to see this person because of the situation.
Label: sadness

Text: I was really disgusted when I saw one of my friends soiling on á his clothes. I thought he was mad.
Label: disgust

Text: Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was accused of having impregnated someone's daughter, it á was the girl's cousin who had done it.
Label: disgust

Text: When a student of mine (at music) performed and played remarkably well.
Label: joy

Text: When my friend promised that she would come to my place, and did á not turn up - I was annoyed at her.
Label: anger

Text: Seeing a person panhandling money on Telegraph.
Label: disgust

Text: [ I do not recall one here either.]
Label: fear

Text: Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping á from under my feet.
Label: fear

Text: I trusted a friend of mine, but she lied to me about something á and this disgusted me.
Label: disgust

Text: [ I am quite shameless, not applicable.]
Label: shame

Text: Some students whose English is worse than mine can go to your á lectures (English lectures).
Label: disgust

Text: Finding out my best friend cannot go to the English lectures.
Label: sadness

Text: I didn't like my former fob and felt joy when I received a á telegram offering me a new one that I though better and for which á I had been waiting.
Label: joy

Text: Truely, I got very ashamed when my brother was sent out of á Business Machines Limited Company due to improper handling of the á office equipment in Sales Services.
Label: shame

Text: When I nearly drowned in icy water wearing ice skates.  It was á difficult to get out.
Label: fear

Text: When my grandmother came to stay with us permanently as she is a á very difficult person to stay with and when she started telling á false stories about us to other people.
Label: disgust

Text: At one occasion I was ashamed of being refused after a proposal á for a friendship with a certain girl. I was ashamed because she á refused publically in the presence of my fellow friends.
Label: shame

Text: A terrible cloud-burst started when we were camping in a tent on á a great bald field.
Label: fear

Text: When I witnessed an accident.
Label: disgust

Text: My friend got married and went abroad, this made me feel sad and á lonely.
Label: sadness

Text: A shop-assistant behaved rather roughly with me though she hadn't á the slightest grounds for it.
Label: anger

Text: Being driven by friend who suddenly swerved and skidded a little. á It was night and on a long trip. We ended up on side of road.
Label: fear

Text: During the English lesson we were required to do a play.  A few á days after doing it the teacher asked us to do it again at a meeting  á and I forgot my part.
Label: shame

Text: I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil) á from the headmaster in standard 6 because I had passed, I became á No 1 and he said I was one of the pupils who had good behaviour.
Label: joy

Text: I had the window open and the door was shut so that the kitten á would not go out.  My partner came in and started talking about á something and I forgot about the window and suddenly I saw the á kitten hanging from the window frame. I was rigid with fright á till I got hold of her.
Label: fear

Text: One day, when I realized that I was alone, I felt fear of á loneliness.
Label: fear

Text: One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stab á his friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.
Label: disgust

Text: During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interfering á with my tasks and making unfounded remarks.  I felt hatred for á him but it stopped when I realized that he just longed for attention.
Label: anger

Text: I had a quarrel with my parents; I was convinced to be right.
Label: anger

Text: I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would á never have said normally. Next morning I was terribly ashamed á about what I had said.
Label: shame

Text: Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated other á people similarly - including lying, hiding facts, being á deceitful, unfair, etc.
Label: disgust

Text: When I got married.
Label: joy

Text: We had had a party the night before and we still had some liquors á left the morning after. I went to the kitchen pretending to á prepare some tea and was caught by my fiancee pouring some rum á down my throat.
Label: guilt

Text: During the PY 102 film session on Tuesday, one of the films shown  á was of an experiment on a live cat involving strapping it into a á machine for possibly days, and doing things to its brain.
Label: disgust

Text: My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them. á But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I am á to blame for not following the advise of the others, but it is á not late still.
Label: guilt

Text: When I finished the work that I had planned to do - my homework.
Label: joy

Text: A tiresome person held me up all day long.  I was very busy then á (I can not remember what the problem was).  He continously tried á to make me talk to him and disturbed me.
Label: disgust

Text: One day my friend told me that she had heard that I was moving á about with her boyfriend. I was disgusted with the news.
Label: disgust

Text: I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told them á that I was going to a seminar. My mother knew that I was lying but á she didn't stop me.
Label: shame

Text: Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by á someone close to me.
Label: anger

Text: Leaving home to move closer to University. As an oldest child, á this experience was traumatic for both my parents and myself.
Label: sadness

Text: Accepted by the college football team.
Label: joy

Text: I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had left á the flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about that á sloppiness and impudence.
Label: anger

Text: When my boyfriend wanted to leave me, I felt sad and melancholic.
Label: sadness

Text: When as a child I stole, from a friend of mine, the ring she had á got in an easter egg.
Label: guilt

Text: I once saw a programme on TV describing how certain wild life á films were made and was disgusted by the treatment of certain á animals in this particular programme of the polar bear.
Label: disgust

Text: I was angry about 3 months ago and I kicked backwards against the á wall. It caved in and so I had to show it to my parents. I had á been angry after my mother said something to me about not being á able to find clothes in my size - something that I'm sensitive á about. (6' 5'' 210)
Label: shame

Text: When I was leaving home I decided to leave without saying á good-bye to my young brother.  My brother saw me and said,        á \ Will you not say good-bye to me?\"  He is only 31/2 years old. "
Label: shame

Text: When my mother was angry with me over my friends and boyfriend.
Label: fear

Text: I was going around with a girl without loving her.  Not only did á I go around with her, but we did many more things.  In the end I á was not very sincere to her.
Label: guilt

Text: Coming home one night - my sister was home, and had been drinking á heavily and started picking arguments.
Label: disgust

Text: I saw a lot of starving people in a T.V news report.
Label: sadness

Text: When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocal á feelings and then days later changed her mind.
Label: sadness

Text: After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for half á a year, I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (for á economic reasons). We separated although I loved him.
Label: sadness

Text: A friend who shares the room with me, opened the window in the á morning and left the room the whole day. When I came home in the á evening, the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.
Label: anger

Text: At primary school I was accused by some boys of being in love á with a certain girl in their class so they had to shout and beat á the girl and the matter was reported to the headmaster.
Label: fear

Text: Finding out that China is poor, so we cannot have good reference á books.
Label: sadness

Text: When my little brother asked me to play with him, I told him that á I had no time and that I would play with him the next day. á However, the next day I said the same thing.
Label: guilt

Text: Taking part in the mobbing of some girls in my class in primary á school.
Label: shame

Text: When I hurt a person's feelings.
Label: guilt

Text: When my mother treats me as a 10-year old boy.
Label: anger

Text: When the teacher asked me a question, I did not know the answer á and I just stood still for about a few minutes without saying a á word.
Label: shame

Text: In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as á I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load á on the tractor trailer.
Label: disgust

Text: When my mother kept me in leading-strings.
Label: anger

Text: When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had a á boyfriend.
Label: sadness

Text: When I decided to separate from my husband.
Label: fear

Text: When I realized that we are living on borrowed time, and that the á nuclear holocaust appears to come closer every day.
Label: fear

Text: I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close á friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being á right dominated.
Label: guilt

Text: Deceived by other people and ran into trouble.
Label: sadness

Text: My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at á the station.
Label: joy

Text: In the recent lightning storm, bolts of lightning were hitting á close by (1/8 mile). I was in bed at the time and was afraid I á might be struck.
Label: fear

Text: When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have any á water for two days.
Label: anger

Text: I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long á time.
Label: joy

Text: The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.
Label: joy

Text: I am ashamed of the horrible way I used to treat my little á sister.
Label: shame

Text: At an important moment in a volleyball game we made a point and á by this we won a set from a much stronger competitor.
Label: joy

Text: Finding out that the university police was afraid to stop the á foreign students playing loud music (China's shame).
Label: shame

Text: NO RESPONSE
Label: disgust

Text: When I could not hold my bladder while making a telephone call á and ended up wetting myself.
Label: shame

Text: Once when I was in the cell group (religious activity) I found á that almost everyone in the group read the bible daily and I felt á guilty in my heart.
Label: guilt

Text: When my brother died.
Label: sadness

Text: Incomprehension and repression towards a child's behaviour, á commonly not accepted, and making the child cry.
Label: guilt

Text: When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a á moment.
Label: joy

Text: When I shirked the gymnastic lesson I met the director of our á school who asked me what I was doing.
Label: guilt

Text: My roommate messing up our room.
Label: disgust

Text: We owned a shop and I used to serve in it occasionally. We á sometimes took lollies out of the stand and Dad caught me one á day.
Label: guilt

Text: When I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was á 16). When I entered the sauna naked, I felt ashamed for a short á time.
Label: shame

Text: Unrealisation of the desired profession (aviator).
Label: sadness

Text: When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia á and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the á events that were taking place there.
Label: sadness

Text: When I saw Russian roulette on TV. (obviously the movie \Deer á
Label: fear

Text: Bought something bad from the shop and they refused to change it.
Label: anger

Text: When I knew about my first job.
Label: joy

Text: A horse which I had liked very much was taken away.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was giving private tutorials to my student; he would not á concentrate and was lazy.  He had not done the home work that I  á had assigned and his academic level was very low.  It was a á nuisance.
Label: disgust

Text: When I saw my family after a separation of one year.
Label: joy

Text: When my brother was selected to the University of Malawi (the á Polythecnic). I was very excited and I rejoiced due to one of our á family members qualifying for University level at long last.
Label: joy

Text: My father had bought too many goods for his shop, there was not á enough space to store them.
Label: anger

Text: I am filled with gloom and sadness at the death of a person.  á More specifically, I felt sad after hearing the news of a á death of a person who was hale and hearty and full of life, withá vigour and plans for the next day but had no next day to cherish it.
Label: sadness

Text: My friend and I were to attend a very important meeting and he á had promised to come and pick me up.  But he did not turn up and á I felt very angry at him.
Label: anger

Text: I made a comment and it was interpreted completely differently á from what I had meant.  When I said it I realized how my mother á had understood it.
Label: shame

Text: When my team lost a championship.
Label: sadness

Text: I broke a glass of glycerine at the Z.C.B.C store in Ndola.
Label: guilt

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.
Label: joy

Text: When I forgot the lines of the play during an orientation camp.
Label: fear

Text: When a class-mate died.
Label: sadness

Text: My father insulted by other people.
Label: shame

Text: I wanted to finish a relationship after 3 months. Unfortunately á my friend had a different opinion. I could not answer his á feelings this made him unhappy, and me feel guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: I live outside Graz - so I have to go by bus. One day I went home á from the bus stop alone. It was dark, I had to go through a á forest and there was a dark figure behind me. I was very á frightened.
Label: fear

Text: I was fearful when I realised that the relish was overcooked á simply because I was not keen enough at checking whether there á was still enough water in the relish or not, instead I was just á playing with my friends.
Label: fear

Text: The last day of school is traditionally celebrated by singing a á song about all the students who are leaving.  In the song á about me, there were things which irritated me a lot.
Label: anger

Text: I told my elder brother that he was irresponsible and that I did á not care for what he did because he was teasing me.
Label: guilt

Text: Heard some postgraduate students talking about girls being á unsiutable to do medicine.
Label: disgust

Text: My mother was always fastidious about my room, bed time, etc.  á She treated us strictly and punished us physically.   These á things were intolerable.
Label: disgust

Text: Being sexually assaulted (not rape, but passionate kissing) by a á friend's father - he stopped when he was driving me home. I á hadn't wanted the lift, had refused 3 times, and then felt it'd á be rude to refuse again. Was really afraid of what he might do.
Label: fear

Text: In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends á unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable, á rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I á didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.
Label: anger

Text: When I dream of anything terrifying I used to have fear for the á rest of the day that the dream might come true e.g., being beaten á (or eaten ?) by a snake.
Label: fear

Text: A certain girl asked me what my major was and when I told her á that it was P.A she started criticizing it saying, \I hate that á
Label: disgust

Text: When I went to my first dental appointment.
Label: fear

Text: When my husband talked about the restrictions he will have to á accept in his life to make our marriage work.  I felt that it was á directed at me as it was me who had demanded the changes.  We á were with a marriage counsellor then.
Label: guilt

Text: The last time I had sex.
Label: joy

Text: When I was accepted as supervisor for a student teacher.  The á notification came by post.
Label: joy

Text: I made the college entrance examinations for P.U.C. It was what I á wanted more. When the first list came out I got frustrated. I á wasn't in. When the second list came out without hopes I started á to read the newspaper and my name was thre. I was in the bus and á felt like crying so that everybody could hear me. The cry was hold, á and 1982 became forever a mask in my life.
Label: joy

Text: When I heard that I had passed my end of first year exams and I á was ready to enter 2nd year because I felt I had failed as they were á very hard.
Label: joy

Text: I was a prefect at secondary school.  On the sports day I told á others that I would take down the names of the people who á misbehaved and after some time I sat down for a brief rest.  á Suddenly the head prefect came and scolded me in front of others. á  I was very angry as there were other prefects sitting and he á picked on me.  I thought that a brief rest was not  serious á enough to be blamed.
Label: anger

Text: There is one thing which makes me feel shameful,  when I see á friends of my age group working and earning a lot, when I am á still studying.  A friend I met a week ago after a period of 5 á years is earning more than Rs 3000/ month.
Label: shame

Text: A dirty person, smelling bad and unknown laying on me.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was subjected to a very nasty joke by a group of friends.
Label: anger

Text: When I was involved in a traffic accident.
Label: fear

Text: I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fence á when  a train was coming.
Label: fear

Text: When I see rotten meat.
Label: disgust

Text: When my brother ran away from home and I thought it was because á of my continously scolding him.
Label: guilt

Text: I woke up in the middle of the night as I had jumped and shouted á with fear.  I thought that someone's cold hand or something á similar had touched my hand.  I crept down under the covers and á went back to sleep.
Label: fear

Text: When I was told that I had not been successful in getting the job I á had been expecting.  I was sure that I was sufficiently á qualified.
Label: sadness

Text: When I didn't meet an appointment I had made. The person phoned á me but I thought of something (I told I was ill) so that I didn't á have to go.
Label: shame

Text: I felt happy when I saw my brother at the bus depot after 3 á months without seing each other.
Label: joy

Text: I was angered by a classmate who poured soup on to my clothes. He á was trying to use a short-cut method in getting his supper. á Coming behind my back, he wasn't noticed by me and as I was á retreating from a hungry congested people I knocked his plate á with my head. He didn't accept being wrong but blamed me for á pouring his soup.
Label: anger

Text: When I went to the sauna for the first time and there were men á and women.
Label: shame

Text: I was sleeping when I heard the neighbours screaming, I peeped á through the window and saw a thief  trying to enter my á neighbour's house.
Label: fear

Text: I had obviously done the work badly but my class-mates of the á student's association did not blame me, they helped me do the á work.
Label: shame

Text: I cannot remember exactly such a situation. But I know that á once I went to a very dirty lavatory and that disgusted me.
Label: disgust

Text: Loneliness, being uncertain of myself in the Autumn.
Label: sadness

Text: One day in a crossroad somebody crashed my car. I got out and á this person laughed at me. I felt such a great anger that I got á in my car and went away.
Label: anger

Text: Describing to mother how a hole in the wall had appeared while I á was babysitting.
Label: guilt

Text: When I got through the first day here at the department.
Label: joy

Text: My grandfather's funeral.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt disgust as a result of one of my midterms - I thought I á had prepared well for it, but the end result wasn't what I had á expected.
Label: disgust

Text: I was almost caught in the girls hostel by the security men, I á would have been expelled from school had I been caught.
Label: fear

Text: I am a \cantor\" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago I á
Label: fear

Text: A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explain á things as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in an á aggressive manner.
Label: anger

Text: A friend had promised me to give me a lift to Graz. To be sure I á called her before we went. She told me that she had just promised á another person to give him a lift.
Label: anger

Text: I felt disgusted one day when, as we were eating, a child á defecated on the table side.
Label: disgust

Text: I was on my surf ski. Rather large waves to strong current á separated me from my ski and we both began to drift slowly á (actually rather quickly) away to sea. The direction I was á drifting in was taking me straight over a reef on which rather á large sharks were constantly being caught. (I was alone with no á one to help me).
Label: fear

Text: Not being chosen for the English lectures (my girl-friend á chosen).
Label: sadness

Text: Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feel á ashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wanted á to say.  Thoughtlessness.
Label: shame

Text: When I bought new clothes and put them on.
Label: shame

Text: At a cross-country race I wanted to take a short-cut (which is á not allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends had á observed that.
Label: shame

Text: When I was mistreated by my step-mother.
Label: anger

Text: I was alone walking in a deserted part of the city and I had some á fear that some men would attack me and rob me.
Label: fear

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.
Label: disgust

Text: The disgust I feel towards a certain person.
Label: disgust

Text: When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.  A á subtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness and á neutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.
Label: disgust

Text: When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to á rest.
Label: sadness

Text: It was shocking news to me when I received a telegram from home á telling me that my grandmother had passed away. I had to go home to attend á the funeral but unfortunately I found that the burial had already á taken place.
Label: sadness

Text: The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.
Label: sadness

Text: After a quarrel with my mother in which matters were \inflated\" á
Label: guilt

Text: When I received a message that my brother was seriously ill and á was in hospital.
Label: sadness

Text: Made a statement that other people did not believe.
Label: anger

Text: I fell off a bike in the presence of a lot of people.
Label: shame

Text: I lost my grandfather whom I loved very much.  I had not known á that he had been ill for a very time, when I received this á message he was already dead.
Label: sadness

Text: The first time I slept at my boyfriends house and had to walk á down the hall to the shower in front of his housemates. I felt á they were judging me.
Label: shame

Text: When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had given á me.
Label: anger

Text: When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time á and I had lost his address and telephone number.
Label: joy

Text: When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them á and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.
Label: fear

Text: Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the á theoretical questions very well, but I failed the practical á driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.
Label: guilt

Text: At noon one Sunday I received a phone call telling me that my á mother had been knocked down by a car at the street crossing and á that her husband should go and see her.  I could not believe this á as my father and my mother had gone out together to buy lunch á boxes.  However I immediately ran to the scene of the accident.
Label: fear

Text: I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I á cried for several days because I was so sad.
Label: sadness

Text: My classmate used her personal relations to get a seat for a á subject that I wanted also.  I had taken the pains to help him á apply and I did not get selected.  I did not like this as he had á not told me the facts earlier, he need not have lied to me.
Label: anger

Text: I met my ex boyfriend by chance.  We separated a few months ago á and I am now with a new boyfriend.  My ex boyfriend looked á depressed, and I know I am not to be blamed.
Label: guilt

Text: I felt it when I received a letter telling that I had been á classified in a national concourse of p... I felt happy and á vanity about it.
Label: joy

Text: When I was at school.
Label: sadness

Text: I had lied to a person because I had thought that I could not á tell him the truth. When he found out he was not angry but á understanding. We talked the whole thing over.
Label: shame

Text: Doing poorly on an exam that I thought I should do well.
Label: shame

Text: When someone I had had a relationship (purely sexual) with came á up to me after I had used her and acted as if nothing had á changed.
Label: disgust

Text: When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.
Label: guilt

Text: I saw a terrible accident happen and I laughed a lot of the á fright and because I was nervous.
Label: shame

Text: Got a present from my friend for my birthday.
Label: joy

Text: Not getting the class paper in time for the lecture.
Label: guilt

Text: Some students talking when other people are having a nap.
Label: disgust

Text: I was sad when my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a football á match a mile away from home. The mail found me there. I was á disappointed and didn't play the other half of the match.
Label: sadness

Text: I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last á year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.
Label: fear

Text: After having finished my B.Sc, I was struggling hard to continue á my studies and had taken the M.SC exam.  I was not sure that I á would be selected in the written exam.  When I saw my name in the á selected candidates list I was overjoyed.
Label: joy

Text: When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that á I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.
Label: shame

Text: Tutorial again !  A fearful feeling came to me when I sat on the á chair and looked at my fellow students all around.  I was really á scared that they would ask me some questions or challenge the á ideas that I had presented.
Label: fear

Text: When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.
Label: disgust

Text: When my girlfriend told me that she wanted to leave me.
Label: sadness

Text: When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated á from them for about three months.
Label: sadness

Text: Saw poverty in the countryside.
Label: sadness

Text: The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor á said that the ear was completely all right.
Label: joy

Text: Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm á or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had á behaved like a scoundrel to you, when by his actions he has made á you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the á way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.
Label: disgust

Text: My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time I á found her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry with á the driver.
Label: sadness

Text: A few months ago when I was teaching, I suddenly became very á angry at the children and slapped some of them.
Label: anger

Text: I was scared when I realized that I might miss the train which I á was supposed to take.  I was 1500 Kilometres away from home and when  á I heard the depart whistle I was still 150 feet away from the á train.  I finally made it.
Label: fear

Text: When I heard that a woman of my community had aborted and got rid á of the foetus by throwing it in the drain.
Label: disgust

Text: When I learnt that my close friend was going to immigrate.
Label: sadness

Text: When my parents separated temporarily and I was left behind with á my father.  As I loved my mother I wanted to go with her.
Label: sadness

Text: Railway station good-bye.
Label: sadness

Text: The same event described under FEAR - in the bus a man sat beside á me, with his trousers open and holding his penis.
Label: disgust

Text: A friend and I were going to have a study session together in á which we quiz ourselves in biology material. Because I believed I á didn't study enough. I feared I would fail.
Label: fear

Text: When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money I á needed to buy something I had been planning to buy.
Label: joy

Text: When my brother had an epileptic attack and I was scared as to á what would happen to him.
Label: fear

Text: When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.
Label: joy

Text: I most joyous moment was the day I got my marks.  I was very á happy when I came to know about my marks at the M.Sc (part I) á examination where I got 71.5%.  This was the highest marks I have á ever scored in my life.
Label: joy

Text: I felt guilty when I couldn't help a person.
Label: guilt

Text: The moment I got the news that I had been selected for the U.G.C á junior national research fellowship.  It was a dream come true.
Label: joy

Text: [ When I am, in my opinion, not understood correctly. ]
Label: sadness

Text: While watching TV (a war movie), I felt a strong fear of death, á threat and fear of loosing people close to me.
Label: fear

Text: Family member survived an operation.
Label: joy

Text: It was my turn to cook dinner.  I forgot a dish (the favourite of á the family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was eight years old my father was run over by a car. When á I saw his body I was sad beyond words.
Label: sadness

Text: One night my father suddenly suffered from a heart attack which á lead to breathing difficulties.
Label: sadness

Text: Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my á part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly á she did not give up for a longer time.
Label: disgust

Text: At night, I walk home past a forest.  Once, somebody got stabbed á in the forest.  I imagine someone attacking me and I hurry up.
Label: fear

Text: I was pregnant and thought that by not having the baby I would á hurt the father like he did me regardless of the life we had á created.
Label: guilt

Text: I was given the task to learn a page of music text for a small á part. But I had forgotten all about it and I felt quite awkward á when I had to show what I had prepared.
Label: shame

Text: At school when I had a shouting argument with a friend over my á ability to carry out a particular duty in the correct way without á harming her.
Label: anger

Text: Death of a pet rabbit. We had to give it away because my brother á became allergic to it. We gave it to a man who kept animals and á lots of other animals for children to watch. We went to visit our á rabbit. It was badly beaten by the other rabbits and eventually á died.
Label: sadness

Text: Somebody went around spreading news that I like people with á money.
Label: disgust

Text: I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was my á birthday.  I enjoyed having that present.
Label: joy

Text: Every time I do not write something well in English.
Label: shame

Text: First anatomy lesson.
Label: disgust

Text: When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I á felt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.
Label: fear

Text: Good dinner on the National Day.
Label: joy

Text: I quarrelled with my younger sister because I had said something á against her boyfriend.  Consequently she looked through me when á she saw me as she thought that I was trying to separate them.  á She had misunderstood me.
Label: sadness

Text: When the train taking me to my military service left the station, á on the platform remained relatives, projects and goodtimes.  I á had a hard year ahead.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt disgust toward meat when I felt sick with the steak after á a week only on meat.
Label: disgust

Text: Once when I said bad things concerning a friend.
Label: shame

Text: I was travelling back home by boat with two friends of mine after á a lovely holiday trip.  The night and the sea were dark, and the á wind was blowing.  I feared that death was there on the boat, I á somehow felt sure about it.  I feared being left alone.
Label: fear

Text: It was when I injured a friend accidentally with a stone. It made á a cut on the cheeks which resulted in suturing.
Label: guilt

Text: Finding out my name on the list for English lectures.
Label: joy

Text: As a ten-year-old I was at the funeral of my grand-father.  It was more á the ceremonies held in the church and not really the death of my á grand-father which made me sad.
Label: sadness

Text: When somebody broke into our home one night when my mother was á out, and my sister and I had just gone to bed.
Label: fear

Text: When I was in a Christian institution, sometimes the nuns would á send back the people who came to visit us when it was not the á visiting hours.  This disgusted me.
Label: disgust

Text: When I let a person assume a fault that I committed.
Label: guilt

Text: I had a discussion with my mother concerning my sister's divorce, á we disagreed strongly.
Label: anger

Text: A day when I was getting out of the shower I covered only the á front part of my body with a towel (I was 7 years old), and I á didn't see that my cousin was in the room.
Label: shame

Text: Relative's death.
Label: sadness

Text: At primary school the teacher caught me cheating during a á dictation.
Label: fear

Text: My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with her á and telling nice things to her.
Label: joy

Text: I was sleeping in my room but woke in the middle of the night to á think I could hear noises and see shadows moving. I felt that á someone was in the house.
Label: fear

Text: At school - being whipped by the teacher in front of the class.
Label: shame

Text: Taking a trip to crocokile country I fell out of the boat and was á motivated by fear of being eaten to perform great swimming feats.
Label: fear

Text: On rising. No apparent reason.
Label: sadness

Text: There was joy in me when I heard that I was to take a course as a á Medical Assistant.
Label: joy

Text: I once failed a test miserably and my friend did very well and á someone made a nasty comment while comparing me to my friend.
Label: anger

Text: I was walking outside the union refec after rain when I tripped á and fell.
Label: shame

Text: I felt guilty of having suspected my room-mate of stealing the á money last term.
Label: guilt

Text: Seeing a friend \making love\" to a high school girl. I á
Label: disgust

Text: Talking about a person's unattractiveness, not realizing that the á person was listening.
Label: shame

Text: I greeted and embraced the wrong person thinking that it was my á friend.
Label: shame

Text: When I stayed on a nudism beach, a man was watching me in a á disagreeable way. I had the feeling that he was examining my á body.
Label: shame

Text: When I am travelling by car and have to meet an oncoming car á while overtaking.
Label: fear

Text: When I failed an exam I thought I would pass.
Label: anger

Text: When the relationship with my first girlfriend broke up and I á realized it too late.
Label: fear

Text: Can't remember specific event - besides just being moderately á happy until a year or so ago.
Label: joy

Text: When I met a friend that I hadn't seen for some time.
Label: joy

Text: When my son was diagnosed as having CEREBRAL PALSY, at age 5. He á would have to endure so much labelling, stigma and discrimination, á even though his case was relatively mild.
Label: sadness

Text: I received a wedding invitation from an ex-flatmate, enclosed was á a small note that overcame a lot of the differences that had á arisen between us due to the circumstances in which she left the á flat.
Label: joy

Text: Falling in love.
Label: joy

Text: My father gave me money for school fees and I didn't pay school á fees instead I spent it on beer and did not tell him about this.
Label: fear

Text: My car skidded on the wet street.
Label: fear

Text: When I was told by the doctor, after many months of coughing, á that I had tuberculosis.
Label: fear

Text: When a big angry dog put its snout on my arm and had I made one á movement it would have bitten me.
Label: fear

Text: When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect my á certificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knew á nothing about this.
Label: anger

Text: When I noticed that a nice person was being exploited á economically.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt joy when I heard over the radio that I had been successful á in my Primary School Leaving Certificate Examination and was á selected for Secondary School.
Label: joy

Text: I told my friend about how I had calculated my salary by cheating a á little.  When my friend remarked about it, I understood that it á was wrong to do so, and I felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: One day my mother went to visit her friends.  When she came back á she scolded me for not having kept the house in order, so I á decided not to talk to her.
Label: guilt

Text: One night I was called and told that the father of a close friend á died. When I visited my friend at home and when attending the á funeral I felt very sad.
Label: sadness

Text: Upon moving away from home for the first time to a different á city, I felt no longer \under the wing\" of my parents even though á
Label: sadness

Text: Finding out I was chosen for the English lectures.
Label: joy

Text: Overhear people talking about me and saying that I am stupid.
Label: anger

Text: I was in \Hainburg\" in December and I was angry about the á
Label: anger

Text: The same situation as with sadness. I was afraid about what my á parents would further do to distroy my relationship.
Label: fear

Text: Before an oral examination - which I did not take eventually.
Label: fear

Text: Finding out I am not good looking.
Label: sadness

Text: The quarrel between my  parents.
Label: sadness

Text: From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.
Label: sadness

Text: Walking along the beach with a friend (another girl), talking, á picking up shells, laughing, chasing seagulls.
Label: joy

Text: When I try to get closer at a person and she misinterpreted me.
Label: sadness

Text: My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.
Label: sadness

Text: When I spanked a child in anger and later regretted it terribly.
Label: guilt

Text: I was walking alone in the street late at night (2.30 am). It was á very quiet. Then a man approached me and said \Hello\"."
Label: fear

Text: When a friend and me played a joke on our boyfriends.  Her á boyfriend came up and accused me of having planned the whole á thing and said that I did not deserve my boyfriend.  He á embarassed me in front of a crowd.
Label: anger

Text: I had a dream in which I was an African elephant.
Label: fear

Text: When a friend of mine keeps telling me morbid things that á happened to his dog.
Label: disgust

Text: Waiting for a taxi - when within 1/2 an hour two separate people á challenged me to fight for no apparent reason except they were á drunk.
Label: fear

Text: Renewed contact with an earlier friend.
Label: joy

Text: At Christmas night there was a good movie on television which I á wanted to see for years. I was whining about it till someone told á me it was very childish. Then I felt shame.
Label: shame

Text: Upon returning from a journey of about two weeks duration, I á found that a collection of pornographic literature had been á removed from my room I had previously thought that no one was á aware of the existence of this material.
Label: shame

Text: If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my á parents always twaddle and whine, when I don't eat all the food.
Label: anger

Text: I saw in an ice-cream kiosque a cockroach walking through a á cornet.
Label: disgust

Text: I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, although á they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.
Label: anger

Text: The possibility of having failed the examination.
Label: fear

Text: I did not do the homework that the teacher had asked us to do.  I á was scolded immediately.
Label: shame

Text: The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the á driver made the same excuse every day.
Label: disgust

Text: When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did á not know what would happen.
Label: sadness

Text: When I think about the short time that we live and relate it to á the periods of my life when I think that I did not use this á short time.
Label: sadness

Text: After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. That á feeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a good á grade for an examination.
Label: joy

Text: I feel this feeling at one and the same degree when I am not á prepared to overcome certain obstacle in my life.
Label: shame

Text: When I was cycling through the park late one night, two people á jumped out of the woods and tried to stop me.  There were á shouting something at the same time.
Label: fear

Text: I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and I á tended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener was á amused.
Label: shame

Text: Once my presentation was the worst among my classmates as I had á not prepared it well and had not seen it as important.  My á presentation was so confused that it clearly showed my poor á preparation.
Label: shame

Text: My grandfather died, when I was an exchange student in the USA.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was presumed to have stolen maize from the school garden.
Label: disgust

Text: When I saw a T.V programme on animals in the film world á (mistreated and used).
Label: disgust

Text: When a close friend of mine maintained a relationship with me á till she needed me and broke it off when she did not need me.  á She behaved life a really selfish person.
Label: disgust

Text: When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished á with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one á which I had desired a lot.
Label: joy

Text: Was picking up my father from work and on passing through the á Valley watched three prostitutes walk up and down waiting for á someone to pick them up. Clothing was disgusting.
Label: disgust

Text: After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was á scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want á a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way á through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and á continue my studies.
Label: fear

Text: I was double crossing Mercy and Maria. They one day came to know á each other. I was found by Mercy red-haded when I was with Maria.
Label: disgust

Text: My mom told me not to gamble, but I did anyway. Sometimes I would á even take some money from my parents and brother. She found out á and yelled at me.
Label: guilt

Text: The day I was told that I had passed my Malawi School leaving á Exams and I was selected to go to college.
Label: joy

Text: When I heard my name being announced on the radio that I had been á successful in an interview for admittance for a medical Assistant á training course. I was really happy and I enjoyed myself by á dancing to music from the Radio cassette.
Label: joy

Text: I went to a party with my boyfriend who got so drunk and started á vomiting. It was so disgusting.
Label: disgust

Text: I missed an opportunity to go abroad because of some silly á mistakes for which I had to suffer a lot.
Label: anger

Text: A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 yearrs old) to my not á responding in his favour to a request, that is: he asked me for á some money I refused, and his reaction was quite childish.
Label: disgust

Text: It happened when I lost two very intimate friends in a car á accident.
Label: sadness

Text: As the only person in my family into academics, I ought to have á looked after my younger (and only) sister better, with respect to á her education and life experiences.
Label: guilt

Text: In Biarritz (the South of France) I met some English students á who, especially for me, went to Paris and gave me food, while I á didn't have any more money.
Label: guilt

Text: When my darling found me walking hand in hand with another girl á whom I loved also.
Label: shame

Text: Very often I take care for my little sister and oversee her á duties. Most of the time everything went fine, but sometimes she á absolutely didn't want to obey; then I hit her (we frequently á were hit by our father).
Label: guilt

Text: I was walking home from a place on southside and I live on á Northside and I was followed. I headed my most direct route.
Label: fear

Text: In a fight with my girlfriend in a luncheonette where everybody á stared at me in such a way that I had to leave it.
Label: shame

Text: This emotion happened when I passed my primary school examination á and was selected for Secondary School.
Label: joy

Text: At a weakness on my part.
Label: shame

Text: I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to á interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class á with her in our first year.
Label: disgust

Text: When realizing that my girlfriend and myself in fact had started á the process of breaking up.
Label: sadness

Text: During the week-end at home, my mother fries greasy and unhealthy á meat dishes which make me feel sick.
Label: disgust

Text: First time in anatomy.
Label: fear

Text: When you are satisfied with something, when you achieve something á you have striven to.
Label: joy

Text: I felt angry when I heard that my sister had failed the á Examinations which we hoped she was going to pass with á distinctions.
Label: anger

Text: Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband. á Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.
Label: joy

Text: When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I á can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just á parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.
Label: sadness

Text: The carterer refused to give me sugar to add to my tea saying á that there was no sugar whilst it was there, so I left the cafe á disgusted without taking the tea.
Label: disgust

Text: Not doing well in the examn.
Label: shame

Text: When I passed an exam.
Label: joy

Text: I was looking after a child and she fell down because I was not á paying her much attention.  One side of her face got bruised.
Label: guilt

Text: When I saw a film in which the man suffered from an illness and    á his skin came peeling off.
Label: disgust

Text: Some time back I had signed a letter which I had not read.  What á had happened is that something had been written against my á friend and this went to the higher authorities.  My friend asked me  á -\you also signed ?\"   "
Label: shame

Text: While cycling in the country a dog started running beside me, á growling and barking, and trying to bite my foot.
Label: fear

Text: When my best friend foud out I'd been lying about something I'd á been doing behind her back.
Label: shame

Text: A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a few á months old.
Label: sadness

Text: When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had been á raped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was accepted as a student at the college, not having á thought it possible.
Label: joy

Text: Doesn't apply.
Label: shame

Text: A friend catched me while masturbating. I am not fully sure á whether she saw it or not.
Label: shame

Text: One day I went to the cinema to see a film in which I was á interested.  On arriving there I saw a long queue (which I had á not expected) and went back home without seeing the film.
Label: fear

Text: I saw a man falling on the walkway. He seemed half dead, and was á immobile. I felt disgust for the people who passed by without á doing anything to help.
Label: disgust

Text: Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.
Label: anger

Text: [ While approaching to test the situation.]
Label: fear

Text: Getting very low marks in mathematics.
Label: shame

Text: Walking at friday night through Nijmegen, going to a pub or a á disco.
Label: fear

Text: I felt guilty when I was robbed of a friend's radio at Lilongwe á bus depot after promising that I would keep it safe.
Label: guilt

Text: When I didn't get a certain job at Lillehammer which I wanted á very much.
Label: sadness

Text: My roommate being unconsiderate.
Label: anger

Text: When my girl went away for a holiday without saying good-bye to á me.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous á for me and the people close to me.
Label: fear

Text: When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.
Label: sadness

Text: Fighting with class mates in Highschool.
Label: fear

Text: A friend told me it would be better for me not to be on familiar á terms with another friend, although, in my opinion he had no á reason to say such things. He only said so hoping that I á would search support from him (that, however, was not necessary).
Label: anger

Text: When I was admitted to the Bulgarian State Conservatoire.
Label: joy

Text: Seeing persons spending money in a shopping center with á completely indifference to the misery reigning in our country.
Label: disgust

Text: I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of á being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at á work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been á drinking.
Label: anger

Text: Telling my parents that I did not well in an examn.
Label: fear

Text: When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I was á very good and would soon get into the ballet academy.
Label: joy

Text: When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.
Label: joy

Text: I saw a film where snakes were crawling everywhere. I felt them á crawling over all my body with that ... skins. The noise that á they did disturbed me very much.
Label: disgust

Text: Losing a boyfriend for the second time to my friend. He fell in á love with her. The same thing happened a few months earlier with á another boyfriend.
Label: sadness

Text: A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many á people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said á and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear. á He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted á when he told that.
Label: disgust

Text: When I heard that my father had passed away. I could not eat for á a week and was only crying. I could not find the courage to go to á bath.
Label: sadness

Text: When I lied to my best friend about a boy she really liked but he á didn't like her. I told her he did and she bugged him for a long á time embarrassing herself.
Label: shame

Text: We had gone to our native village and I went to visit a tribal á group which believes in Goddess Kali.  As it was a festival day they á had to offer a hen to the Goddess so they cut the head off a hen á right in front of my eyes.  I felt disgusted and evenb gave up á eating meat after this incident.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a á doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.
Label: shame

Text: When taking part in the mobbing of one of my best friends in á primary school.
Label: shame

Text: [ The same as in anger.]
Label: disgust

Text: My girlfriend left the house in which we lived together a few á months ago. This made me very sad.
Label: sadness

Text: I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball á offending her relatives.
Label: anger

Text: I stopped my car in front of a pedestrian crossing as a child was á crossing the street.  The car driving in the next lane did not á stop and the child got hurt.  Had I not stopped ...
Label: guilt

Text: Having an affair with my good friend's best friend. And every time á I see my best friend I feel guilt because we can't tell him.
Label: guilt

Text: A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue my á studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.
Label: guilt

Text: I did badly in the mid term examination.
Label: shame

Text: It was on St. Claus Day when I was five years old. St. Claus and á his Devil Servant came to see me. St. Claus' Devil Servant á rattled with his chain and bowled terribly. I was so frightened á that my parents had to ask him to leave.
Label: fear

Text: I felt fear when my friend and I broke into an abandoned military á base in Los Angeles this summer. I feared because I didn't want á to be caught.
Label: fear

Text: When I found out that I had failed to pass my exams during the á term by one point.  The fact that exactly the same thing had á happened last term did not help.
Label: sadness

Text: A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed a á wish to meet me, I have however avoided her (turned down an á invitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up all á my empathy.
Label: guilt

Text: A friend forgot his appointment with me.
Label: anger

Text: I vividly remember having feelings of disgust toward some of my á jr. high classmates who didn't work at all on their schoolwork á and who would coplain and take my tax money when I was older and á more successful than they were. At the time I pictured some á adults like this that I knew in the complaining situation.
Label: disgust

Text: Reading about executions and massacres which happened during á World War II, I felt disgust towards those who did it.
Label: disgust

Text: Friend's fiancT left her for me.
Label: guilt

Text: When I received the first year results as the first year had á involved a lot of work and I was very pleased when I got the á results.
Label: joy

Text: Finding out that China is still backward in science.
Label: sadness

Text: On my birthday, an old friend of mine sent me a card. I had not á met him for a year and I was very glad that he had thought of me.
Label: joy

Text: Telling friends about how my parents had been treating my á brothers and sisters unfairly.
Label: shame

Text: When my grandmother after staying with us for awhile went back á home.
Label: sadness

Text: I was on a class excursion, by boat to Stockholm.  At night my á class mates prepared to clebrate their motive in life which was á \life is merriment\".  I felt depressed about the way they sought á
Label: sadness

Text: I broke up with my boyfriend of seven months, but it was a very á \indepth\" relationship and so after feelings of grief and loss á
Label: sadness

Text: Death of a relative.
Label: sadness

Text: My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get á along very well and usually we share everything. Once we two were á sitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.
Label: shame

Text: Saw a snake unexpectedly.
Label: fear

Text: I was ashamed when my boyfriend went to sit with another girl á when he invited me to come to watch Drama festival.
Label: shame

Text: Peeping.
Label: guilt

Text: I had planned to study for my mid-term exams on a certain day and  á my room-mate called me to ask me to go out for a stroll.  I tried á to make an excuse so as not to go out but she refused to listen á to me and insisted that I go out with her.  I find it unnecessary  á to talk to her anymore.á
Label: anger

Text: I was asked to stop studying economics, a field which interested á me, by my employers.
Label: anger

Text: The day when my son said for the first time \mummy\"."
Label: joy

Text: When armed robbers broke into our house at night.
Label: fear

Text: A friend doesn't let me study when I want to. She doesn't feel I á need to study and doesn't understand how important studying is to á me. I get very angry with her.
Label: anger

Text: I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days á later he died.
Label: guilt

Text: I read a book about the situation in South-Africa, about the á terrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with the á white population.
Label: disgust

Text: I was enjoying the company of bird life while I was eating lunch á in a park when a group of people began throwing sticks at some of á the birds - for no reason other than the satisfaction of seeing á them being scared away.
Label: anger

Text: Once when I crossed the street, and was nearly trampled by a car.
Label: fear

Text: I joked with an unfamiliar friend in an obstinate tone.  I was á afraid of his misunderstanding me and being hurt and angry at me. á  I felt sorry over my conduct and thought that I had to find an á opportunity to apologize.
Label: guilt

Text: A wurm dropped on my head.
Label: disgust

Text: My uncle had promised to buy me a bicycle. As time went by and I á had not received it yet, I asked my father to buy it for me. á Later I heard that my uncle had wanted to offer me the bicycle on á my birthday two weeks later.
Label: guilt

Text: My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something á which was serious and a real burden to me.
Label: anger

Text: When the robbers broke in, at night.
Label: fear

Text: I was on vacation, and therefore I did not attend a meeting of á the day care centre.  Nevertheless, the very day I came back they á called me early morining to ask me \what are you going to do á
Label: anger

Text: I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while at á first he had said that he would not do that.
Label: joy

Text: I received the message that I'd been accepted at the school where I á really wanted to go.
Label: joy

Text: Some boys not cueing in the dining hall.
Label: disgust

Text: In my village there was this tax collector who used to cheat á people and collected more than was wanted, the surplus was for á his family and himself.
Label: disgust

Text: When a \friend\" woke me up in the middle of a blessful sleep by á
Label: disgust

Text: When a certain boy went about saying that I am his girlfriend. I á wrote him an insulting letter to him and called him names.
Label: anger

Text: In a film, there was an episode where they used a chain saw to á cut a man.  I could not look at it, but I could not avoid á listening either.  I sought shelter in my boyfriend's arms.
Label: disgust

Text: When I saw a film in which there was a scene where women were cut á to pieces.  Above all, it was the blood and the confusion which á impressed me most.
Label: disgust

Text: The parents of a friend of mine surprised us and another couple á sleeping in thier place.
Label: shame

Text: [ No response.]
Label: anger

Text: The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone call á from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of á the All India Essay competition.  I had won this prize when I was á an under-graduate when even post graduates had participated.  I á had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.
Label: joy

Text: I met a certain lady at Mchesi and I proposed a word of love to á her and at the same time she accepted my proposal.
Label: joy

Text: On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a á woman who were quarreling, beating each other, shouting and so á on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other á in such a degrading way.
Label: disgust

Text: When mum had beaten my young sister just because she had received á a letter from a boyfriend.
Label: disgust

Text: My grandfather died thirteen years ago.
Label: sadness

Text: One night, while I was sleeping, I woke up suddenly with the á sensation that there was someone in my room.
Label: fear

Text: A friend asked to borrow my notes and I did not give them away á (my notes too badly written)
Label: guilt

Text: I was once nominated as an Officer Cadet in the Armed Forces and á my name was cancelled on the list of nominees of those who were á sent to Kenya for Training.
Label: sadness

Text: I was camping with a friend of mine and we spent the night in the á forest.  I could not fall off to sleep and could clearly hear á noises from outside (steps ?) approaching our tent.
Label: fear

Text: Saw my father with that woman he is married to now.
Label: disgust

Text: It was a week before the higher level results were announced.  I á had tried and failed many times and this was the last time that á I was taking the exam.  I knew that if i failed again I woulld á have to enter the society.  I imagined things during this period á - I dreamt that I had entered university and it was a nice á experience.  When I thought about the future, an unexplainable á fear rose in me.  I feared being a worker and not having a bright á prospect, I also feared the criticism of my relatives as my á brother had gone to university.  Whenevr I thought of this issue á I could not eat or concentrate, and my heart beat increased.
Label: fear

Text: When I passed an exam which I had failed last year.
Label: joy

Text: I had a good relationship with two friends. Once without reason, á they clearly showed that they thought I was naive, dull and á unable to take care for myself, while I expostulated that I could á manage things.
Label: sadness

Text: When I could not find my 2 year old daughter.  I ran and looked á for her everywhere and could not find her.  (I finally found her, á she had gone to bed to sleep)
Label: fear

Text: Insulted by a teacher in front of the class.
Label: shame

Text: The time when I cleaned the house and everything was tidy, á then my cousin, who is 4 years old, came with a muddy pot and made á a mess of the whole thing.
Label: disgust

Text: When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important á family occasion that I should not have missed.
Label: guilt

Text: The repression of rioting and non-rioting \Blacks\" in South á
Label: disgust

Text: At the tender age of eleven a friend and I left a party and á proceeded to walk through dark and secluded streets of a bad á neighborhood to find a telephone (recent spate of Horror Movie á watching had occurred).
Label: fear

Text: I felt joy when I red my name in the list of the approved in the á entrance college examination.
Label: joy

Text: When my father died.
Label: sadness

Text: When my father shouted at me for going to a party with my sister.
Label: disgust

Text: A girl I do not like kept coming to me and talking to me.
Label: disgust

Text: After a long trip in my dad's van without incident I stopped to á fill the tank with gas and dented the side of the van against the á pole. Then my cars electrical system would not work when I tried á to drive home from his house.
Label: anger

Text: During a party I overheard a conversation about china. When I á wanted to give my opinion one of the people came out to be Chinese á and his opinion was right of course.
Label: shame

Text: Person talking about a situation while eating.
Label: disgust

Text: When I saw a lot of rubbish and animal waste on the floor.
Label: disgust

Text: I could not take care of my mother when she was admitted to a hospital  á for surgery, I continued my studies as I could not get leave.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was young, I stole some money from my mother's purse. It á wasn't very much, but I can remember when she found it gone I á felt very guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: I was walking in the countryside alone when I came across two á dogs who began barking at me.  I did not know whether they were á tied up or loose, but I was afraid of them approaching me.
Label: fear

Text: When I spoke to Jan-Erik Wikstr÷m on the telephone.
Label: anger

Text: When my flatmate put me down because she \thought\" she was better á
Label: anger

Text: When I was bluffing in front of my mother to get more money.

Text: Fear is an emotion that I experience very often.  Naturally this á is during exams and subsequently while waiting for the results.  á However there is one occassion when I was paralyzed with fear.  á This was when I was doing my M.A.-I, and we had a series of student á lectures.  I was one of the participants and my lecture happened á to be the opening lecture.  I had been confident all morning, about á twenty minutes before the lecture, my confidence started failing á me.  I felt my heart go cold, my lips go dry and I was really á paralyzed.  This incident of fear is still fresh.
Label: fear
