Text: I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.  At á night I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoids á were on the move.
Label: fear

Text: One of the greatest joiy was when I succeded in acquiring a á motorcycle through my own efforts.
Label: joy

Text: Arriving in New Zealand as a teenager - first overseas trip - á something \exhilarating\" about the change of scenery etc."
Label: joy

Text: When they tried to rob me.
Label: fear

Text: On my way to a concert I went with a man who tried to molest me. á At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fills á me with disgust.
Label: disgust

Text: When I went to the library three weeks after it had opened and á found that everyone was busy.
Label: shame

Text: When I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of a á friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother á watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We á never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as á it was for me.
Label: shame

Text: [ An unfair punishment.]
Label: anger

Text: When I was caught stealing money from my father.
Label: shame

Text: When I found out that my sister had been playing with my á confidential things which she had taken from my hand-bag.
Label: anger

Text: Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no á one to help me and call First Aid.
Label: fear

Text: When I dated my friend's boyfriend after they had broken up.
Label: shame

Text: When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned á I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature á National Olympiad.
Label: joy

Text: When relatives have acted strangely, and unfriendly towards me.
Label: shame

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: When I was dancing with a dame at a social, one of my friends who  á was interested in her came and took her away from me.  I was á really angry with him then.
Label: anger

Text: When I gave birth to a healthy boy.
Label: joy

Text: I was in a cafe with another person when, suddenly, several close á friends of my partner appeared.  I did not know what to do and my á partner felt uncomfortable.
Label: guilt

Text: While swimming, I hit my head at the bottom of the pool and á required stitches. I later learned that the consequences could á have been much more severe and that terrified me.
Label: fear

Text: I had not done my assignment seriously.  I only pretended to á finish the work as the work did not have any meaning for me.  The á whole thing made me feel guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: When I betrayed my former girlfriend.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was told that my father had passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: One dark night with no street lights, a car was obviously á following me.
Label: fear

Text: A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.
Label: disgust

Text: When I had to sleep in a bed at a hostel, which was full of dirt.
Label: disgust

Text: At my sister's wedding.
Label: joy

Text: After joining my M.A in Social Sciences, I appeared for the first á semester exam.  I failed one of the exams, and when I looked at á my results I felt disgusted and then I got angry.
Label: disgust

Text: During these Summer vacations a schoolmate who was not in my á class went to Britain.  Before he left, his classmates and some á of us who were accquainted with him had a B.B.Q on the beach.  á When I arrived I saw that some people , who were not close á friends of the departing person(person A), were playing mahjong.  á Some others were playing bridge and A had nothing to do, besides á it was A who had prepared the food.  Later when we wanted to talk á and his classmates did not even have the decency to listen to him.  á They only asked him a few questions half-heartedly and then they á talked on their own.  Some of their conversation was against me and  á another classmate.
Label: disgust

Text: In an examination ,which other students found easy I could hardly á think and did not know what to answer.
Label: shame

Text: When I finished my C.S. Project I was overjoyed. I felt relieved á because it was due the next day and I was tired of looking at it.
Label: joy

Text: The death of my father.
Label: sadness

Text: After our sad first of May party, I felt ashamed because the á friends who had been invited had to suffer.  We, the organizers á of the party, did not drive the intruders away.
Label: shame

Text: Being put down by the class leaders.
Label: anger

Text: When I learnt that I was selected for form I.
Label: joy

Text: The government's announcement of the withdrawal of the student á allowances in 1984.
Label: anger

Text: I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most á of all when we are at a party.
Label: joy

Text: My parents attitude towards each other when they should become á reconciled, despite my father's long-time addiction.
Label: disgust

Text: Sometime back I came across a certain man who was badly beaten by á some people because he was found raping the wife of the village á headman.
Label: guilt

Text: My girlfriend one day went out and promised to be back at 6.00 pm á however she first arrived at 10.00 pm, without a message (we had á to go out that evening).
Label: anger

Text: I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was á not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.
Label: fear

Text: In the dark an unreal figure formed by a shadow.
Label: fear

Text: When I considered writing a load of crap for this emotion.
Label: shame

Text: I ran a race for the CAL track team and I did terribly and then á the coach said that I should sit out for the season. I felt á really sad because I wasn't going to be able to run. It was á something I always had done and now I couldn't do it anymore.
Label: sadness

Text: Maltreatment of children.
Label: disgust

Text: I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had á caused. A third person meddled in our conversation, turned my á efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had á intended.
Label: anger

Text: I made an appointment with a friend to drink coffee togehter. á However, for the third time in that week she arrived an hour too á late.
Label: anger

Text: A fall during a climb, with almost with no previous experience.
Label: fear

Text: A four year girl ran away from her father straight in front of my á car.  I was forced to use the emergency brakes.
Label: fear

Text: I was playing a sport in an advanced PE class and many of the á people were not advanced.
Label: disgust

Text: In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they á greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.
Label: guilt

Text: When I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by other á people. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.
Label: anger

Text: I feel it when I see that somebody is traying to made a stupid of á me.
Label: anger

Text: When my little sister was sick at home and I thought that she á would die.
Label: fear

Text: A colleague asked me for some advice and as he did not have á enough confidence in me he asked a third person.
Label: anger

Text: When I was about 14 years old, I \borrowed\" a can of drink from á
Label: guilt

Text: I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life á of another by means of utterly unfair methods.
Label: disgust

Text: Criticized in front of the class.
Label: shame

Text: And she said absurd things, false things that filled my ears and á inflated my head which seemed to be caught in a carcass where the á heart wanted to explode and where the arm wanted to knock down á the world.
Label: anger

Text: Failing an examn because I did not work hard enough.
Label: shame

Text: Close friend discovered I had deceived them. Felt shame at having á done it and knowing that they knew.
Label: shame

Text: I had a very close friend who went to Canada after her F.B, his  á departure was unavoidable.  When he came back during the Summer á holidays I was very happy as nothing had changed between us.
Label: joy

Text: I had subscribed for this test. We were informed by our á secretary where the test took place. We went over there and thought á there was a course. So we went back again I felt ashamed that the á secretary again should see me.
Label: shame

Text: I think I have hardly had a situation where I felt disgusted. á Perhaps once, when I saw a big spider.
Label: disgust

Text: When I lied at home.   I told them that I was going to a á Christian meeting and I went to see my boyfriend instead.
Label: guilt

Text: After I had had a disappointment in my private life, my friend, á who studies in Vienna, came to see me spontaneously.
Label: joy

Text: My father died after two very painful weeks in bed. I felt á relieved, and was ashamed of that.
Label: shame

Text: Lying to my grandparents about visiting my boyfriend in Chico.
Label: shame

Text: After going through a glass door, I sustained a number of serious á cuts which were gaping open.
Label: fear

Text: When I got a letter offering me the Summer job that I had applied á for.
Label: joy

Text: At the death of my husband's father's mother which occurred á during university examinations and therefore I was unable to á attend her funeral.
Label: sadness

Text: I was ashamed of being laughed at by my colleagues when I failed á to answer a question in the classroom.
Label: shame

Text: When I swindled money out of someone.
Label: shame

Text: We always made a lot of noise during a certain lecture.  This may á have been because we did not respect the lecturer. Finaly, the á lecturer could not tolerate it and he scolded us angrily and á pointed out our misbehaviour.
Label: guilt

Text: Saying goodbye to a friend.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was fined for speeding.
Label: guilt

Text: Winning the local soccer championships this year was a great joy.
Label: joy

Text: The teacher of one course gave me 10 questions with sub-questions á going from a to e for each question.  She asked me to do all this á in one and a half hours.  It involved a lot of describing and á explaining and even though I knew all the answers, I could not á finish the work.
Label: disgust

Text: I had wasted some time instead of doing something I needed to do á to give to a friend. (Also in the time I wasted I had done some á things I did not consider morally right).
Label: guilt

Text: When I shot a bird in the head with a shotgun.
Label: guilt

Text: When I didn't notify someone that he was summoned by a headmaster á and as a result he ended being on a heavy punishment.
Label: guilt

Text: We were on the road in a car when a lorry bypassed us.  We had to á swerve and we almost got run over.
Label: fear

Text: I was told to do something I did not want to do.
Label: anger

Text: Making a sexual pass at my cousin with whom I have a very close á personal relationship.
Label: guilt

Text: I was moving in the graveyard at 6.00 pm one day and was griped á by fear because I was told that ghosts detain people moving there á at night.
Label: fear

Text: Finding out I am not chosen for the English lectures.
Label: sadness

Text: When two female classmates and I were having lunch, we chatted and  á cracked jokes, I was very happy.  However, I felt that I may have  á said something inappropriate which might cause them to have a bad  á impression of me.
Label: joy

Text: A friend of mine got encouragement and I did not, as the á supervisor did not like me.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is á not a complicated operation, but just before it started I was á very afraid so that I will never forget it.
Label: fear

Text: Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out of á Nijmegen) for a while.
Label: joy

Text: During the short period of my unemployment about six years back.
Label: anger

Text: When I feel helpless after having tried to help someone without á any result.
Label: sadness

Text: I received a letter which was too strong for me. It said I had á done something which I really didn't do.
Label: disgust

Text: I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in love á with me.
Label: joy

Text: My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I still á haven't had time to see her.
Label: guilt

Text: When my mother was robbed in a shop.
Label: fear

Text: When I did not inform my friends of my forthcoming birthday.
Label: shame

Text: When I became aware that an acquaintance had stolen from friends.
Label: disgust

Text: During a family discussion on my future and my prospects as a á student, they accused me of not bothering about looking for a job to á assume my financial situation.
Label: anger

Text: Through the media and their presentation of a kidnapped child who á was raped.
Label: disgust

Text: Noticing my flat had maggotts !
Label: disgust

Text: Winning a tight tennis match. One set to play, and the team was á behind by 3 games. We won the last set 6-2 and won the match by a á game.
Label: joy

Text: Failed to do what I had promised.
Label: guilt

Text: In traffic I often get relatively angry with other drivers. á Several transgressions make me mad, especially not yielding to á priority traffic (e.g. coming from the right).
Label: anger

Text: When I made the same mistake that I had accused someone else of, and á this was obvious to a third pereson.
Label: shame

Text: When I heard that my father had passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: When somebody who had been a bully and had acted cruelly to á others who were unable to defend themselves was taken down a few á notches and he began to grovel. I was disgusted with his á grovelling and the manner in which he had treated others.
Label: disgust

Text: Two summers ago my best friend and I drove into unknown mountains á at midnight to pick up my broken car. We told one another á horrifically scary ghost/murder stories and succeeded in scaring á eachother pretty well - even though somewhere in our heads we á knew the fears were unjustified.
Label: fear

Text: When the paramilitary was sent to the UNZA and it started using á tear gas and started intimidating the students without any á provocation.
Label: anger

Text: When I did not get the compound which is known.
Label: fear

Text: Out on a weekend with a group of people, everybody felt irritated á because at night the music didn't stop in time. And at breakfast á my boyfriend ran away because we didn't agree with him. I felt á angry.
Label: anger

Text: My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend á himself very well; I should have taken his part.
Label: guilt

Text: I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years, á when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal á that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a á bit guilty for what had happened.
Label: guilt

Text: I felt guilty when I had refused to lend money to my friend who á needed it immediately.
Label: guilt

Text: Promising someone to do their job and then not being able to do á it due to transport troubles.
Label: guilt

Text: When I heard the news that my brother had passed away.  It was á the first time that I lost a brother.
Label: sadness

Text: My father has a chronic desease. In the autumn of 1983 he had a á very strong fit or seizure.
Label: fear

Text: When I passed the TOEFEL with very good marks.
Label: joy

Text: I had been away all night without having told my parents about á it.  In the morning when I came home, my mother looked tired.  á She said that she had been awake all night because of me and that á she was angry and disappointed.
Label: shame

Text: When I overslept for the second time on the day I had an á examination.
Label: shame

Text: I tried to swindle a jeweller because my watch was broken and I á wanted to have it repaired it was a pity but they detected it.
Label: shame

Text: I went to visit a friend in hospital.  He was going to be á operated the next day.  I was afraid that they would not let me á in and I did not know what his reaction would be on seeing me.
Label: fear

Text: One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had á objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced á me to come.  The day of the appointment; I had to wait for him á for over an hour.
Label: anger

Text: [ I feel a sense of joy whenever I complete a piece of writing á which is part of my work.  Intense reading also brings me joy.  I á also feel happy when I reminiscent about them.]
Label: joy

Text: As a child - about 8 years old - walking across a paddock - being á set upon by another boy who claimed it was \his land\" - being á
Label: anger

Text: I had promised to say goodbye to a person who was going on a á trip, and I did not turn up.
Label: guilt

Text: Classes were over and I wanted to go home.  A friend of mine á asked me to wait for half an hour to take him back home.  I said á no.
Label: guilt

Text: When I state things with great positiveness and try to convince á others, and it appears that my statement is not right.
Label: shame

Text: When I was involved in a car accident last November, after the á first fall of snow.  I lost control of the car and it spun round á and landed on the opposite side of the road, on the hard á shoulder.  It was stopped by a pole on top of a bank sloping down á to a stream.
Label: fear

Text: I was in the cafeteria at the university and a class-mate told me á that a friend of hers had had all her teeth taken out because of á an infection caused by her eating a rat's nail in her hamburger.
Label: disgust

Text: When quarreling with friends.
Label: guilt

Text: Being disloyal with persons I loved.
Label: guilt

Text: Some people were unfairly treated, because of their á nationality/colour.
Label: disgust

Text: I took my father's car to church one Sunday (I told them that's á where I was going ) I decided instead to go for a drive to the á beach - on the way I got a puncture.
Label: guilt

Text: Doing poorly on a midterm.
Label: disgust

Text: Quarreling with my father, when he made false assertions.
Label: disgust

Text: Flirting with other girls while I already had a very good á relationship. When there are problems in my relationship, the á flirting increases as does the feeling of guilt.
Label: guilt

Text: I went to visit friends and it was very companionable.
Label: joy

Text: I received a poor grade on a midterm even though I got all the á right answers and knew the material. I went to the TA to try to á raise my grade and he wouldn't do it.
Label: anger

Text: When I see dead dogs on the road.
Label: disgust

Text: When I arrived too late at a meeting of mentor (the night before á the introduction of novices on the University start).
Label: shame

Text: Many years ago a friend wanted me to with her to southern Europe á and I preferred to travel alone.  I felt guilty because I wanted á to go on my own.
Label: guilt

Text: I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular á job was not done, it was not my job to do it.
Label: anger

Text: On holidays - just driving along a road beautiful scenery. Just á with my boyfriend - not really talking but just feeling á overwhelmed.
Label: joy

Text: When my sister's first child came home, after one week in á intensive care at the hospital.
Label: joy

Text: I felt guilty when one of my secondary teacher left me while I á was in Form three, he was the only one who showed love to me.
Label: guilt

Text: A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for a á concert which I considered important.  He could not get them the á way he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.
Label: anger

Text: It was when I stepped on a python (snake) unknowingly while it á was sleeping near a baobab tree.
Label: fear

Text: [ I do not remember when I last felf ashamed.  I do not usually á feel ashamed of what I do.]
Label: shame

Text: It was when my father caught me with a girl in dark corners and á asked me what I was doing there.
Label: shame

Text: It so happened that while staying at anaunt's place I discovered á that I was afraid of sleeping in pitch darkness.  The room á which my sister and I were sharing had no light, and I would á refuse to sleep without having the light of the adjoining á bathroom switched on.
Label: fear

Text: I wanted to go out to walk but I didn't know either where or á with whom, suddenly an invitation appeared.
Label: joy

Text: It was in the evening when I heard that my girl went to Zambia á and that she would never come back.
Label: sadness

Text: When a friend died.
Label: sadness

Text: In primary school I once faltered while answering a question and á the others started laughing.
Label: shame

Text: When I began to date, the first gestures of affection made me á feel ashamed. Note: for GUILT go to record n¦231
Label: shame

Text: Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.
Label: sadness

Text: My boy-friend had promised me to come home at about 10 p.m. He á did not return until midnight and had consumed a lot of alcohol.
Label: anger

Text: Two-timing - going out with person other than guy I was in á relationship with.
Label: guilt

Text: After an oral examination I shook the professor's hand, but he á had only stretched it out for my ball-point-pen.
Label: shame

Text: Soiled my short trousers with faeces.
Label: shame

Text: Disgust is a feeling that I have never experienced with peoplie á but , on the other hand, it has been with repulsive animals, i;e á snakes on T.V.
Label: disgust

Text: When I argue with my mother about the way she treats her two á children differently.
Label: sadness

Text: When I lose on my bets on anything - baseball, football, á basketball, track, craps, poker, or arcade - whether its 5 á dollars or 200 I feel that I should never have done it in the á first place.
Label: disgust

Text: When I began to date a boy with whom I am till now. This was 16 á months ago.
Label: joy

Text: [ No response.]
Label: anger

Text: Once, I accidentally injured a boy in the eye and he almost lost á it.
Label: guilt

Text: When going out in the weekend I have to bike 5 kilometers through á lonely and dark polders, then I always have terrifying fantasies.
Label: fear

Text: A friend whom I had gone out of my way to do something for did á not bother to acknowledge my efforts, and treated me badly á thereafter.
Label: anger

Text: When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I á respect.
Label: shame

Text: Close friend leave to go overseas for an indefinite period. á Farewell scene at airport.
Label: sadness

Text: It was the first time I met him (my boyfriend Mr.W).  It was á during the first term Summer vacations.  We met each other while á handing in our homework.  He invited me have a trip with him and á we were together till 8 P.M.
Label: joy

Text: When my ex-boyfriend and I separated.
Label: sadness

Text: My parents told me that they do not like my friend.
Label: sadness

Text: When the guy I was in love with told me that he had met someone á else and that we would not meet again for a year.  Although we á did not have a steady relatioship, we were having an affair.
Label: sadness

Text: During a demonstration I climbed up the closed central door of a á bus.  When the bus stopped I had to go back to the same place, á afraid that the police would see me.
Label: fear

Text: One night during dinner my nephew was naughty, so I quarrelled with my  á parents.   I regreted this as my nephew was only two years old and I  á had to tolerate him !  The quarrel made my father think that his children  á may not take care of him in the future (it was a slip of the tongue and  á this made me realize that my father keeps his thoughts to himself).  I was  á still very angry so I dropped my bowl and chopsticks and went to the kitchen  á to drink tea and then ran to the other side of the house.
Label: guilt

Text: The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt this emotion when my name was announced on the radio that á I had been selected to come to Lilongwe School for Health á Sciences to take a training course as a Medical Assistat.
Label: joy

Text: I was in ILHA GRANDE with a wonderful sun, with wonderful people, á with a wonderful sea, with a wonderful boy.
Label: joy

Text: After my car accident, when I woke up in a heap of stones.
Label: fear

Text: Being rude to somebody who was impolite to me.
Label: shame

Text: I was travelling in a local train when a drunkard, smelling á terribly, entered the same carriage and started eating fish that á was stinking.
Label: disgust

Text: When a classmate hit me on my occipital region when I was busy á studying and concentrating on my classnotes.
Label: anger

Text: My girlfriend does practice and therefore leaves me alone at á night and in the weekend. In addition, she is very busy doing á several things. So we don't see each other often.
Label: anger

Text: When I received the letter informing that I had been accepted to á be a Chinese university student, I was excited as I had longed á for it.
Label: joy

Text: When my mother looked in my drawer (where I keep my personal á things) and she found some porno photos that I have kept from á more than a week, and split it.
Label: shame

Text: I know that a certain person feels very lonely, and that she á always looks forward to seeing me. However, often I am too á busy to visit her, then I feel guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km á off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough á room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there á once again. When I did not do that they had a way to make me feel á guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towards á my students.
Label: guilt

Text: Long illness.
Label: sadness

Text: At a gathering I found myself involuntarily sitting next to two á people who expressed opinions that I considered very low and á discriminating.
Label: disgust

Text: There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. I á always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my á mother. So my mother always scolded her.
Label: guilt

Text: When I watched a report about El Salvador on TV, I saw people who á had been murdered by terrible methods.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt ashamed when I fought with my mother on some issue, and á caused her trouble.
Label: shame

Text: When I heard of the death of my mother.
Label: sadness

Text: I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter á to UNZA.  This happened again when I passed all my first year á courses.
Label: joy

Text: When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother á who had passed away about a month ago.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt joy when I heard that I was accepted for the Free á University in Driebergen.
Label: joy

Text: [ Can not think of anything.]
Label: shame

Text: I once was accused of falling in love with someone's girlfriend á which was not true because the girl was just a friend of mine.
Label: anger

Text: When I received the news that my in-laws had passed away.  I á depended heavily on them for their guidance and the running of á their daughter's buisness.
Label: sadness

Text: Being chosen to do this experiment.
Label: joy

Text: When a \friend\" dropped a frog down my neck, and I didn't know á
Label: disgust

Text: When my grandfather was sick, and died I felt more sad, though, á when he was sick.
Label: sadness

Text: Going away for the weekend, leaving my College room open - when I á returned several friends had had a party there, leaving the mess.
Label: anger

Text: I ate 12 biscuits one night after tea while watching TV - I don't á know why.
Label: guilt

Text: I felt afraid just before receiving the question paper of the á part II exam.
Label: fear

Text: When I was caught telling a white lie.  At that time, I was not á allowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.  One day when I was late, I á made up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place, á though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing with á my pals.
Label: shame

Text: While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met an á acquaintance of hers.  My friend started showing off and telling á false stories about herself and praising herself.
Label: disgust

Text: When I opened my TE Score envelope, and saw I got into á Physiotherapy.
Label: joy

Text: Can't remember having had this feeling.
Label: disgust

Text: At school, when the only thing people my age could think of was getting á rolling drunk. They couldn't have a good time without firstly á getting drunk.
Label: disgust

Text: When my roommate's moped was stolen I was very angry.
Label: anger

Text: When my brother hit his head and lost consciousness at the sports á practice.  For some time he could not remember what had happened á but he recovered later.
Label: fear

Text: When I finally managed to get a specific sound from my guitar, á after baving tried for a long time.
Label: joy

Text: My boyfriend breaking up with me about 7 months after I had an á abortion. Just the fact that he was ignoring me and continued to á do so.
Label: anger

Text: I was raped once when I went through a dark alley at the back of á our house. The man pushed me in the bushes. I fought back and á succeeded to escape.
Label: fear

Text: A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he á didn't come.
Label: anger

Text: [ Cannot recall any incident when I felt shame.]
Label: shame

Text: I had never made a malicious joke in front of my boyfriend. Last á week I did it I was funny, he loved it, and I died of shame.
Label: shame

Text: When I had gone for a boxing tournament which ended at 2 o'clock á in the morning.  I was alone on my way back, and I could hear the á barking of the dogs, the nocturnal animals and the sound of my     á own footsteps.  There had been a rumour  circulating that there á were ghosts in that area.
Label: fear

Text: Whenever I see an alcoholic.
Label: disgust

Text: When I won a tennis match.
Label: joy

Text: The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep had á been eaten by the neighbour's dogs.  It had been locked out by my á wife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.
Label: sadness

Text: When I triffled with other people.
Label: guilt

Text: When opened a box of biscuits and found worms inside.
Label: disgust

Text: When my father bought me a suit.
Label: joy

Text: At one of my close friends saying she didn't like the way I am á nice to people I don't know, or who have been nasty to me.
Label: anger
