Text: When I was in the 12th standard, I could not speak English.  One á day, while  talking with my relatives I used a wrong word and  á my cousin corrected me, believing that I did not know English.  I á really felt ashamed then.á
Label: shame

Text: Continous fear of a nuclear war.
Label: fear

Text: I remember deceiving my brother, I told him that I was going to á attend the Sunday service, instead I went out to the town with a friend.
Label: guilt

Text: I came out of the house at 7:20 am Monday morning getting ready t á go to school and fight for a parking when I saw my car had a flat á tire.
Label: anger

Text: A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and see á me. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town. á Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I got á impatient I called her but her parents told me that she had gone á skiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointment á to be able to see her.
Label: anger

Text: When I had crossed Lilongwe forest I heard that there was a rabid á hyena just near the path in the forest.
Label: fear

Text: A father of 4 children killed in an accident.
Label: sadness

Text: My love and me rented a room in a hotel one evening.  We stayed á there a few hours and when leaving the hotel, I felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: When I had my first boyfriend.
Label: joy

Text: Lying to a friend about something that was trivial.
Label: shame

Text: A classmate damaged ma iron and tried to hide the damage.
Label: anger

Text: Being alone in the room at night.
Label: fear

Text: At the police centre a man between 40-50 was brought in.  He was á very drunk and in all likelihood had not slept indoors for a long á time and had relieved himself in his trousers.
Label: disgust

Text: I was disgusted with my girlfriend's behaviour. She was going out á with other boys who were also my friends.
Label: disgust

Text: From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when I á am in a restaurant.
Label: disgust

Text: [ It irritates me when people talk about me behind my back.  I    á prefer people to tell me what they have to, on my face instead á of talking behind my back.]
Label: anger

Text: When our government decided to withdraw student allowances as it á was one of the conditions imposed by the IMF. á
Label: anger

Text: My friend came to the concert for my sake as it was me who had á organized it and the concert was unsuccessful.
Label: guilt

Text: My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life, old-fashioned values) á and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions.  I have á noticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems by á drinking.  I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.
Label: disgust

Text: After a meeting ended we started talking about when we would á have the next discussion ( I had many tests the coming week and á could not have a meeting in between, I thought that they would á understand this as they had always done).  They did not á understand my problem and thought that I should not have so many á other activities.  Their reaction made me burst into tears.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt this when I was copying homework for one of my classes.
Label: shame

Text: When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked, á because there where persons that didn't have problems, and á wouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.
Label: anger

Text: When I told my sister I had slept with my boyfriend, and she at á first was mad at me I then felt shame for this act, but not á guilt.
Label: shame

Text: I \snapped\" very abruptly at my mother when she said something á
Label: guilt

Text: Hit a dog with my car, and didn't stop.
Label: shame

Text: I had been very weary all week - no letters, no phonecalls, no á visitors and then my younger sister came with some cheese, a card á and some pocket money for me; and she told me that she was á working now.
Label: joy

Text: When some housemen told me a young girl like you should not be á allowed to lecture to consultants, I was too shy to argue against á them.
Label: guilt

Text: When I deny something to my sister and after a while I feel sorry á and try to bypass the situation.
Label: guilt

Text: When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.
Label: joy

Text: When my parents got divorced.
Label: sadness

Text: People having a football match outside the window during the á lecture.
Label: anger

Text: Guilt conscious struck me when I failed my Standard Two á Examinations in 1972. I knew that I would suffer the consequences á of what I had been doing during class hours: thus playing with á friends and sometimes not even going to school.
Label: guilt

Text: When as a 7 year old, I stole money from my mother.
Label: guilt

Text: The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student of á economics.
Label: joy

Text: Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.
Label: disgust

Text: At my father, when he yelled and accused my sister's friend (over á the phone) of doing something he didn't do, or know anything á about.
Label: disgust

Text: My 2 year old daughter disappeared in a moment of inattention; I á was responsible for her.
Label: fear

Text: A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept á putting it off.  When I finally made it, I did not see her for á days only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died.  I á felt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not do á what she had requested me to do.
Label: guilt

Text: When a friend of mine discussed with me, I felt fear of losing á her. This occurred because we had a missunderstanding between á mutual colleagues.
Label: fear

Text: When I passed the driving test three weeks ago and got my á licence.
Label: joy

Text: When someone close to me is travelling by car and is delayed.
Label: fear

Text: This is an incident that many of us witness in our everyday life á in a city like Bombay.  One day I was travelling by bus, three á men dragged two fellows out of the bus.  Once outside they were á beaten into pulp.  These two fellows, who got beaten, were pick-pockets á and they were being beaten by all and sundry.  I thought to á myself -\what is life?\".  It is one hell of a place where á
Label: disgust

Text: Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of á names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.  We á read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar á room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if á I would succeed as a group leader.
Label: fear

Text: When my parents work very hard and get tired - while I go to á school and study instead of helping them. I feel that I'm letting á them down, disappointing them.
Label: guilt

Text: I had shown anger toward my dog and he was killed later that day.
Label: guilt

Text: One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my á friends.  Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so we á stayed indoors.
Label: sadness

Text: We were at a football match and when we were leaving the stadium á (the stadium was packed with people) and I lost my shoe in the á crowd. Our attempts to find it didn't give any result and I had á to go home without one shoe. In other words to cross the whole á town !
Label: shame

Text: When my honest intentions were marred by another's jealousy.
Label: sadness

Text: When I have to leave the baby in the carriage and go shopping, I á fear that something will happen to the baby.
Label: fear

Text: When my boss cut off my vacations saying that in that month it á wouldn't be possible, and after some time he let another girl á take vacations that month. The anger was because of the á resentment. Resulting from our bad relationship.
Label: anger

Text: The death of Jaya Prakash Narayan caused a great deal of sadness á as I believed that he was the only true democrat and a ray of á hope on the Indian horizon.
Label: sadness

Text: When we got a young dog.
Label: joy

Text: It was when I was selected to go to a Secondary school to start á form I.
Label: joy

Text: I was cold to my sister without meaning it, just because I was á upset and frustated.
Label: guilt

Text: When I found out how the people of Ethiopia were starving and á their government was spending millions on celebrating being in á power so many years. Then I saw all these people on TV needing á food, etc.
Label: disgust

Text: When I received a letter from my girlfriend telling me that she á was engaged to an another man.
Label: shame

Text: When I laughed at a lame man walking down the road, it looked á funny at the time but later I felt lousy.  It was the same day á that I had stolen some coins from my mother in the shop.
Label: guilt

Text: The long lasting illness of my grand-mother, and the changes in á family relationships caused by it.
Label: sadness

Text: When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been á disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few  á days earlier.
Label: anger

Text: I once felt guilty when a certain passenger in the same (ship, á plane ?) which I boarded when coming from home lost his 10t which á in fact fell into my pocket unknowingly.
Label: guilt

Text: After failing a second attempt at Med 4, following a number of á difficult personal circumstances.
Label: shame

Text: When Kanishka was blown up, I really felt disgusted at people á killing each other.
Label: disgust

Text: Some foreign students playing loud music before the biology á examn.
Label: anger

Text: In Punjab, when in the name of religion people killed each other á during the agitation.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was told that I had no right to control my lover.
Label: disgust

Text: Forced to fill in a questionnaire.
Label: guilt

Text: When I heard the news of my grandfather's sudden death.
Label: sadness

Text: When I entered in the University after a year of struggles.
Label: joy

Text: When I missed my train this morning, I felt sad for some time.
Label: sadness

Text: When I missed crashing, by a hair's breadth, into a man who came á out 20 metres ahead of me when I was driving at 110km/h.
Label: fear

Text: Inter-national sports events won by my favourite national team or á player brings me joy, e.g when India won the World cup cricket á match.
Label: joy

Text: When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was selected to come here.
Label: joy

Text: When I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me, á because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.
Label: shame

Text: When I do not put in the needed amount of hours of work or study á for the day, I feel guilty and try to make up for the lost á time.
Label: guilt

Text: A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by á insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in á front of her child. She left it happen without saying a word in á order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to á calm the man, but without success. Just because he was stronger á we had to comply. From that day I detested him.
Label: disgust

Text: My ex-boyfriend began to date my best friend. After they had been á seeing each other, I found out that he had been sleeping with á another girl, without my friend knowing, I told my friend what he á had been doing behind her back.
Label: anger

Text: When I had my first oral examination after a long time; á especially one day before the examination when I had the feeling á that I had not studied enough and had not enough time to make up á for it.
Label: fear

Text: The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was á of my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as well á as her family etc.
Label: sadness

Text: I was forced to leave an unforgettable friend.
Label: sadness

Text: I was scolded by my mother for no reason.
Label: anger

Text: When one lets friends down
Label: guilt

Text: A girl entered in the division where I work and greeted everybody á but not me.
Label: anger

Text: In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections with á several employers, after several years of dedication I was á dismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.
Label: sadness

Text: When I met a good friend of mine after a long time.
Label: joy

Text: After shouting at a friend.
Label: shame

Text: Insulted my girlfriend during a peptalk.
Label: shame

Text: A holiday at a whitesand deserted beach. A cool evening near the á end of summer and we had a fire in the sand - toasted á marshmellows, cuddled and drank champagne.
Label: joy

Text: I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect, á lied to me.
Label: disgust

Text: When my relationship with my family is very poor I often fear á being excluded from the group, a fear which is stronger in á situations when an argument is on hand.
Label: fear

Text: I felt anger when I saw that I was being misleaded by my á boyfriend, he went out with other girls. I felt anger for his á falsity.
Label: anger

Text: One evening, when I had gone fishing with my friends, we heard á the roar of a lion near by and had to run for our lives.
Label: fear

Text: I once saw an elderly lady who was not properly dressed.  She was á wearing a transparent dress, such things are not sopposed to be á seen in African society.
Label: disgust

Text: My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call of á mine.
Label: guilt

Text: When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his á own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.
Label: anger

Text: When I recently got a very positive answer from a clinic telling á me that they would willingly assist and collect data for me for a á clinical pilot study.
Label: joy

Text: The time that I had to put my dog to sleep.
Label: guilt

Text: When I splashed a child by not slowing down while driving á through a puddle of water.
Label: guilt

Text: I was so sad when I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He was á the only man who was supporting my parents as well as myself.
Label: sadness

Text: When I had to walk home in the dark for the first time.
Label: fear

Text: It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and á told us my father was badly injured in an accident.
Label: fear

Text: At a restaurant I observed how the gypsies tried to get money by á cheating the foreigners i.e non Swedish speaking.  My anger had á nothing to do with hatred against foreigners, but it was an á expression of the anger I feel when I see people being used .
Label: anger

Text: We were writing Primary school leaving Examinations when I had á fallen at the steps going into the Exam room.
Label: shame

Text: I woke up in the middle of the night of a nightmare, I was alone, á it was very quiet and very dark.
Label: fear

Text: When I was in the puberty I smashed the favourite toy of my á little brother because of a fit of rage.
Label: guilt

Text: When I saw a dead body in the mortuary I became afraid and I was á filled with fear.
Label: fear

Text: When a close friend drowned in the American River.
Label: sadness

Text: When I bribed the person who caught me doing something I was not á supposed to have done.  I was very ashamed of what I had done.
Label: shame

Text: I woke up at the house of someone I knew, not remembering very á much about what had been said or done during the party on the á previous night.
Label: shame

Text: When I got separated from the woman I loved.
Label: sadness

Text: Leaving Melbourne to move interstate - leaving relatives and á friends behind.
Label: sadness

Text: For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off our á clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go á into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and á staring at us.
Label: shame

Text: When a man rang the doorbell and wanted to enter the house with á violence. I was alone at home that moment.
Label: fear

Text: When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents á treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of á them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not á encouraged and was rejected.
Label: disgust

Text: Earlier, I was afraid of speaking in front of a crowd of people.
Label: fear

Text: Saw some girls dressed up like Americans
Label: disgust

Text: When I heard a lion roar for the first time.
Label: fear

Text: I was at home and we were sleeping when we heard some robbers á breaking into our house.
Label: fear

Text: When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and á looking down on me.
Label: anger

Text: My bicycle was demolished.
Label: anger

Text: I received the results of the test paper of my major subject and á I found that my result was not as good as a classmate who had á recently changed his major subject.    I felt very ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: When I was finally qualified for my profession.
Label: joy

Text: I had too much homework and examinations and I did not know how á to organize my work.
Label: anger

Text: Marriage crises.  Boredom.
Label: sadness

Text: Not being able to do well to be chosen for the English lecture.
Label: sadness

Text: When someone pointed out that I was proud, yet I didn't dress up á properly. This was when I and my friend went for a dnce one á Saturday.
Label: shame

Text: Sleeping with a girl on a Saturday night and then not contacting á her in later days.
Label: shame

Text: [ No response.]
Label: sadness

Text: I have once been very sad and lonely.  This was when I was trying á to organize a play as a student (15 years).  Instead of á materializing, it fizzled out.  The worst thing was that the play á fell apart completely and I found myself weeping uncontrollably.  á Now when I think of it, I laugh it off; but at that time it was á intense.
Label: sadness

Text: Without the employer's knowledge and even without any á communication their bank accounts were changed and their personal á accounts closed.
Label: anger

Text: I felt ashamed when in a certain occasion I had to read a text á and didn't stop stuttering.
Label: shame

Text: Thinking of the unknown, what happens at the moment of death, á etc.
Label: fear

Text: A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore, once I á stayed with him and his girlfriend, I bought some meat, but nobody á wanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said \I thought á
Label: shame

Text: [ Whenever I do something prohibited or wrong I feel guilty.]
Label: guilt

Text: Watching a horror film.
Label: fear

Text: Not getting the reference paper.
Label: sadness

Text: Once I lied to my parents and this made me feel very guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: My best friend got married and left her home-town to go and live á in Poona.  After her wedding I felt sad.
Label: sadness

Text: Spit and vomit.
Label: disgust

Text: A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling to á marry him.  The girl tried to refuse but her parents would not á leave her alone.
Label: anger

Text: Before going to school I usually take something to eat right at á school and this time I took Father's money without him knowing á it. I felt guilty and I returned the money.
Label: guilt

Text: Last week I had planned to play tennis and had booked a tennis á court.   However when I arrived at the university gym the clerk á told me that the court was being used for lessons.
Label: anger

Text: Being catched when stealing.
Label: guilt

Text: Article published.
Label: joy

Text: When a person is privileged in account of situations that are á unjust, and disloyal to colleagues and friends.
Label: anger

Text: Disgust with oneself after being intoxicated enough to go to bed á with a stranger.
Label: disgust

Text: When my grandmother died of cancer.
Label: sadness

Text: When I failed two subjects last year.
Label: sadness

Text: When they told me that I had got a study grant.
Label: joy

Text: When I almost walked on a snake.
Label: fear

Text: Walking through campus at night a squirrel jumped in front of á me.
Label: fear

Text: Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for one á week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my á friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was á terrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had an á improper and unsavoury conversation.
Label: disgust

Text: Once in primary five, I had forgotten to take a book to class and á the teacher punished me by asking me to stand at the back of the á class.  I thought about the way my mother would react if she saw á me being punished.  My mother was very good to me and though she á did not see me punished, I felt sorry for her.
Label: shame

Text: After a busy day I went back to my hostel.  I closed the door and á had a drink, then I read my favourite book on the bed.  Suddenly á I felt peace and joy.
Label: joy

Text: I felt guilty when I thought that I was still not standing on my á own feet.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was a child I broke plates because I wasn't given food on á the grounds of coming home late.
Label: disgust

Text: My younger brother and sister were involved in an accident on á their way back from school and my brother was quite badly hurt.
Label: sadness

Text: Finding out that the girl I like does not like me.
Label: sadness

Text: When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keep á the promise.
Label: shame

Text: I passed an exam which I thought I had failed.
Label: joy

Text: When a very dirty class-mate farted in my  presence.  There was a á terrible smell.
Label: disgust

Text: I saw a movie called \The Thing\", the film directed by John á
Label: disgust

Text: Shifted from Melbourne to Brisbane. All my old school friends á gave me a party and I had to say good-bye to them all.
Label: sadness

Text: A fear of lack of personal powers.
Label: fear

Text: I was caught sneaking sweets.
Label: guilt

Text: I feel sadness from the fact that I was not born with a better á appearance.
Label: sadness

Text: When I stole money from my mother and she asked me later if I was á responsible.  I never admitted it.
Label: guilt

Text: My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.
Label: anger

Text: I felt guilty when I read an advertisement for a job as a chemist á in the newspaper and when my friend asked me if I had applied for á that job, I told him that I had not even seen the paper of that á day.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was hitch-hiking and I went with a man who drived like a á madman.
Label: fear

Text: To fight with a sister and to know that she doesn't care.
Label: sadness

Text: I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me á to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come á home late in the morning. Next day I called him - he was not at á home. As something like that had happened to me several times á before, I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody á and I felt very sad.
Label: sadness

Text: A good report card (a scholarship) in primary school.
Label: joy

Text: A relative died.
Label: fear

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: When I saw a fight I had a physical reaction of disgust and of á deep perturbation.
Label: disgust

Text: I had to call someone and make an appointment for a conversation. á I was very afraid to fail.
Label: fear

Text: I had promised to call a girl but I did not do it.
Label: guilt

Text: When my child was born.
Label: joy

Text: When a close friend wilfully cheated me.
Label: disgust

Text: Passing (by car) over a bridge where only one car could pass. There á was a precipice on both sides, no protection grilles, and the á bridge was completely muddled.
Label: fear

Text: When I stole something.
Label: guilt

Text: I felt very angry after one driver had run over my beloved niece.
Label: anger

Text: When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our á mark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my á classmates about the scolding they had got at home. My first á mark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for more á than that and I put down \very good\" for fear of being scolded. á
Label: guilt

Text: Doing something wrong at home, and then letting my (normally) á more rampant brother take the blame.
Label: guilt

Text: Almost crashing into the back of a car while driving along the á motorway on my motorcycle.
Label: fear

Text: Once a week I work as a volunteer in a biologic garden. this work á in the garden and the contact with other volunteers filled me á with joy. They also gave me support after I failed passing my á driver's test.
Label: joy

Text: The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son. á I can say those were the happiest months in my life.
Label: joy

Text: At about midnight I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On the á whole it was a distance of several kilometers. A car followed me á through the streets. Only when I went into a one-way street the á car disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.
Label: fear

Text: I feel disgusted at not having got aa \A\" in yesterday's á
Label: disgust

Text: I was afraid when my boyfriend came home because my parents á disapproved him of his coming home. I thought they would chase me á out of the house.
Label: fear

Text: When I accused unjustly a person of robbery, who proved me the á contrary, almost caused a public fight.
Label: shame

Text: When I stand at the bus stop for one hour waiting for the bus to á arrive.
Label: disgust

Text: When I saw President Reagan get elected.
Label: disgust

Text: I am chosen for the English lectures instead of my good friend á and people told me that girls are more likely to be chosen.
Label: shame

Text: One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me that á some of my relatives had died in an accident.
Label: sadness

Text: I lied, to be precise I cancelled a meeting with a good friend.
Label: shame

Text: I don't use to lie to my parets about what I do, and the two á times that I felt anger were when they doubted me I said that I á was going to the club, and they didn't believe me because the day á before they had met me at FLIPERAMA. I had the wish to kill them.
Label: anger

Text: Saw some young people fighting for seats on a bus.
Label: anger

Text: Death of brother.
Label: sadness

Text: A railways officer, when asked by the ticket checker to produce á his tickets, got very aggressive and started abusing and using á his authority in a very wrong way.
Label: disgust

Text: I hated you for not letting me go and found out that it was not á your decision.
Label: guilt

Text: When I unjustly accused a person of my family of something she á didn't really do.
Label: guilt

Text: When I failed the entrance exam to IMEC.
Label: sadness

Text: When I pass an examination which I did not think I did well.
Label: joy

Text: I stormed into the room, hoping to cool myself with some soft á music from my three band radio cassette.  There was only young á Kaley there and he explained, \ Your aunt has sold it as she á
Label: disgust

Text: I was sad to hear that my brother had a motorbike accident.
Label: sadness

Text: I was accused of having done something, which I hadn't and got á very angry.
Label: anger

Text: Unexpected visit by a close friend, whom I hadn't seen for half a á year.
Label: joy

Text: When I didn't succeed to enter at the University, I felt that the á college entrance course sistem prejudiced me, that my integrity, á and effort weren't corresponded.
Label: sadness

Text: When the relationship with my girlfriend broke up.
Label: sadness

Text: When my mother got a terrible beating from my father.  It was so á bad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realized á how bad it was.
Label: disgust

Text: I saw part of a Prince video with him crawling out of a bath tub.
Label: disgust

Text: I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes á came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents á attention by talking to them.
Label: shame

Text: I was at home and I heard a loud sound of spitting outside the á door.  I thought that one of my family members would step on the spit á and bring the germs in the house.
Label: disgust

Text: A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very á disgusting, especially because I was eating.
Label: disgust

Text: I was very scared when I went to the examination hall for my M.Sc á examination as I had studied a limited partion of the course á thoroughly and I was in great doubt whether that would be asked.
Label: fear

Text: When I was rude to my mother and got angry with her.
Label: guilt

Text: Staying alone in the room after midnight and reading horror á stories.
Label: fear

Text: A young man was insulting and humiliating a drunken man.
Label: disgust

Text: They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some á awful liquid accumulated at the bottom.
Label: disgust

Text: I had been forced to get together with strange and disgusting á classmates.  The things they talked about disgusted me and made á me feel ill at ease.  I knew that I would feel unhappy if I á stayed there but I was defeated by the social norms.
Label: disgust

Text: When I had gone to a school picnic and was left behind in the á forest.
Label: fear

Text: Watching \11 am\". They had a programme on the starving refugees. á
Label: sadness

Text: When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7 á and we were about to take the main exam.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt shame when I saw someone I knew and pretended not to see á her. Later she saw me and said hi.
Label: shame

Text: When my father phoned me to come home from my vacation, since he á no longer had the time to look after my garden and animals.
Label: anger

Text: When I was reading a book.  It had nothing to do with the book á itself but with the disagreable smell of the pages of the book.
Label: disgust

Text: When I took away my best friend's boyfriend.
Label: guilt

Text: When having a relationship, I made love with another girl.
Label: guilt

Text: A very close friend left me.
Label: sadness

Text: One day I heard from a friend that the boy I loved had gone out á with her and not with me.
Label: sadness

Text: During an argument with my brother, I behaved rather á intransigently, even cruelly, wishing to morally hurt the \person\" á
Label: guilt

Text: My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the         á primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.  á Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.
Label: joy

Text: My grandfather died. He lived almost as a recluse not caring for á himself as well as he should - Dad and we all helped as much as á we could, but it didn't save him from himself. It was an á unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't á jailed.
Label: sadness

Text: When my mother rejected my boyfriend and made unfair judgements á on him.
Label: anger

Text: When my brother had to spend all evening repairing a gear-lever á that I had broken.
Label: guilt

Text: I had to decline an appointment which had been very important for á the other person. For this reason we even got into trouble.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was going home for my holiday, I almost drowned in the á Zambezi river.
Label: fear

Text: I saw a septic, smelling wound.
Label: disgust

Text: The patient whom I expected to get well suddenly passed away á after he showed had his meals.
Label: anger

Text: At an unjust insult or injure.
Label: sadness

Text: When the gear broke on my car.
Label: sadness

Text: When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person á with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.
Label: fear

Text: When someone does not listen to me after having asked me to á repeat what I said. This happened more than one time with the á same person.
Label: anger

Text: When my mother quarrelled with my aunt over me.
Label: anger

Text: I was in my room, I just heard that my Uncle had been caught in á somebody's house with somebody's wife. He had to appear in court. á I went to see what would happen to him.
Label: shame

Text: When I don't justify the confidence of people that I respect.
Label: guilt

Text: When a colleague failed to contact me at the arranged time.
Label: sadness

Text: Departure of a very close friend - for a long stay overseas, á sharing in the sorrow of her parents who were left behind.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.
Label: anger

Text: Talking with a nice girl.
Label: joy

Text: My boyfriend promised to take me to see a game of tennis and rang á saying he was going to the pub with some of his friends instead.
Label: anger

Text: This happened when I went to check my first year results, I had  á thought that I would fail and I found that I had a clear pass in á all my courses.
Label: joy

Text: A certain Area Party Secretary came home in the morning and said á we had to leave our home and build somewhere and the reason á being that they wanted to establish a market. The Chairman knew á nothing about it and was very angry.
Label: anger

Text: My living and working conditions at home were unbearable. We used á to live in a three room flat together with two more families. The á discords caused a change - one of the families moved out. The á other family stayed with us but I drifted away from my fiancT. In á fact we were two families in the flat. Then I found myself alone á in the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay next á to me my grief and sorrow took on large proportions. I wanted to á commit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause of á the irritation.
Label: sadness

Text: While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to the á lavatory.  My cousin told grandma and she came.
Label: shame

Text: When my one year old son gives me a spontaneous kiss.
Label: joy

Text: Enrolling at varsity, being told I couldn't get in to certain á papers.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt angry when my only pair of trousers was stolen and could á not be able to find out who the thief was or anyone who knew á about the story.
Label: anger

Text: When I was with a girl who seemed to love me, while I was with á her just to go to bed with her.
Label: guilt

Text: My episode of fright happened when I came to study.  I had to á stand in front of my still unknown fellow students and talk about á myself.  My hands shook, I flushed and became tongue-tied.
Label: fear

Text: An item which belonged to a friend of mine was missing.  I had á taken it earlier and I thought that I had returnrd it so when he á asked me for it I stubbornly refused having it.  Later when I á looked for it, I found it in my room.
Label: guilt

Text: When my girlfriend of two years told me it was all over.
Label: anger

Text: During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participants á made an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.
Label: anger

Text: Facing a mad dog.
Label: fear

Text: I worked in a harbour and emptied latrine containers from the á back of the lorries.
Label: disgust

Text: When I came very late one night (or morning !) and my parents á were waiting, not so much angrgy as disappointed.
Label: guilt

Text: I feel disgusted at my cousin, who is bad-mannered, does not know á how to behave and talk to others, he does not respect elders and á lies all the time.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was 4, we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and á her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wanted á to arrive before them and went on a shorter, but more dangerous á way. When I arrived, I found nobody there. I waited for a long á time, but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had á been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I saw á how much she had worried (herself).
Label: guilt

Text: When I passed the 12th standard board exams.
Label: joy

Text: As I could not be home before midnight I called home at 11.30 and á asked them to leave the door open so that I could get in.  I á actually woke up the whole family by calling them so late.  My á mother could not go back to sleep, besides she had a conference   á the next day and really needed to sleep.
Label: guilt

Text: For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.
Label: joy

Text: At hostel, my roommate was a very selfish person and would avoid á doing anyhting that did not concern him.  A few of us prepared lunch á together and had decided to share the work.  My roomate had á promised to do the same but I had to wash the bowls everytime á after dinner.  I tried to wait and thought that he would realize á his fault.  I did not want to tell him to do the work as he is a á university student and ought to have self-respect.  He á disappointed me and so every time I saw him I tried to avoid him á and did not want to keep any contact with him.
Label: disgust

Text: At a party, I started talking to a guy I had seen in one of my á classes. My boyfriend felt awkward and left to talk to a friend á but kept on looking at me as I talked.
Label: guilt

Text: Watching a horror movie with friends.
Label: fear

Text: When someone took my pen away.
Label: anger

Text: Finding out my grades at the end of my freshman year.
Label: joy

Text: When I noticed two spiders running on the floor in different á directions.
Label: disgust

Text: People who came to our home - and requested \Put out your smoke\". á
Label: disgust

Text: I broke the gutar of a colleague but as it happened in a moment á when nobody was present I could escape from the guilt.
Label: guilt

Text: I was stopped from entering a party while I was at School but I á had an Invitation card with me. This was done because they said I á was too young to join elderly people.
Label: disgust

Text: When I see that some people remain cold and egoistic with regard á to close friends, even in situations that those friends need á them.
Label: disgust

Text: The loss of my mother.
Label: sadness

Text: When I as a child of 9 or 10 I was playing doctor with the á neighbours boys their mother caught us.
Label: shame

Text: When I got a letter from home.
Label: joy

Text: When my cousin passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: I was angry when my friends said that I should not receive á Nursing Science books because there was a rumour that I was á intending to leave the college.
Label: anger

Text: When my friends died one after the other.  The first died in a á car accident and the second one recently, due to an illness.
Label: sadness

Text: Stopped at a Fast Food shop with friends and a few locals wanted á to fight us for no apparent reason. They hit and picked on one of á my friends.
Label: anger

Text: When I gave in to what my wife wanted and locked the cat out, it á was killed by the dogs.
Label: guilt

Text: When I found out that I could not go to the concert (after buying á the tickets) because of a biology test which occurred the morning á after.
Label: sadness

Text: During the Physics experiment session I did not understand the á content of the experiment and did not know how to do it.
Label: sadness

Text: When walking along the beach with my boyfriend, we saw 2 people á having sex on the sand dunes in full view of everyone. It was the á fact that they chose that area in which to have sex, that á disgusted me.
Label: disgust

Text: There was a lot of irritation between me and a person who lives á in the same house where I live. Suddenly it became too much for me and I á accused him of several things.
Label: anger

Text: When I took my entrance exams successfully and also when I got my á school leaving certificate because the delivering ceremony was á extremely official.
Label: joy

Text: Before my final examination.
Label: fear

Text: I had high-heeled shoes one time, but a certain girl who saw the á shoes told me that they were out of fashion and I looked as an á old man when I was in those shoes.
Label: shame

Text: I once got a phone call stating \one of your friend is in jail, á
Label: disgust

Text: This feeling comes frequently when I go out at night and tell my á mother that I shall come back early. But then I get home a 5 or 6 a.m.
Label: guilt

Text: Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance á examinations.
Label: fear

Text: I had an accident with a trafic police car that was packed at a á curve without any visibility and against all traffic regulations á in a strong snowstorm. As a result I still cannot repair my car á because of the missing spare parts.
Label: anger

Text: All my friends arranged to go for an afternoon snack and they did á not tell me.  They told me that they did not have my phone number á but I do not think that this was true.
Label: sadness

Text: [ No response.]
Label: disgust

Text: I had gone home for a week-end and when I came back I found that á my clothes and my bedding had been stolen.
Label: anger

Text: When I tried to hide a fact from a person for irrelevant reasons á and considered such an attitude childish.
Label: shame

Text: I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment á but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed á holiday job.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was able to buy my new car, after lots of problems.
Label: joy

Text: When I was chased by a big dog near my house.
Label: fear

Text: Someone told me that I was chosen for English lectures because á the class leader is going out with me (not true).
Label: anger

Text: Our basketball team is undefeated in league play (4-0) currently.
Label: joy

Text: Being with a close friend, in the city, who was involved at the á present point in time in outrageous activity.
Label: shame

Text: Finding out that I have misunderstood other people.
Label: guilt

Text: I felt guilty the other day because I took two pieces of bread á instead of one in the Cafeteria and some of the girls were short á of bread.
Label: guilt

Text: Seeing my sister after about 2 years of not seeing her. Only á spent 1 hour or so before she was off overseas with her husband á for 3 months.
Label: joy

Text: I found myself a place after looking for one for a long time.
Label: joy

Text: I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last á born in the family.
Label: joy

Text: When my girlfriend's nephew passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was first taken to the dissection room where I found 10 dead á human bodies.
Label: fear

Text: When I was sick my husband bought me a piece of cake.
Label: joy

Text: When my first love was not successful.
Label: sadness

Text: After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me to á buy a rose for my mother.  We went together to a pub and my á mother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.  I á did not known about it and so was all the more glad.
Label: joy

Text: I felt angry when I was told that I had not been selected to go á to the University.
Label: anger

Text: A friend of mine said in a group that she felt lonely and á withdrawn from everyone because of mental deficiency.
Label: guilt

Text: My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - \Lord Grey\" died in his sleep - His á
Label: sadness

Text: Due to a misunderstanding on my part, two of my best friends á quarelled.
Label: guilt

Text: I received a letter from a friend whom I was missing
Label: joy

Text: Each time the professor asks me a question in class.
Label: shame

Text: I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and started á chasing my friends and me.  We were very frightened till we á climbed up a tree.
Label: fear

Text: A car came very close to hitting me whilst I was crossing the á street.
Label: fear

Text: Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a á nonsense.
Label: shame

Text: When the Cambridge results came out and I obtained a first á division.  I had been thinking that I had not done very well.
Label: joy

Text: I counterfeited a mark in the school register during the lesson á in gymnastics. I felt this feeling two days later when I stood á face to face with my teacher, whom I highly appreciated and á respected.
Label: shame

Text: When I was on holiday, walking back to where I was staying, at á night, and two men started closely following me. There was nobody á around that I could run to.
Label: fear

Text: A conflict with a pupil.
Label: anger

Text: When I whatched a horror film on a Friday 13th.
Label: fear

Text: When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.
Label: fear

Text: You told me psychology can help people to be happier.
Label: joy

Text: Slept with someone close to my girlfriend and myself.
Label: guilt

Text: When some friends and I get acquainted a guy during vacations I á thought he was disgusted and \a friend\" of mine for whom I feel a á
Label: disgust

Text: I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. I á felt guilty before her.
Label: guilt

Text: Selling the appartment after my divorce.
Label: guilt

Text: I was disgusted at the behavior of these boys I work with in the á scouting program. They showed a lack of interest, unrest, and at á times just plain rude behavior.
Label: disgust

Text: Observing someone in the cafeteria noisily gulping in his food, á having extremely bad manners.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt guilty one day when I stole a slice of bread in a á cafeteria.
Label: guilt

Text: [ No response.]
Label: sadness

Text: When I woke up in the middle of the night because of a dream, it á wasn't a nightmare, it was an uninteligible dream in wich I woke á because of a certain end.
Label: fear

Text: I failed an exam which I thought I would certainly pass.
Label: shame

Text: When I went to my room-mate's drawer to see if she had an iron  á which I could use, she came in.  I felt guilty as she may have á thought that I had been stealing.
Label: guilt

Text: Going to the examn not well prepared.
Label: fear

Text: When stupid people push me during rush time in the city.
Label: anger

Text: When I had been angry at my friend without any reason.
Label: shame

Text: I experienced joy at a friend's 22nd birthday party. We had good á food, good liquid, good company, good music, and an overall warm á atmosphere. The birthday girl and I communicate incredibly well. á I felt very content, warm and inspired just talking with her á giving her a neck massage.
Label: joy

Text: My boyfriend and I did not have any contact with each other during  á the Summer holidays.  I met him the day of the registration and looked  á through him.  In the canteen he asked me if I wanted to have a drink and  á I said no as I did not want him to do me a favour.
Label: disgust

Text: I took my math midterm and got it back the following Wednesday in á class. It was a totally low grade.
Label: shame

Text: In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, I á played very badly.
Label: anger

Text: A few days ago, I hitch-hiked to Arnhems with a friend. á Everything went well: they picked us up very quickly, the sun was á shining, I was feeling free and, for the first time after long á time, happy. I really had the feeling that I was living at full á speed.
Label: joy

Text: I studied medicine for several semesters and at that time I á developed a great fear of examinations. I was most afraid of my á examination of anatomy. While other students were examined, I was á dissecting. I was able to hear everything and was waiting with á fear until it was my turn.
Label: fear

Text: At a private party I literally fell into the food. The party was á completely ruined for the host, carpets had to be cleaned, etc.
Label: shame

Text: When I met an old schhol friend (school love) who works in á Sk+vde.
Label: joy

Text: When I was going home, I saw somathing which looked like a snake   á on the road but later I found out that it was only a stick.
Label: fear

Text: When playing a football match, there was one player who made mean á tackels, kicked at everything and did things having nothing to do á with football.
Label: anger

Text: I had reacted angrily at a friend for no fault of his.  I had á raised my voice and had not cared for his opinion.
Label: shame

Text: It was when I read a newspaper article on the future and they á foresaw that we would be eating frog-burgers by the year 2000.  á An illustration showed a frog between two pieces of bread.
Label: disgust

Text: When I lied to my wife and told her that I was going to the á Copperbelt on a buisness trip, she later found me in a hotel with á a girlfriend.
Label: shame

Text: I had a dream about my fiancTe leaving me and making an end to á our relation.
Label: fear

Text: [ In an aeroplane.]
Label: fear

Text: When I got an unexpected letter from  a guy, who had been my school á mate.
Label: joy

Text: I felt sad when I heard that my girlfriend was double-crossing me á with the boy who is my best friend.
Label: sadness

Text: When it was found that I had gone out of the school premises á without permisssion and at the wrong time.
Label: fear

Text: When I got a stereo walkman from my father when he had finacial á difficulties. I thought that although he promised to give me that á present, he was not obliged to do so.
Label: joy

Text: Knowing that I had to do the survey with him I felt very á reluctant.  Although I do not know him I feel disgusted by just á looking at him.  Thinking that the project lasted several days I á regreted having joined that project.
Label: disgust

Text: I had a misunderstanding with my father and after some time I á found that I had been wrong.
Label: shame

Text: When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.
Label: anger

Text: I am a school teacher. At a teacher-parent meeting I received a á good deal of positive feed-back on my work both from the parents á and through them from the pupils.
Label: joy

Text: With an alcoholic.
Label: disgust

Text: When I got a first class in the twelveth standard exams, I was very á surprised and happy and I had a very good time with my friends.
Label: joy

Text: There is a person whom I disgust. Evrey time I see her I get this á terrible feeling I disgust her whole appearance.
Label: disgust

Text: When I passed the university entrance exam.
Label: joy

Text: My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and á take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for á me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own á feelings were intensified.
Label: sadness

Text: When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He had á undergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death. á When he came home I could see him smile for the first time after á may weeks.
Label: joy

Text: Iqam chosen for your lecture and my best friend is not. Now he is á angry with me and I cannot help him.
Label: sadness

Text: When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I was á occupying and take up a smaller one as I was becoming a full time á student at UNZA.
Label: anger

Text: In class I had to say something aloud and people reacted  by á laughing.
Label: shame

Text: I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my á parent father, shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived á self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as á I am.
Label: shame

Text: After some friends had come to see me. They had stayed for á several days and we had got on very well. When they had left, I á had a feeling of emptyness.
Label: sadness

Text: We went fishing some 5 or 8 kilometers off the shore of Lake á Malawi. Before we could settle down the lake became very rough to á the point of threatening our lives.
Label: fear

Text: I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in á the children Assembly.
Label: joy

Text: I broke my knee when I was skiing over \Yastrebetz\" (a racing á
Label: fear

Text: When the teacher asked me a question in class, concerning á something I had read earlier, and I did not know the answer, so I á felt ashamed in front of the whole class.
Label: shame

Text: Could not get into the university I wanted to get in.
Label: sadness

Text: When I had an anticipatory honey-moon with my fiancTe.
Label: joy

Text: I did bad on a test I didn't study for.
Label: shame

Text: At school teacher for not allowing us to go out on New Year's Eve á when on a class trip overseas.
Label: anger

Text: I was raped by a friend.
Label: fear

Text: When a thunder belt hit the roof top of the building I was in.
Label: fear

Text: When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and á she was fed up with my behaviour.
Label: anger

Text: Some of my friends had an argument.  I had earlier phoned one á of them and that may have influenced him to argue.
Label: guilt

Text: My father had once again told me that I should be careful and try to á seek admission to other places also apart from the faculty of á Social Sciences at the university of Helsinki.  I was not at all á interested in any other place and had no time to study for other á entrance exams.
Label: anger

Text: One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulted á a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.
Label: anger

Text: Saw a beggar on the street (China still so poor).
Label: shame

Text: When my relatives troubled me so that I would help them á financially.
Label: disgust

Text: A man kept a seat taken by putting his coat on it after a while á the chair was still empty, I asked him if I could use the chair, á he didn't agree for the chair was for his coat.
Label: anger

Text: Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.
Label: anger

Text: I was skiing alone and the mountain became covered with mist and á I thought I was lost and was going to panic.
Label: fear

Text: When my last year's second semester results came through - I was á ecstatic.
Label: joy

Text: One day I was near home, kissing my boyfriend in a car when my á mother appeared and asked me to go home, because she didn't know á about the event.
Label: fear

Text: Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. We á told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny á noises. I was terribly frightened.
Label: fear

Text: It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk á and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol. á I felt fear of what could have happened.
Label: fear

Text: Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yelling á and screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - in á effect lowering myself to their level.
Label: shame

Text: I was using my sister's stereo while everyone was out. I know she á wouldn't want me to and I would get into trouble if she found á out. But she was only partly justified in forbidding me to use á it. She never found out.
Label: guilt

Text: I was crossing the street together with some colleagues of mine á when I suddenly found myself almost under the wheels of a truck.
Label: fear

Text: When I failed my grade 7 exam at the first attempt in 1975.  My á father and the entire family thought that I was finished in life. á  I really felt like hiding.
Label: shame

Text: When a girl in my class (on the secondary school) appeased the á teacher, resulting in getting a higher grade. This occurred often á with her.
Label: disgust

Text: When I got a good grade for an exam in statistics.
Label: joy

Text: Lately I've felt guilty because I'm folling behind in my classes á and not studying much.
Label: guilt

Text: Korean judges cheating.
Label: anger

Text: With my mouth full of bun, I drank directly from a packet of milk á which turned out to be weeks old (completely separated).  It took á a while for the milk to seep through the bun.
Label: disgust

Text: I borrowed my classmate's notebook one week before the á examination and I promised to give it back to her in two days á time.  I was very busy at that time and forgot many things; as I á was not very often at home she could not contact me.  When I á started my revision I realized that her notebook had been on my á desk for five days.  I contacted her immediately and gave it back á to her.  Though she did not say anything I felt very guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: My mother revealed personal details about me and the á negative aspects of my character to other people when I was á present but unable to defend myself.
Label: shame

Text: When I was driving home after  several days of hard work, there á was a motorist ahead of me who was driving at 50 km/hour and á refused, despite his low speeed to let me overtake.
Label: anger

Text: When my father managed to begin a \new life\" after the divorce á
Label: joy

Text: When I was refused a transfer from my school to another, simply á because it was far away from my house.
Label: disgust

Text: My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke about á kicking the cat.  He had never done anything of the kind, but I á knew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.
Label: anger

Text: When a very close friend of mine went into hospital for a major á operation and I couldn't see her for a while as I was not a á relative she had no relatives in N.Z.
Label: sadness

Text: Before one of my final exams of the third year - natural á sciences.
Label: fear

Text: Insulted by classmate in public.
Label: shame

Text: During my high school time I succeeded to play a concert of á Mozart on the piano when I gave my first performance I succeeded á to play it very well.
Label: joy

Text: I had a test in the class and I had not adequately prepared á myself. I didn't fare so well on the exam and I felt bad about á it.
Label: shame

Text: Every time, in the last few days, when my girlfriend told me that á she loves me.
Label: joy

Text: At the funeral of my uncle, I was one of the bearers.  I was not á familiar with the etiquette and acted tactlessly because of my á ignorance.
Label: shame

Text: I felt joyful when I heard that I had been selected for College á education.
Label: joy

Text: When I came to know that my exams were on two successive days and á that there was very little time (about 9-10 hours) to study in á between.
Label: fear

Text: I felt the emotion when I entered a certain ward in the hospital á to visit my relative who was sick.
Label: disgust

Text: When I knew that my niece did a bad schoolar examination because á I couldn't explain her the lesson.
Label: guilt

Text: I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, when I saw á a man hiding behind a tree.  I got frigthened, turned around and á ran out of the forest.
Label: fear

Text: I felt some disgust for my boyfriend for a time, after he had á left me.
Label: disgust

Text: Last night - finding that someone in the house had eaten an á entire packet of almonds I had bought for a family treat.
Label: anger

Text: I lived together with my boyfriend. One night he stayed away and á next day he told me that he had chat up with another girl.
Label: disgust

Text: When I got 1/2 out of 15 in Abnormal Psychology I felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: I was in a very small class and the professor said something á about me that made everyone look at me at the same time.
Label: shame

Text: I had gone to aa bookshop to buy some books.  Somehow, I got very á cross with the security guard checking through what I had bought. á  I lost my temper and screamed at him.  Later I felt very ashamed á at myself as a lot of people I know were there.
Label: shame

Text: When I was not in a position to control myself.  I had said too á much and had been cruel with no other than my mother.
Label: shame

Text: While playing indoor-hockey, there always is an older man who á frequently and intentionally plays the ball out of the field. In á my opinion this is very childish, because we play for fun only.
Label: anger

Text: In a course I thought that I deserved good marks but I only got á ordinary marks with no justification as to why I was given these á marks.
Label: anger

Text: A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately I á was able to break loose.
Label: disgust

Text: When somebody suddenly said something (about me) at a wrong á moment and I didn't agree (at that exact moment I was needing an á extremely positive word).
Label: shame

Text: I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with my á extended family, one young man used bad words while asking me to á leave their home.
Label: shame

Text: Disgust with a subordinate.
Label: disgust

Text: A person I trusted a lot gave me many false explanations to á justify a wrong action.
Label: anger

Text: While still at school a friend died of cancer, after being ill á for a long time, she was 17 yrs old.
Label: sadness

Text: When the morning newspaper has not arrived.
Label: anger

Text: A close relative of mine died in a serious car accident.  I was á one of the first two people to see the corpse and I had to do it. á  Before going in to see it I was afraid as it was the first time á that I was seeing a corpse.
Label: fear

Text: When being made look a fool by the teacher in front of the class á during a turn.
Label: anger

Text: Hear a very nice joke made by a friend.
Label: joy

Text: At primary school, when I vomited in front of others in the middle  á of a lesson.

Text: The first day I visited the hospital I was disgusted because I á experienced offensive smell which I never expected. I nearly ran á away from the course.
