Text: In Southern Tyrol, I was gathering apples, it was a fine day, I á was not thinking about anything, I felt an overwhelming joy.
Label: joy

Text: When the doctor told me that there was something wrong with my á eye and I had to undergo an operation.
Label: fear

Text: [ No response.]
Label: disgust

Text: When I caused much pain and sorrow to my boyfriend by finishing á our relationship.
Label: sadness

Text: My friend promised to take me out for a movie but he didn't turn á up.
Label: disgust

Text: Our neighbour came and gossiped, about others, with my parents.
Label: disgust

Text: A friend of mine got pregnant anf failed the first year at á university.  The boyfriend refused his responsibility and they á ended up in court.
Label: sadness

Text: When my mother was very sick and almost died.
Label: sadness

Text: When I heard of the assassination of the Indian prime-minister, á Indira Gandhi.
Label: disgust

Text: My older brother who gives me unwanted advices about problems in á my relationship with my girlfriend.
Label: anger

Text: When I bought my car.
Label: joy

Text: A child, 9 years old, died in a stupid way.  He fell from a place á which was 1 metre high.
Label: sadness

Text: Yesterday my friend gave me a gift and had dinner with me.
Label: joy

Text: One day I was busy day dreaming along the road and suddenly I á heard the sound of jamming car braked behind me. I woke up from á my dreams and it was about to crash me.
Label: fear

Text: [ When I see that the toilet is unclean.]
Label: disgust

Text: My brother had bowel obstruction, having heard that he was going á for surgery, I was afraid he might not come back to life after á hearing of the General Anaesthesia.
Label: fear

Text: A close married friend has just had his first child.
Label: joy

Text: When my family allowed me to do higher studies.
Label: joy

Text: Out of sheer curiosity, I went to see a pornographic movie in á Copenhagen.  The room was full of men, who panted and á masturbated.  Very disgusting.
Label: disgust

Text: When my sister broke my china tea set.
Label: anger

Text: When I wanted to go into a house, there was suddenly a big dog á standing beside me. It was hardly moving, but I did not know how á it would react later on.
Label: fear

Text: Having suffered a not very pretty sight, I reacted by uttering á some very cruel and sharp words.
Label: guilt

Text: Some persons, who are important for me, came to see me and I had á not washed the dishes.
Label: shame

Text: During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it á impossible to continue discussing.
Label: guilt

Text: My girlfriend's results in school had become worse because I á prevented her from learning (we often went out etc.).
Label: guilt

Text: My flatmate and close friend living and sleeping with another á close friend of mine.
Label: disgust

Text: Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in á a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.  á He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.
Label: disgust

Text: A very, very close friend of mine used to come to my room to      á see me and I naver bothered to pay him a visit.  One day he asked á me the reason behind this and I gave him a shirt.
Label: guilt

Text: I had shouted at my younger brother and he was always afraid when á I called out loudly.
Label: guilt

Text: When i was asked to be a child's godmother.
Label: joy

Text: I was very angry one day when my husband ignored me and slept      á on a separate bed.  He had no reasons to doubt me or to neglect á me and I had never imagined that he could do such a thing.
Label: anger

Text: The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my á grade six.
Label: sadness

Text: New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.  We stood on the á steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the á first time.
Label: joy

Text: My father promoted to be a professor.
Label: joy

Text: I stayed at home for a period because I felt depressive and I á neglected my study when people adked me, I told them that I had á freeterm and studied hard. I felt ashamed for my behavior and á lies.
Label: shame

Text: Once I failed seven subjects at school and I was terrified to á give my report card to my father.  I left it on the table and went to á bed very early in order to avoid him seeing me.
Label: fear

Text: At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and the á next day they promised to take revenge on me.
Label: fear

Text: While walking in town I noticed how the police harrassed a man á who was under the influence of alcohol.  They terrified him with á the thought of arrest by driving close behind him on a pedestrian á street.  My disgust was directed at the gestures and the facial á expressions of the policemen; they seemed to be enjoying á themselves.
Label: disgust

Text: Failing in an examn because of lazyness.
Label: shame

Text: A drunken man forced me to kiss him.
Label: disgust

Text: I was disgusted with my brother's behaviour when he kept throwing á things away because of his anger, after mum had shouted at him.
Label: disgust

Text: There is a certain person, whom I only have seen. He makes me á cringe, feel disgust.
Label: disgust

Text: When my girlfriend told me that she was no longer interested in á me.
Label: disgust

Text: Heated discussion with spouse concerning new house.
Label: anger

Text: I was walking home one night (after getting a bus to my town) á when I was confronted by a group of males (about 6), they would á not let me pass - they made comments etc. - I crossed the road á and hurried home.
Label: fear

Text: When I heard that a good friend had committed suicide.
Label: sadness

Text: When someone whom I considered my friend, without telling me he á was annoyed, proceeded to ignore me for several meets with no á apparent reason.
Label: disgust

Text: When I found that my ability to do ordinary work was worse than á my fellow mates.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was a child I hid under the sheets out of fear of á darkness.
Label: fear

Text: I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.  I á wanted to help them but everyone said no.  We then left.
Label: anger

Text: Talking to someone I disliked.
Label: disgust

Text: Does not apply.
Label: disgust

Text: [ I feel shame when I do not arrive on time and others have to á wait for me for a long time.]
Label: shame

Text: Going to a concert.
Label: joy

Text: During a discussion I said something rather stupid and á unnecessary.
Label: shame

Text: We went to visit my mother at the residence.  She was crying and á said that she was about to die.  I believed all her complaints á and continously thought of the possibility of loosing her.
Label: sadness

Text: I feel unbelievably happy about the relationship between my á boyfriend and me, it is a reoccurring feeling.
Label: joy

Text: I bought a possible answer to a homework problem which was á completely inapplicable to the question due to my not having read á about the subject matter.
Label: shame

Text: One day in the intimity with my girlfriend I had an ejaculation.
Label: shame

Text: A female friend was violently ill on the return journey from a á wedding reception we attended. Getting her out of the car when á home took quite a while.
Label: disgust

Text: When I damaged my wristwatch which I liked very much.
Label: anger

Text: I was walking down a little village at night.  There was nobody á in the steet.  A dog began to bark, I felt that it was following á me.  Then I began to run, the other dogs started barking too.  At á last I arrived home.
Label: fear

Text: When I had promised to do some washing for my mother and I did á not do it.  She did it herself despite her being ill.  I felt á very guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: On a boat trip to Denmark, 14 of us had a lot of fun and we á spent SEK 10 each on one armed bandits and against all odds we á won the jackpot of SEK 1000.
Label: joy

Text: When I was a little girl about eight years old I broke the bey á from a closed. Mother asked who did it. I said that it wasn't me, as á I almost never lied, and my brother did it more frequently in á spite my brother denieing it my mother gave him a few slaps.
Label: guilt

Text: The only event I can remember is having a nightmare when I was á very young (3 years old) I dreamt about a machine which was going á to crush me.
Label: fear

Text: I had gone for a medical check-up at the U.T.H and failed to make á it back on time for the C119 practical sessions at 1400 hours á last academic year.
Label: fear

Text: I realized the girl liked to be with me.
Label: joy

Text: After my final examination at school I was glad that the á examination was over and that I had passed it.
Label: joy

Text: China not doing well in the Asian Olympic games.
Label: shame

Text: I refused to lend my homework to a friend.
Label: guilt

Text: I broke my Uncle's Radio player accidentally and so I feared that á he was going to cut me off from going to his house as well as á playing it again.
Label: fear

Text: I was really shameful when my mother beat me in the presence of á my friends because I didn't cook lunch up until 2 o'clock.
Label: shame

Text: The behaviour of people spitting everywhere.
Label: disgust

Text: While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting á helplessly.
Label: disgust

Text: Once I had dinner at an elegant restaurant and I did not have á enough money to pay the bill. There were a lot of people there á and I felt quite awkward.
Label: shame

Text: I feel disgusted when people do not understand me in the right á way, i.e they misunderstand me.
Label: disgust

Text: Cannot recall the emotion with any force.
Label: shame

Text: Not finishing my duty as a class leader.
Label: shame

Text: When I was travelling to school by bus, I went past a place á where a sewer had been repaired.  There was a bad strong smell á which suffocated me and I wanted to leave the place immediately.
Label: disgust

Text: When I received the higher level exam results, I mistook the á grade E in mathematics for a grade F and I was shocked.
Label: fear

Text: I was having an argument with my brother on his behavior, then we  á started fighting and I got annoyed at him because he started á teasing me.
Label: anger

Text: I felt very guilty when I tried to teach swimming to my younger á brother, as I myself could not swim very well and my brother á had started sinking to the bottom, however my elder brother á saved him.
Label: guilt

Text: When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my á registration at UNZA.
Label: joy

Text: My husband falls ill and does not follow the doctor's advice on á the treatment or the diet control.
Label: disgust

Text: My grandmother died.
Label: sadness

Text: In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens and á invalids.
Label: shame

Text: At the death of my friend's father and especially as this á happened ten days before her wedding.
Label: sadness

Text: When I saw the film \Memorie of Prison\" I saw a scene of á
Label: disgust

Text: After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did á not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was á madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I á told him to be cautious, but he did not care.
Label: fear

Text: I felt joy when I entered at the University.
Label: joy

Text: In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playing á with his penis in the middle of the town.
Label: disgust

Text: When I am dirty because I have not had a shower for a few days.
Label: disgust

Text: Anger with boyfriend's best friend for alienating me and blaming á me for personality changes in my boyfriend and changes in my á boyfriend's attitude to him and his obvious egoistical attitude á himself in doing so. I also lost one of my best friends - his á girlfriend.
Label: anger

Text: I could have died when I was caught cheating on a test in high á school. That was my first and last time.
Label: shame

Text: I went to study in a public library but I didn't know it well. I á got a book and wanted to study hearing music. Then I went to a á place were I could do it, but when I passed by a door a bell rang á and a man came saying that I couldn't leave with the book.
Label: shame

Text: When I was jumped by three men in a deserted area.
Label: fear

Text: Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I began á to feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it was á only \the thing to do\", and not really an act of love."
Label: shame

Text: To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.
Label: sadness

Text: When inadvertantly I found myself in the ladies room.
Label: shame

Text: When a close friend of mine collapsed and passed away and the á illness was not known.
Label: sadness

Text: Last year I had a friend visiting me for several days. The only á thing he did was sleeping, drinking, taking pills and thinking á only about himself.
Label: anger

Text: I thought that I was going to fail a subject and so I began to á study for the final exam, then my friend told me that I had á passed it.  That meant that I could go home, as I do not study in á my hometown.
Label: joy

Text: Walking alone in the dark in a strange street.
Label: fear

Text: I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and á growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until á several weeks later.
Label: guilt

Text: It was only once that I really felt sad: at my grandfather's á funeral (after a long time of suffering he had died of cancer).
Label: sadness

Text: My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letter á addressed to me.  She denied having read it intentionally and á said \the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sun á
Label: disgust

Text: I am disgusted by people who spoil their identity because of á misbehaviour.  This morning when I was in a crowded bus, I found á a seat on which a university student was sitting on one side and á he had put his bag and files next to him.  There was very little á space left and I sat down while he kept on reading.  Even when I á leaned on him he did not put his bag away.  He did not respond and á I felt very angry.
Label: disgust

Text: I had not studied very much for my final examination at school, á so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral á examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I á heard that I had passed it.
Label: joy

Text: When we still attended school, my brother and I usually went to á see our aunt and to show her our term's report. She rewarded us á with money. Although my reports were as good as my brother's, he á got more money.
Label: anger

Text: Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often á recently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe my á general impression from severl situations which evoked this á feeling in me.
Label: sadness

Text: I went to bed with a girl and the next day she thought it was the á start of something serious and I just thought it was fun and I á told her I wasn't interested in starting a serious relationship.
Label: shame

Text: I feel anger when I see a \parent\" beating and punishing his child á
Label: anger

Text: I was at home, filling my tax report.  Nobody had time to help á me.  I would have liked to do it quickly so that I could go and á meet a friend of mine who had just returned from hospital.  I got á angry as both my brother and my father refused to give me their calculator á as I had not asked for it nicely.  I could not leave as I á had to wait for help and the tax report had to be done.
Label: anger

Text: When I had to move away from home to study, and I knew that I á would not be coming back home for a long time.
Label: sadness

Text: Waiting for the results of the High level examination.  I was á afraid of not being accepted.
Label: fear

Text: I once stole a shirt from the Department Store in which I work. I á have been promoted to work in a very privileged section of the á store. Their belief in my integrity makes me feel even guiltier.
Label: guilt

Text: Finding out that I can go to your English lectures.
Label: joy

Text: Found out that I am not good at football.
Label: shame

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: I felt very sad when my son died after a short illness.
Label: sadness

Text: At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).
Label: sadness

Text: When my friend let my personal matters be publicaly known.
Label: shame

Text: A couple of years ago during the summer holiday, I was fishing at á a lake with my husband.  Suddenly it started raining while the á sun was still shining. I experienced a feeling of joy, happiness á and fulfillment.  the whole nature was full of music.
Label: joy

Text: I was not sure whether I should help an old woman going down a á flight of stairs. I just watched her and saw how difficult it was á for her to do it.
Label: guilt

Text: When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibility á of elucidating this.
Label: anger

Text: A friend of mine remembered me when she needed me and did not á even think about me when she did not need me.
Label: disgust

Text: When I blurted out an answer in class without having been asked á to do so.  The teacher told me that it was bad manners to do so.
Label: shame

Text: Before an examination: I had the fealing that I had not learned á enough.
Label: fear

Text: To see damaged lettuce (with worms) in the icebox.
Label: disgust

Text: I had a girlfriend which I used to call regularly. Then I didn't á phone her for a while. At a certain moment I felt a little á tension which became worse.
Label: guilt

Text: I saw the gare of a prison.  This gare and the building were in á deplorable condition and were full of rubbish.
Label: disgust

Text: I was listening to a priest in church saying how sinful man was, á and how all men should renounce their desires and pleasures to á please God. I could never understand how something that brings you á joy could be a sin.
Label: disgust

Text: My grandmother wanted me to help her. I was driving a tractor á pulling a dead branch off a tree. I told her she didn't respect á me.
Label: guilt

Text: This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was á attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate á woke me up.
Label: sadness

Text: I was talking badly about a person to some friends, and á discovered that his daughter was listening.
Label: shame

Text: We were driving a car of a friend of mine when we turned in the á wrong direction towards an unknown district, and nearly drove á down a precipice.
Label: fear

Text: Every year during carnival I am very joyful I have an intense á feeling of happiness then.
Label: joy

Text: I was angry when my boyfriend did not turn up as promised.
Label: anger

Text: When I was treated improperly by someone.
Label: fear

Text: The results of the mid term examinations were very poor.
Label: guilt

Text: The girl I was seeing didn't want to have a serious relationship. á
Label: sadness

Text: I borrowed a friend's books and forgot I had them, she asked for á them back and I told her I didn't have them. I duly found and á returned them.
Label: guilt

Text: Fooling around with this guy I did not know.
Label: shame

Text: I got back too late after a Sunday going out without having á called up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept the á whole night.
Label: guilt

Text: When my boyfriend and I made up.
Label: joy

Text: When a close friend, residing in the hostel, lost his father I á really pittied him and the situation made me feel sad.
Label: sadness

Text: [ No description.]
Label: anger

Text: Shouting at my parents because I was angry about something else.
Label: guilt

Text: I mangled the side of my dad's van on a fence. I did not realize á the extent of the damage until he showed it to me the next day. á The shock on my face was genuine so a friend interceded with a á good excuse which I did not deny. I never clarified the á situation.
Label: guilt

Text: Sitting in the dorm when the guys were verbally reading letters á in Penthouse.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt angry when repeated pleas to the ticket collector and the á co-passengers in order to make a queue fell on deaf ears.  I have á this feeling whenever someone is not disciplined and methodic in á doing his duty.
Label: anger

Text: I was sleeping alone in the house at night. A boy putting on a á short only knocked at the window whispering that I should open á for him.
Label: fear

Text: My father promised me a bicycle for my birthday. Just before my á birthday he forgot he promised this to me.
Label: anger

Text: A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer.  á Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.
Label: sadness

Text: My boy-friend had promised me to come an 10 a.m. - he was 3 hours á late.
Label: anger

Text: A friend's mother died.
Label: sadness

Text: One day, early morning my mother who is healthy fell ill.  There á was no doctor or compounder near by and for a few hours -8 A.M to á 6 P.M she did not speak a single sentence, nor did she drink water á or  milk.  There was no movement in her body and I felt really á scared.  I almost lost my confidence about her survival.
Label: fear

Text: A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better á than she is.
Label: disgust

Text: I got an A in anatomy - the first one I have ever gotten in a á science class here.
Label: joy

Text: I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big and á it was moving its limbs.
Label: disgust

Text: [ I feel disgusted at people who talk negatively about a person á without knowing the person well.]
Label: disgust

Text: It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girl á but I considered it only as an \affair\". Only much later I realized á
Label: guilt

Text: When someone stole my bike.
Label: anger

Text: I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceived á them.
Label: shame

Text: One day my boyfriend put my hand on his penis and I felt well, á but after I felt a guilty conscience because I hadn't thought á about the consequences that this could have brought if I had gone á farther.
Label: guilt

Text: Father lost his temper at home because he was mistreated at work.
Label: sadness

Text: When a study tour got confirmed, I was happy all the time till    á the tour began.
Label: joy

Text: People hunting animals.
Label: anger

Text: Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a á couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had á stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my á daughter.
Label: anger

Text: I felt shame when I had to talk with a person that I hadn't seen for á many years. Shame that he wouldn't recognize me or that I á wouldn't know what to say.
Label: shame

Text: In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn. á  One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk á (hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and á I could not foretell his reactions.  However, nothing happened.
Label: fear

Text: Talking to friends about how old you are and we cannot be as á successful as you at your age.
Label: shame

Text: Getting my kitten, found at work several years ago, taking him á home in a box on my motorbike, showing it to my defacto.
Label: joy

Text: My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really á happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me á made me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just another á person. There were other cousins she could have asked but she á asked me.
Label: joy

Text: When I was ditched by my girlfriend.
Label: sadness

Text: When bicycling along, a courier van started to tail me very close á - I sped up and moved over and he just did the same. I reacted á violently, much physical responding in the dangerous situation.
Label: anger

Text: Being caught by parents in a compromising situation with á girlfriend.
Label: shame

Text: During an informal talk with a friend when we talk about the life á of another person, a common friend, that is in a situation of not á being able to assume certain problems that he decided to solve, á that is, she herself suggested the problems and decided to solve á them but didn't get it until the moment.
Label: sadness

Text: When I learnt that my cousin sister was pregnant.
Label: disgust

Text: My best friend was not chosen for the English lectures.
Label: sadness

Text: Sending pictures home when I'd put on so much weight.
Label: shame

Text: I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car would á run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.
Label: disgust

Text: On seeing a scene of an accident in a magazine.
Label: disgust

Text: A scene in a film in which one man repressed another one. By á concidence, their position was reversed. The other man was á repressed in an identical way as he did before.
Label: disgust

Text: I hit my cousin badly after she threw away my dresses in a á pit-latrine that the little girl fainted.
Label: guilt

Text: I was on a concert-tour and therefor seperated from my á boy-friend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male member á of the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep, but á his feelings were. I felt guilty when he said \I am not a á
Label: guilt

Text: My class leader told me I am not chosen for your English á lectures.
Label: anger

Text: I was alone at home when I broke a figure and then mended it.  A á few days later my mother noticed it and asked me about it, I told á her that I had no idea.
Label: guilt

Text: When I had a good result in the certificate examination.
Label: joy

Text: I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on á my birthday.
Label: joy

Text: For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.
Label: joy

Text: I was at the cinema with my sister and her boyfriend.  A man á sitting beside me started to stroke my leg for a while, he left in á the middle of the film.
Label: fear

Text: When I am dishonest to a friend to whom I am very close.  I á feel guilty because I know that he gives a different version of á the truth and I have not corrected these mistakes, and he is á aware that I know that they are wrong.
Label: guilt

Text: When a certain drunk man slapped my buttocks when I was quietly á standing waiting for a bus.
Label: shame

Text: Selling my used car.
Label: joy

Text: I was sad when I saw that a beautiful girl was not attainable.
Label: sadness

Text: The greatest guilt I felt and I didn't know if it was really á justified is that when I was a child I had a brother very close á to me. He  became ill, and asked me to see  him in the hospital. á I didn't go, when his situation became worse in the U.I.T. (Unity á of intensive therapy) I went and he died.
Label: guilt

Text: There was a scene of shooting in front of my house, I was very á afraid. Two armed men confronting. I didn't discover the reason á of the incident.
Label: fear

Text: When I almost fell down from some rocks because I had been acting á foolishly and playing dangerously.
Label: fear

Text: At a party in which I met an interesting female. We enjoyed á eachothers company, while slow dacing.
Label: joy

Text: I went to visit Montrose home for crippled children to interview á a handicapped child. I interviewed two boys and it went really á well. I promised I would visit them, but never got the time. Now I á hope they've forgotten me, but I feel ashamed of letting them á down.
Label: shame

Text: When I am discussing something with a person and I realize that á the other person is thinking over her own argumentations instead á of listening, I become angry.
Label: anger

Text: I lied to one of my best friends.
Label: guilt

Text: Failed to keep an appointment.
Label: guilt

Text: When I had to dissect a live mouse at school.
Label: disgust

Text: At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He á had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison á with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of á guilt.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was misleaded by a person who assured that something would á not occur, that I had no reason to prepccupy myself, and suddenly á I saw myself implicated by the fact, because of the incompetence, á and irresponsibility of that person.
Label: anger

Text: When some unforgiving acquaintance dragged up an old and rather á embarassing situation from my past.
Label: shame

Text: Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there á are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the á thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.
Label: fear

Text: Receiving a nice present from my parents.
Label: joy

Text: Getting my accentance letter from CAL.
Label: joy

Text: I had an important amount of money with me and felt fear of being á assaulted.
Label: fear

Text: When I told my uncle a false story - that people had stolen the á books from my room and I demanded money from him.  When he found á out the truth I was in trouble.
Label: guilt

Text: I don't know why suddenly I thought that what I was feeling for á my boyfriend was not really love. After almost three years being á together, this matter of fact shaked me and I felt a great sorrow á that I can call sadness.
Label: sadness

Text: When my friend got very low marks in field work even though he á had worked throughout the year, I had this feeling.
Label: disgust

Text: A friend misunderstood me.
Label: sadness

Text: When harassed by this boy - it was sexual (refer to GUILT).
Label: shame

Text: As I was taking venous blood from another patient I introduced á air into the place of puncturing and there was a swelling which á is dangerous to the patient hence I became afraid.
Label: fear

Text: When our school was raided by the pupils of the boys secondary á school who beat us up.
Label: fear

Text: I felt guilty when I was given a prize which belonged to someone á else.
Label: guilt

Text: Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no á idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The á fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.
Label: sadness

Text: I really became sad when mother passed away while I was very á young.
Label: sadness

Text: Having to decide on a termination of a pregnancy, after á discussing it with friends, family and the man involved.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was young my mother told the neighbour that I had wet the á bed.  I felt ashamed thinking that the neighbour's children would á get to know about it.
Label: shame

Text: A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.
Label: joy

Text: When I cheated my father and told him that the school á administration wanted K80 for the purchase of a mini-bus.  Two á months later the school authorities wrote back to my father for á the money.  I could not go back and ask him for the money again á as he had already given it to me once.
Label: guilt

Text: When boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.
Label: sadness

Text: Finding out about some girls who have been nice to the class á leader in order to go to the neuropsychology lectures (English á ones).
Label: anger

Text: Not being able to be selected for the dancing team.
Label: shame

Text: [ No response.]
Label: sadness

Text: I lost my driver's licence because of speeding.
Label: shame

Text: Finding out that the person I love understands me.
Label: joy

Text: When working in a chemical laundry, I saw rats and maggots in the á washing.
Label: disgust

Text: I had a girlfriend in the same class I was. I did not do well in á my Exams, but she did satisfactorily well and was taken into á another class leaving me behind.
Label: shame

Text: [ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me, á though I have not in any way been connected to some events.]
Label: anger

Text: I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time we á started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said á that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Some á time later I apologized for that.
Label: guilt

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: After taking a difficult midterm for one of my classes, I felt á shame for not studying as much as I should have. I was ashamed of á the results of the midterm.
Label: shame

Text: The time I shouted at most of my friends at a party.  It was as if á  all my friends had done something wrong, or may be it was the á influence of the beer.
Label: shame

Text: At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and á the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression á on me.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept á under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a á half.
Label: fear

Text: When I broke the window pane of my next door neighbour's house.
Label: fear

Text: My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainly á would have liked to live longer. I was also said because I was á confronted with the fact that I would die one day too.
Label: sadness

Text: I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill and á vomited.
Label: disgust

Text: When I got a low grade in an administration course.
Label: anger

Text: A drunk man had fallen in the street and he was shouting obscene á words.
Label: disgust

Text: When I see all the putridness of people. The fact is the catarrh á and spits that whash the streets of S.Paulo.
Label: disgust

Text: I said nasty things which I did not mean to a friend.
Label: guilt

Text: Getting into this university.
Label: joy

Text: Not brave enough to take up a challenge in a group discussion.
Label: shame

Text: At the death of a close relative.
Label: sadness

Text: About not helping my sister when she asked me to help her on her á chemistry class. I pretended to be busy.
Label: guilt

Text: I was angry this morning when I missed the train to university.
Label: anger

Text: When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.
Label: guilt

Text: When I saw a documentary film about World War II (about Hitler á and his adepts).
Label: disgust

Text: The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for his á permission.  It was the first time that I was driving a car.
Label: fear

Text: When my parents drove me to a nearby place and went home á immediately instead of waiting a few hours.  They could have á easily waited.
Label: anger

Text: Over an argument.
Label: disgust

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock. á  I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the á gallows.
Label: fear

Text: I had a friend who I didn't see for a long time. We had a á relationship from much union and interaction. It was more that á one year that I didn't see her. She appeared in my home and we á talked.
Label: joy

Text: I experienced this when one of my friends reported to the á Headmaster that I had gone out for beer, whilst the information á was not true at all. So I had to fight the friend before the á Headmaster.
Label: anger

Text: I felt disgusted while studying for my applied psychology and á mental testing papers in B.A.
Label: disgust

Text: When I stared to much at a pastry that a woman was eating and at á the same instant the pastry felt on the floor.
Label: guilt

Text: On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the car á acquaplanned.  I lost contact with the road surface for a few á seconds.
Label: fear

Text: When I was studying in the library - preparing for a test, two á people sitting next to me talked to each other for 20 minutes.  á There were no other seats so I could not go elsewhere and I did   á not want to interrupt them, so I could only be angry in my heart.
Label: anger

Text: Someone knocked on the door when I was alone at home (though á there was a door bell).  I looked through the peep hole but it á had been covered.  I called my sister but she could not help me á as she was hundreds of kilometres away.
Label: fear

Text: Can't remember that feeling.
Label: shame

Text: Celebrations on the graduation day with the orchestra playing in á the garden ( I am a part of this orchestra).
Label: joy

Text: The thought of having to read a boring book of 400 pages in á English.
Label: sadness

Text: When a friend who comes visiting me unexpectedly asks for coffee á and I refuse to give him this.
Label: anger

Text: As a child, when I saw an \unesthetic\" sight."
Label: disgust

Text: When the summer holiday job was almost over.
Label: disgust

Text: I was caught doing something bad and I bribed the person who á caught me.  Later I felt very bad, maybe I should have paid for á my bad behaviour.
Label: guilt

Text: Somebody took my wristwatch and promised to have it mended and á later was telling me that he couldn't give it back to me because I was á rude at a certain time.
Label: anger

Text: Somebody told her friend that she would hit me wherever we would á meet.
Label: fear

Text: The death of my father made me feel quite guilty, because my á attitude towards him had been cold and indifferent.
Label: guilt

Text: I had fear when I was left alone at the bus depot at night. I had á problems of how to move to this place.
Label: fear

Text: Once I had to visit a rather special person.
Label: shame

Text: I felt disgusted when I was in a restaurant which didn't appear á to be clean and orderly. (I do not like to be in unclean á environments).
Label: disgust

Text: On Christmas eve I went to a classmate's home with other á classmates.  The next morning when I came out of the toilet she á said something and I did not understand what she was saying.  á When she pointed at my trousers I discovered that I had forgotten á to zip them up.  I rushed back to the toilet but by the time the á others had guessed what had happened.
Label: shame

Text: Saying goodbye at the airport to my boyfriend who has to go to á school back East. We are very close and have been together 4 á years.
Label: sadness

Text: When the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the final á of the Europe Cup at Athens.
Label: joy

Text: Disgust with drunk people.
Label: disgust

Text: Not helping parents enough at home and at the farm - this has á happened many times.
Label: guilt

Text: Someone acting stupid in public.
Label: disgust

Text: When I had my first sexual relation and it didn't work.
Label: shame

Text: Once when I complained I caused a great discussion between my á parents.
Label: guilt

Text: When I look at people around and know that people who are stupid á look stupid.
Label: joy

Text: I hadn't been at my parent's place for a long time. When I went to á visit them I had high expectations, but when I was there it was á very different from what I expected.
Label: sadness

Text: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected for a á University course.
Label: joy

Text: Finding my glasses again after having lost them in town.
Label: joy

Text: When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever á cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to á learn that it was me who was delaying things.
Label: joy

Text: When reading a newspaper story of a man who had committed á incestuous acts on his two-year old child - the thought that á anyone could do such a thing is abhorrent to me.
Label: disgust

Text: When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and I á am shut up in my appartment.  Nothing happens in particular á because there is no time for anything else.
Label: sadness

Text: My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car.  At the á agreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had an á accident.
Label: fear

Text: When my father married a certain lady. The reception was held at á Kasungu town Hall.
Label: joy

Text: I was swimming in the river and I lost the top of my bikini.  I á did not notice it and came out of water.  There was a á disagreeable classmate watching the scene.
Label: shame

Text: During the first year in university I had bad results in both á the terms, especially the first term.  I was afraid that  I would á not be promoted to the next year and that the others would go á ahead of me.
Label: fear

Text: In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got á me a three day furlough.
Label: joy

Text: Being on view in a meat-factory. Pigs being cut open, pigs being á suspended from nods, blood everywhere, decompsition.
Label: disgust

Text: When my friends were rude to a girl.
Label: shame

Text: [ No response.]
Label: disgust

Text: An inter-college basket-ball match.
Label: fear

Text: I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher á Institute.
Label: joy

Text: Shame of not doing something well.
Label: shame

Text: I could have been killed by a falling object.
Label: fear

Text: My good friend misunderstood me.
Label: sadness

Text: A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if the á goods that he had ordered had arrived.  I had totally á forgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.
Label: shame

Text: Decided at the last minute not to do something that I said I á would do with a person.
Label: guilt

Text: I felt disgust with alcohol in general when a close friend of á mine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and it á was quite shameful.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was involved in a car crash.
Label: guilt

Text: I had known the girl for a few months when I proposed to her and this á put an end to our friendship, as from then on we started á withdrawing from each other.  I liked her very much.
Label: guilt

Text: At having an argument with a stranger, in the street.
Label: anger

Text: Some weeks ago I experienced a day that everything went wrong I á broke several things I felt very ashamed for I am not a sloven.
Label: shame

Text: An uncle of mine who just retired, having worked hard all his á life, got a cerebral hemorrhage.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was at the end-of-term party last week and had fun - was á happy and sang and drank only soft drinks.  It is possible to á have a good time without alcohol.
Label: joy

Text: When I don't go to my parents on Sunday and phone them to tell á them that I have to study. The truth is that I listened to sports á on the radio.
Label: guilt

Text: On school, during a fancy fair, there was a stand of amnesty á international. There I read (for the first time) a description of á the tortures of a woman, what they did to her.
Label: disgust

Text: When I went in a clinical hospital and saw in what conditions á people are attended there.
Label: disgust

Text: I am a teacher in arts and crafts (boys from 15-16 years). for á them it is obligatory and they dislike it. They tease me. When one of á them cut up some material I flared up.
Label: anger

Text: Having quarreled with a boyfriend, he threatened to leave me.
Label: fear

Text: If I don't go to lectures, I often feel ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: The end of a relationship (after 4 years) by doing this I hurt á the other person very much.
Label: sadness

Text: Lecturers being unfair to me in reports.
Label: sadness

Text: Riding home from school after completing two midterms in two á days, and feeling I did well on them.
Label: joy

Text: The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called  á the misuse of his iron.  He called me stupid, self centered etc.  á I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining á school to cool off.
Label: anger

Text: As a young girl in form I, I wet my bed one day at the boarding á school and many girls came to see the person who had done it as I á had to take my mattress out that day.
Label: shame

Text: When I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one and á went well.
Label: joy

Text: When my father passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: In the past I experienced this feeling almost all the time - á wherever I went, in different sutuations. I was small and I had á to be taken to kindergarten, but me the fool didn't dare to tell á exactly where, finally as a result I was late.
Label: shame

Text: When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water in á it and threw it in the dust-bin.
Label: anger

Text: At a certain situation I felt myself neglected and undeservedly á harmed.
Label: anger

Text: When in my childhood we were forced to take cod-liver oil.
Label: disgust

Text: When my father died.
Label: sadness

Text: When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.
Label: joy

Text: I forgot to zip up my trousers, this was not noticed by anyone.
Label: shame

Text: I could not finish my homework on time.
Label: shame

Text: After the interview for admission to the university and before á the admission list was disclosed.  I was scared that I would not á be admitted and my fear lasted for quite some time.  My fear á disappeared only after the list was disclosed.
Label: fear

Text: I lived in a student-house, where you shared the lavatory and á shower with a fellow student. the shower cubicle formed the á connection between both appartments. My neighbour very often was á drunk and aggressive. One night, I was afraid that he would enter á my room.
Label: fear

Text: I omitted to do a favor to a friend, while he was very much in á need for help.
Label: shame

Text: When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up until á midnight.  I had no place to go to and there were strange reports á at the police station.
Label: fear

Text: When I heard about a murder of a 16-year-old girl.
Label: disgust

Text: I thought that I had failed an examination, but when I was á informed about the mark, I saw that I had passed it.
Label: joy

Label: joy

Label: anger

Text: When I was watching some scenes from the Bertoluchi's film á \Twentieth Century\"."
Label: disgust

Text: When I was a kid, I always opened the door to greet my father á when he came back from work.  One day it so happened that his á hair was scattered due to over-crowding in the train, and when I á opened the door as usual I saw something else.  I was so scared á that I could not talk.
Label: fear

Text: Telling friends about your nickname.
Label: guilt

Text: When I recently thought about the hard work it takes to study, and  á how one wants to try something else.  When I read a theoretical á book in English that I did not understand.
Label: sadness

Text: This issue worried me rather than saddening me.  In mid September á I went to Guanggho alone.  I was looking for an accomodation in á the evening and after having walked 2 or 3 miles I still could not á find anything.  What could I do?  I was not worried about á sleeping on the streets but because of some procedural problems.  á I finally found a place to sleep at 8 o'clock.
Label: sadness

Text: New Year's Eve party in the country, I hardly knew a person; my á partner spent most of the time at the bar. I had little á opportunity to get to know people because our table was separated á and my boyfriend's parents were present.
Label: anger

Text: When two drug addicts tried to take away my money.
Label: fear

Text: When I masturbated in my room.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was still a child I was told off in face of other persons á for having touched an object that didn't belong to me.
Label: shame

Text: To be kissed by soembody I didn't expect to.
Label: disgust

Text: A friend of mine played a joke on another friend over the á telephone.  This friend, crying, called me and I got very angry á and made the other person apologize.
Label: anger

Label: sadness

Label: shame

Label: anger

Label: joy

Label: disgust

Label: joy

Text: The day I left my first girlfriend.
Label: sadness

Text: A friend who was 22 years old, died of leukemia; I had not known á that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shima á with roast chicken), I felt disgusted.
Label: disgust

Text: This morning I spent a lot of time on my toilet and missed the á train to the university.  My mother told me that I spent more á time than a woman on my toilet.  I felt a mixed emotion of shame á and anger.
Label: shame

Text: When I thought the house was on fire at night.
Label: fear

Text: Once I had torn a few pages off a library book and I felt ashamed á at this.
Label: shame

Text: On my birthday, when a very close friend sent me a huge bouquet á of flowers.
Label: joy

Text: I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. The á girl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: At work when I did not get the full co-operation of my colleagues á to complete an assignment.
Label: disgust

Text: When students in our working group showed no responsibility or á interest in our work.
Label: anger

Text: When in the initial interview for the recruiting, I don't know why, á I accepted to do the test for army.

Text: When I went out with my dog in a forest late at night when we á were on a camping.

Text: In the begining of teenage, on the matters of sex - speaking á about sex.

Text: I was sitting on an electric swing, suddenly the machine went á out of order while I was still in the upward position.
Label: fear

Text: One day, when I was twelve years old, my brother took some slimy á substance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made of á cider and threatened to throw it at me.
Label: disgust

Text: A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his á behavior.
Label: fear

Text: When I excreted on the mat instead of the potty.
Label: shame

Text: During lunch with some classmates, a priest was also there.  He á was eating desperately as if someone was going to take his plate á away.  He did it with gluttony.  He wiped his hands on his suit á several times and it was full of crumbs.
Label: disgust

Text: At a meeting with over one hundred people, they decided who had to speak á from the stand by drawing lots.
Label: shame

Text: I was alone at home, in bed reading a womens' magazine in which á there were storiees of paranormal experiences.  My leg was á itching and I stretched my hand to scratch and I felt another á strange hand. (later I realized that it was the corner of the á blanket)
Label: fear

Text: Being sexually assulted in public.
Label: shame

Text: I heard somebody talk about studies in a highly enthusiastic á \student-like\" way."
Label: disgust

Text: After seeing a terror movie at the cinema, I was so scared that I á couldn't even drive the car into the garage. I often thought á about the film afterwards, hoping such things couldn't exist in á the \real world\"."
Label: fear

Text: Going to CAL not knowing anyone.
Label: fear

Text: My roommate being nice to a party leader in order to get into the á party.
Label: disgust

Text: While playing a ball game, I made a mistake and we lost the game.
Label: guilt

Text: When someone took my writing materials yet I was to write á Examinations in a few minutes.
Label: anger

Text: When my mother asked me to do a job for her which does not á require much effort on my part, yet I refused for selfish reasons á and saw her have to do it.
Label: shame

Text: When I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to my á mother and when my behaviour had been influenced by other outward á factors.
Label: guilt

Text: I was informed by my flatmate that, when we'd moved into our á flat, she'd expected us to buy our food separetely - this event á actually happened some 5 months after our sharing began. Prior to á this, she had said nothing.
Label: anger

Text: After having been ill, when I was coming back to the hostel, I á felt very sad leaving home.
Label: sadness

Text: In a Mathematics class, the professor asked me a question and I á gave the wrong answer.
Label: shame

Text: Skiing down a very icy slope, very fast in white-out conditions. á Out of control with no idea of what I was doing or where I was á heading.
Label: fear

Text: A friend of mine trusted me to back her in a decision she had á made.  But when the moment came I did not agree with her opinion.
Label: guilt

Text: Thinking that I had been seen smoking at school by a teacher - á waiting to be summoned to the headmaster's office.
Label: fear

Text: When I was curious about it and went to a spiritism session with a á friend. I had already been there other times (many times when I á was younger) but that day, even if I don't believe in á spiritism I was terribly afraid that something would happen to me á (sort of incorporation !).
Label: fear

Text: I had asked the teacher to write a recommendation letter for me, á but I had not provided enough information and had run short of á time.
Label: sadness

Text: One day during our clinical practices, we had a very ill patient. á Unfortunately the patient passed away. I had seen him dying and á it was the first experience. During the night I became afraid á fearing the dead body.
Label: fear

Text: Being close to drowning.
Label: fear

Text: I did not do as well as I expected on a chemistry exam. I á received a score below the average and I thought I had done very á well.
Label: sadness

Text: Deception from a person I loved very much.
Label: disgust

Text: When my grandfather was in a nursing home when I was young I never á wanted to go and sometimes didn't have to and later I felt á guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: We got into a fight with some chaps in front of our family house. á The value of the property destroyed was approximately 15 000 FIM. á I felt ashamed when my parents came to know about this.
Label: shame

Text: When I was made to feel responsible for the emotional state a friend of á mine was in.
Label: guilt

Text: \ I have been hearing rumours that you have not been allowing á
Label: anger

Text: On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.
Label: joy

Text: When I was touring Asia with my present football team, I saw old á Europeans with young asiatic prostitutes.
Label: disgust

Text: We got news that my (almost) 21 years old brother died while á visiting Europe of a cerebral hemorhage. It finally hit me an á hour after we saw his corpse in the coffin. It felt like a door á between himself and everything had closed and locked forever.
Label: sadness

Text: One morning I was standing at the bus-stop and the bus passed by á without stopping, even though there were only 8-10 passengers á inside.  I felt angry at the rude behaviour of the bus driver and  á conductor.
Label: anger

Text: In the traffic I insulted a man who crossed my way. Afterwards I á paired with him, and felt shame because of mine lack of pacience á and ridiculous attitude.
Label: shame

Text: Thinking about death when walking alone at night.
Label: fear

Text: I was not able to explain well to my good friend to make him less á angry.
Label: guilt

Text: Before I had a tooth pulled out.  I was very upset and ill.
Label: fear

Text: Not keeping a promise of delivering materials of great importance á to the receiver.
Label: guilt

Text: When I heard that my nephew had passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.
Label: anger

Text: When I saw my brother in Church, and publically accept Jesus á Christ as his saviour and Lord.
Label: joy

Text: I went to spend a night with a relative of mine and there I á found that the bed had been wet the previous night.
Label: disgust

Text: Staying alone in a dark place.
Label: fear

Text: My joy was the joy of meeting again.  My husband came home after á having been away for weeks (for work).  I was on the railway á station to meet him.
Label: joy

Text: When I received the result slip of the higher level examination á (an university entrance exam) and saw that I had a very good á possibility of being accepted into the university, I felt very á excited.
Label: joy

Text: When I acted in a negative way at a certain moment by laziness á to concede a moment of the time I thought to be my own.
Label: guilt

Text: When I stole a packet of cigarettes from a neighbour  and the á next day I owned up and returned it.
Label: shame

Text: I remember that when I was in school I saw a case of partiality - á one of the teachers gave private coaching classes to some girls á and she would give these girls extra attention in class and would á ignore the others.
Label: anger

Text: [ I have never felt this emotion.]
Label: shame

Text: When I failed an exam unfairly.
Label: anger

Text: When my Bictorian \friend\" was staying at my house we ere going á
Label: guilt

Text: I was together with my family one night, a few days after my á father had died, during that conversation I expressed my á displeasure because nobody understands me.
Label: sadness

Text: One night we, all the family members, were sitting in the front á corridor of the house when a gentleman looking person came in.  á He was my father's client and he had come to bribe my father in á connection with the proceeding case.  At my father's refusal he á abused my father, my brother and I could not control our temper á and we rushed at him.
Label: anger

Text: I cried for 3 hours because I felt very miserable. Then I called á my boyfriend and he said lovely things to me. After this feeling á disappeared I felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: Afraid I wouldn't catch the train when I was going to see my á sweetheart.

Text: [ No response.]
Label: anger

Label: sadness

Text: I had to call somebody between 12 and 12:30. As I had no á possibility to call him at this time, I did not do it until 3 á p.m.
Label: guilt

Text: Someone told me we are not as good as the All English Class.
Label: anger

Text: Made a misjudgement in a football match.
Label: guilt

Text: When I realized that I was not working hard enough and was not á being useful as an individual to the society or the family, guilt á at spending money on uncalled for activities - in short wasting á my life.
Label: guilt

Text: Due to laziness, I failed the term studies completely at á University.  I also wanted, to some extent, to protest against my á parents' expectations.
Label: guilt

Text: A very close friend of mine died. I read it in the newspaper. I á didn't know what to do and thought about it the whole day.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt afraid of losing somebody I love to another person because á I was an incomprehensive person and lots of time I fight with á this person.
Label: fear

Text: I was disgusted when my brother was arrested because of stealing á money.

Text: When I was weeding the garden I found a lizard in my hand.
Label: disgust

Text: A man asked me: \May I sleep in your stairway?\"  and I answered á
Label: shame

Text: I wrote an Exam and happened to have not done as well as I á thought I would. I was angry to myself for not having done so á well.
Label: anger

Text: When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on the á outer reef of Tvavni, Fidgi.
Label: joy

Text: I went to my boyfrien's house. There I found clothes of a certain á girl. Without asking whose clothes they were I started tearing á them only to realise that they were his sister's and so I felt á guilty.
Label: guilt

Label: sadness

Text: Last Summer I was walking along the beach in a bikini and an á awful man came cycling after me.  He was shouting and I ran as á fast as my legs could carry me.
Label: fear

Text: My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing á and went out with him herself.
Label: anger

Text: That evening when I opened the songbook while I was singing the á song \Those were the days\" that guilt feeling became stronger.  á
Label: guilt

Text: I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner set á quite involuntarily.
Label: guilt

Text: [ Being close to another person.]
Label: joy

Label: shame

Text: One day mother slaughtered a chicken for a brother who had come á back for holiday. In everybody's absence I opened the foodstore á and ate all internal organs of the chicken. When mother á discovered, we were all called and I was found with hands stained á with soup. I was ashamed being the eldest of all in the family.
Label: shame

Text: Close friends talking badly of other friends.
