Text: When I saw a program on Ethiopia on T.V, a fews hours earlier I á had thrown away some clothes and food.
Label: guilt

Text: After a long time (of no communication with him, physical á illness and worry) my lover came to see me, when I least expected á to see him.
Label: joy

Text: On the way home from Marstrand I was driving behind my father's á car.  Another car tried to push in front of my father and he was á forced to swerve and he thus collided the car with a pillar.  The á other car drove off without even seeing what had happened.
Label: anger

Text: Recently, some friends and I had too much to drink while on a á foot-ball road trip to USC. We trashed our hotel room and I felt á ashamed when the maid walked in the next morning.
Label: shame

Text: When my friend who is close to me got engaged and did not invite á me.
Label: disgust

Text: When my elder sister died.
Label: sadness

Text: When my grandfather died I was extremely sad.  However my family á members did not have any special feelings, they said that he was á already 80 years old.
Label: sadness

Text: Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes, we do not speak á about sexual things, too. But once he told such a vulgar joke, á that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me, but some of his á friends, but I was present.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt anger when at the end of a telephone call, a good friend á told me that she would go to travel next year with another good á friend. We couldn't talk this out.
Label: anger

Text: The day the results of the university entrance exam was á published, I found my canditate number and I was very excited.
Label: joy

Text: When I was a child, I had a medical check-up. I had to undress á myself and was examined by several doctors.
Label: shame

Text: Watching a horror film.
Label: fear

Text: When my mother was proved to suffer from a very serious disease.
Label: sadness

Text: A meeting with the family and the friends I felt dear and loved, á sharing the gladness of being together at a birthday.
Label: joy

Text: A few days back I had a tutorial class and the teacher randomly á assigned one person in each group to make a presentation.  The á discussion in our group had been confused and the presentation á was not very well prepared.  Unfortunately I was selected to á present and I could not keep calm, was confused and result was á very poor.  I really felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: When you betray the trust you have been given. This is connected á with copying at a class-work at school.
Label: shame

Text: Every time I meet a certain person. We cannot get on well á together, we dislike each other.
Label: disgust

Text: Risk of being involved in a fight after a party.
Label: fear

Text: When riding in a very fastly-driven car on a lose metal road at a á very late hour - no other cars on road, and driver was taking á corners very sharply. I felt afraid - because if an accident á happened, the area was very isolated. Also, I feared for driver, á after I was dropped off - would he make it home safely.
Label: fear

Text: Emotional reassurances by spouse.
Label: joy

Text: I added a little   ?   to a yield in an experiment to get more of á a yield.
Label: guilt

Text: When I left a man in whom I really believed.
Label: sadness

Text: For the above: guilt at not living up to my own moral á expectation, guilt for not being the type of person my patents á wanted, guilt for just about bloody everything, just realising á that I have failed drastically in my own eyes.
Label: guilt

Text: My sister, whom I like very much, asked me for a favour which I á refused her for some flimsy reason. Some time later I felt sorry á for that and something like sadness.
Label: sadness

Text: In the traffic with a car, I nearly got crushed between a bus and á a tram.  The attention of other drivers saved me at the last moment.
Label: fear

Text: On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near á the house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As my á girlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me. á He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I á really did not like that.
Label: fear

Text: I forgot to lock the outside door at my Land Lady's place.
Label: guilt

Text: When my fiancee travelled 2000 Km to visit me, and I hadn't seen á her for 4 months.
Label: joy

Text: When a close friend did not write.
Label: anger

Text: Returning home in the late afternoon I saw an indecent act made á by a man with the purpose that I saw it.
Label: disgust

Text: When my elder brother failed form five in 1968 when I was 5 years á old.
Label: disgust

Text: At my job, I got disproportionately angry with a child.  My á reaction was not as it should have been.
Label: guilt

Text: I got up late and I could not go to my lessons on time.  When I á entered the class room the stare of the teacher and my classmates á made me feel guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: When I lost something that was valuable to my sister.
Label: guilt

Text: A friend giving me an expensive Christmas gift while I gave her a á cheap one.
Label: shame

Text: One evening I went fishing with some friends but we could not á fish as a fisherman had already put his net there.  We pulled á out the net to find only crabs in it so we threw the net away.  á The net was large and may have cost $1000.  The fisherman used á the net to earn a living and we had had thrown it.
Label: guilt

Text: Losing my temper with my spouse.
Label: guilt

Text: I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I á was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.
Label: joy

Text: Car accident, hurt three of my closest family.
Label: guilt

Text: I was in a restaurant with my boyfriend when I saw my best female á friend after not seeing her for two weeks.  We rejoyced, hugged á and had a long talk.
Label: joy

Text: I wanted something in particular and did not get it, also there á was no possibility of getting it.
Label: sadness

Text: [ When someone tells me something that hurts me, I feel bad about á it and also feel sad.]
Label: sadness

Text: I was visiting my parents in law when the house was invaded by á three strange men, and they committed an armed assault.
Label: fear

Text: A boy I had been admiring so much asked me to go out with him.
Label: joy

Text: I felt guilty one day when I was accused of running away from á classes and I was caught.
Label: guilt

Text: Saw someone licking his dining bowl.
Label: disgust

Text: My mother had just been teaching me how to crochet, which is á thought highly improper for a boy in a town.  Just when we á finished, a neighbour walked in.
Label: shame

Text: [ No reponse.]
Label: sadness

Text: When someone accuses me without reason and is not willing to á listen to me.
Label: anger

Text: A day I was with my boyfriend and a couple of friends in a bar, á and he said something that I didn't like (I don't remember what). á Without thinking I slept him in his back, getting ashamed and á sorry just after.
Label: shame

Text: A good friend of mine who is at the moment in a foreign country. á I didn't write her for several months and now I feel guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: Not doing my share of the work for the house job.
Label: shame

Text: Had a letter from my father (usually he does not write to me).
Label: joy

Text: One night, when I got out from the University I saw two strange á people near my car. When I got near, they moved away, and then á came close again. I had a feeling that they were assaulters. á After I left I discovered that the windshield was broken.
Label: fear

Text: One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to á somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.
Label: joy

Text: When I tried to explain to my child as to why there were á magazines wiith naked girls on them at the kiosk.
Label: disgust

Text: After a courtship of three months I made an end to it. The boy á was very sad about this.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was a child it was found out that I had taken off my á clothes outdoors.  It was summer and my friend and I were out á in the woods.  It had felt exciting at that time.  My parents á discovered that my trousers were back to front and I felt á ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: Postgraduate students talking about girls stupid.
Label: disgust

Text: [ For example, unfair pushing in a bus.]
Label: anger

Text: Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him á very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the á hunter who shot him.
Label: sadness

Text: That I didn't take the time to make an appointment with someone.
Label: guilt

Text: When I made an end on a relationship after three years.
Label: shame

Text: I always feel ashamed when I do not succeed in accomplishing á something in which I had put in all my efforts.
Label: shame

Text: When I was 15 my mother discovered various items in my room which á 15 year olds aren't usually expected to have - mainly alcohol, á marijuana and contraceptives !
Label: shame

Text: Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.
Label: disgust

Text: When I dreamed that I was being attacked by a friend.
Label: fear

Text: I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my á affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if á nothing had happened.
Label: disgust

Text: My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very á naughty and began wetting her pants.  She did it one afternoon.
Label: anger

Text: I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months. á  I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we á went there because we knew we would meet there.
Label: joy

Text: To go through the underground way at suburb station of LAPA. Poor á people and the ambulants badly dressed up in a passage badly á kept.
Label: disgust

Text: When I was at a boarding school at Lusaka, the Rhodesian á soldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw the á whole scene.
Label: fear

Text: I saw a friend's husband with another woman.
Label: disgust

Text: I was asked to join my friend in a boat at Mangochi Lake Malawi á and when making a turn, it seemed as if the boat would sink on á the side.
Label: fear

Text: An incident occurred to me when I was going home with my á girlfriend. On the way, a man named Banda grabbed my girlfriend á in my presence. I was really angry with him and as a result I á threw stones at him and he ran away.
Label: anger

Text: I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fence á and started barking angrily.  They were jumping and it seemed á that they would come for me any time.
Label: fear

Text: My teacher reminded us not to do a Summer job, however I did it á for two months.  Yesterday I was chatting with my teacher and á when we talked of the Summer job, I felt ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: [ When family mmembers or friends blame me for something I am not á responsible for.  I feel very sad as it was not my fault.]
Label: sadness

Text: The inability to read a book at college.
Label: sadness

Text: I went to a doctor with a complaint. The doctor told me that I á was completely healthy.
Label: joy

Text: Brother provoked anger. It was when mother and father were away á and we had to look after ourselves. He accused me of being á selfish and a snob.
Label: anger

Text: On a holiday in France I made a walk in the woods all alone and á very relaxed. Then a motorbike took me over and I saw the man á watching all the time. Suddenly the man stood behing me and I ran á away fast.
Label: fear

Text: When I got the positive result of my examination to achieve the á Bachelor Degree in Plychology.
Label: joy

Text: When my friend did not pass the high school graduation á examinations.
Label: sadness

Text: When my grandfather died.
Label: sadness

Text: I made an appointment to pick up someone. However I arrived á too late and she had to wait a quarter of an hour.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.
Label: disgust

Text: When my friend failed an exam by just one mark.  During this exam á she had asked me to show her my answer sheet and I had not done á it.  When the results came out, I thought that had I shown her my á answer sheet she would have passed the exam.  I felt guilty as I á had failed her.
Label: guilt

Text: Breaking up with a girl.
Label: sadness

Text: When I got associated with a boy one year ago, I neglected my á best friend. When the relation with this boy finished she behaved á very easy-going towards me. I felt guilty then.
Label: guilt

Text: When my sister's boyfriend accused her of having been sleeping around.
Label: disgust

Text: Caused fault in V.C.R. by not following instructions carefully.
Label: shame

Text: Once at a camp a classmate criticized me in front of others.  Now á I find that this classmate is very disgusting.
Label: disgust

Text: My son was born.
Label: joy

Text: Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finland á for a year as an exchange student.
Label: sadness

Text: China winning the Asian Olympic games.
Label: joy

Text: I choked on a cold drink in front of girls who were strangers.
Label: shame

Text: Getting a good mark for a subject I had worked hard at but á expected only a moderate mark.
Label: joy

Text: When I passed and qualified for the university.
Label: joy

Text: When I first suffered from syphilis.
Label: sadness

Text: I feel guilty as I am not working, and even my studies are not á progressing.
Label: shame

Text: Made a mistake at work.
Label: guilt

Text: One of my best friends'fiancT broke off the relationship because á his feelings for me were stronger than for her. I felt the same á for him, but did not really encourage him to leave her or stay á with her - still felt shame.
Label: shame

Text: When I was about to be bitten by my friend's dog, later on it bit á me.
Label: fear

Text: Passed the last exam.
Label: joy

Text: At a success of mine, at a real achievement.
Label: joy

Text: I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not á have the money to do it.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt very angry when a mishanga seller robbed me of the á transport money I had to go to school.
Label: anger

Text: When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of á mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.
Label: disgust

Text: When I had beaten my auntie.
Label: guilt

Text: When I had just moved into my new appartment I found a ventilator á in the kitchen.  I was going to clean it when I found that the á drum was full of mud and slime.  I felt disgusted.
Label: disgust

Text: Boyfriend doing cleaning in situation where it was my job to do á it. Later snapped at him over trivial thing. He looked downcast. á I felt guilty - \he's just done all that work for me\"."
Label: guilt

Text: Cheating in a minor geography exam at school.
Label: shame

Text: Despite my being affectionate, sincere, and helpful to close  á relatives of mine; they turned around and accused me of being á inconsiderate in my relationship with them.
Label: disgust

Text: I went to a restaurant with my boyfriend for dinner. There we saw á a couple. the man of the couple was a negro and he hadn't manners á for eat.
Label: disgust

Text: When planning to marry.
Label: joy

Text: The first time that I caressed a girl, I was about thirteen and á she was eighteen.  I noticed that it did not affect her at all.
Label: shame

Text: A night spent with a group of friends.
Label: joy

Text: Once when I was studying for my examination, I was asked to do á some work which was unavoidable.
Label: disgust

Text: It was when my father was taken into detention by the CIDS for á two years for a reason I don't know up to now.
Label: sadness

Text: When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got \very good\" á
Label: joy

Text: With the job appointments committee when the headmaster in charge á explained that a male teacher was more suitable for the á particular post.  I had more years of service than the male á teacher, but this was not taken into consideration.  I could have á been given a less attractive job if things had gone the way the á headmaster wanted.
Label: anger

Text: When I pulled a chair from under someone at kindergarten and he á hit his head.
Label: guilt

Text: When I see someone vomitting.
Label: disgust

Text: [ No response.]
Label: guilt

Text: I deliberately avoided a person who I wanted to hurt, and who á wanted to talk to me.
Label: disgust

Text: I cheated my boyfriend.
Label: guilt

Text: When I came to know that my father and his parents were : self á interested, dirty, negative, egoist, bad peolpe,......
Label: disgust

Text: I felt very disgusted at a friend to whom I had given a Psychology á book to read, and she did not care to give me back the book á during the exams.
Label: disgust

Text: When I gave birth to a child and saw that it was normal when it á was put against my breast.
Label: joy

Text: When I had to go to reconciliation before converting to á Catholicism but then once received - o.k.
Label: guilt

Text: Found out my wife (girl-friend?) pregnant.
Label: joy

Text: I lead a rather secure life.  The only thing I can remember is a á song from the nineteenth century which is against alcohol.  Both á the melody and the word (although naive) effected my emotions.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was young, about 6 or 7, I did not make it to the toilet á on time.  I hid the dirty trousers in the cellar as I feared itá being discovered by my parents.
Label: shame

Text: When I did not go to work because I had to study for a midterm.
Label: guilt

Text: The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary á examination.
Label: guilt

Text: Last Summer in Italy I was attacked by a dog.It was terrible to á feel that untidy dirty dog against my naked skin.
Label: fear

Text: When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus á holding back progress as everything depended on him.  I felt á angry over his actions.
Label: anger

Text: I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving á me any thing - money to come back to school.
Label: anger

Text: I watched a football match with my old friend.  The performance á of the team was very good and the team members were full of á spirit.  The match was excellent and every time a goal was scored á I felt excited.
Label: joy

Text: My lovely girlfriend double-crossed me and so that I found her á chatting with another guy.
Label: anger

Text: My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my á girl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid to á lose her.
Label: fear

Text: I met a friend in a discotheque. he was with a girl and he told á me that she was not his girlfriend.  I, to say something, á commented that she must be a viscious woman.  He then told me á that she was his girl.
Label: shame

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: When I got  grade \C\" in M160 at the end of my first year at á
Label: disgust

Text: The last time I had to phone the Registry, after having called á them so many times in the last few days.
Label: shame

Text: When I heard the examination results and when I recovered after á having been sick for a week.
Label: joy

Text: When a close friend entrusted me with a secret and I let the cat á out of the bag.
Label: shame

Text: The second time I went to the entrance exam to V.S.P. and á didn't get approved.
Label: sadness

Text: When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I á had managed it well.  He was born a month too early with a á malfunctioning lung.  This happened a year ago.
Label: joy

Text: It appeared that I gave correct answers to all questions during á an examination of personality while I thought I performed very á badly. Even now, I don't know how I managed it.
Label: joy

Text: I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date  á with my fiancee.  We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was á afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.
Label: fear

Text: When a drunkard barged into a room where my friend and I had run á in order to get away from him.  We were all alone and all I could á see was this hand coming towards me.
Label: fear

Text: When my brother did not send me the transport money to resume      á my studies in time at UNZA.
Label: anger

Text: My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.  One evening, á when I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.  My mother's á expression told me that it had died.  My knees refused to support á me and I began to weep convulsively.
Label: sadness

Text: When I saw a man hitting a child of 2 years without any consideration, á simply because the child had been leaning against a window.
Label: anger

Text: When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd died á because she was old, but because she lived in the last few years á in an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers - á no chair, or private space, and when I went to visit she would be á sitting in the \lliving\" room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I á
Label: sadness

Text: Insulted for no reason.
Label: anger

Text: I read in the newspaper that the Student Lodging Fund was going á to build new appartments for refugees (in my opinion this is the á state's affair).  This is when only a fractoin of the students á can find an appartment.
Label: anger

Text: When I was a child: I had told my mother a lie and she found it á out.
Label: shame

Text: Someone stole a K10 note and the teacher thought that it was me á when I was not responsible for the theft.
Label: disgust

Text: When I insulted my young sister for a very little misconduct of á putting on my shoes. She wrote me an apology letter and the á message she included made me feel guilty.
Label: guilt

Text: While he was drunk, my life partner tried to hit me.  I felt á scared and fled to the bathroom.
Label: fear

Text: I gave my mom a gift she wanted for years. I raflected her joy.
Label: joy

Text: When I lost the person who meant the most to me.
Label: sadness

Text: For my parents anniversary, we hosted a party and we were very á happy.
Label: joy

Text: I needed a recommendation for something. I decided that the best á person to get one from was a professor who I had never talked to á before. I felt a lot of fear going up after class to ask him to á recommend me considering he had never heard my name before. But I á did.
Label: fear

Text: When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.
Label: sadness

Text: When I got the scholarship letter from Australia.
Label: joy

Text: I allowed my then boyfriend to touch me, if only briefly.
Label: shame

Text: Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't á wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness á (and so it is now).
Label: fear

Text: At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of a á sports event, but my teacher refused to give me the day off á because he didn't like me.
Label: anger

Text: Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.
Label: fear

Text: I misunderstood a girl and thought that she loved me.  One day á when I was talking to her, her boyfriend appeared and I felt á ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: My class winning against another class in a football match.
Label: joy

Text: Bulgaria won a football match against France.
Label: joy

Text: That was soon after the results of the interview which nearly á 9,000 people attended in all the three regions of Malawi. My joy á came after hearing on the radio that I was one of the people á selected to undergo the Medical Assistant training at the á L.S.H.S.
Label: joy

Text: When I decided to leave my steady, secure employment to come to á university. Because I didn't know if I could cope with all the á requirements of study and also being older I didn't know if I á would enjoy mixing with younger people, also financial á insecurity.
Label: fear

Text: When I read the newspaper that morning I found my candidature á number on the admission list of the Chinese university.  I was á satisfied and happy and the cumulative anxiety disappeared.  I á only wanted to cry out that I had succeeded.
Label: joy

Text: A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were being á clubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutally á graphic. B) Description of a disfigured orphaned child in Hiroshima á calling for her mother.
Label: sadness

Text: My father was very angry with another man in the presence of my á friends.
Label: shame

Text: Seeing maltreated, dead animals.
Label: disgust

Text: When I passed an exam.
Label: joy

Text: I didn't do very well on a midterm and I'm disgusted with myself á because I was prepared and thought I did well.
Label: disgust

Text: When I saw that the mark I had obtained in an exam was a good á one.
Label: joy

Text: When I was 7-8 years old, I woke up one night and found myself á alone at home.  My mother had gone out to buy cigarattes from a á machine.
Label: fear

Text: Dad had just married his second wife (my step-mother) and I did á not like her so I went to the wardrobe and set fire to her á dresses.  Eveyone suspected my brother and he had to bear the á consequences.  Nobody ever got to know that it was me who had á done it.
Label: guilt

Text: When I got a record as a gift from a friend.
Label: joy

Text: When an old schoolfriend phoned me to arrange an appointment to á talk about old memories. I hadn't seen him for 8 years.
Label: joy

Text: I had to wash my grandmother because she did not get to the á bathroom on time.
Label: disgust

Text: On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought á me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.
Label: joy

Text: I feel guilty when when I realize that I consider material things á more important than caring for my relatives.  I feel very á self-centered.
Label: guilt

Text: One of my class-mates had a disease unexpectedly, he had been in á a coma for six days in a hospital before he died.
Label: sadness

Text: [ No response.]
Label: disgust

Text: My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a á good friend who, she thought, was not good company for me.  á Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried to á defend my friend.
Label: anger

Text: Doing well in an examn.
Label: joy

Text: Several years ago my mother died. She had been ill for a long á time, but nevertheless her death came unexpectedly. I did not and á I still do not want to believe that it is true.
Label: sadness

Text: When I was hungry, I tried to take the money that my mother á had saved up for something else.
Label: shame

Text: [ ....has not really happened.]
Label: shame

Text: When I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited and á disappointed.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was told that my uncle had passed away.
Label: sadness

Text: After having failed my driving test.
Label: shame

Text: During lectures, I sensed an unexpressed understanding with a boy á I did not know.  We exchange glances ; I think he likes me, and I á like him too.  Perhaps he has fallen in love with me .........
Label: joy

Text: Not handing in homework in time.
Label: guilt

Text: My cat was sick and I had to take him to the vet to be put down - á no one else there to do it.
Label: sadness

Text: Riding through a bush fire on an island of Australia - on a á pushbike as a little boy - all alone, lost and surrounded by á smouldering wood and flame.
Label: fear

Text: Having received an offer to do post-graduate work.
Label: joy

Text: When I was notified that I had been accepted as a Psychology á student.
Label: joy

Text: After being told that an ex-boyfriend had been hurt by my wearing á something he had given me when I was with another guy. I was á unaware of my actions really, as I had not considered the fact á that he had given it to me, and might see me. I still respected á his opinions of me.
Label: guilt

Text: In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend's á birthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin, really wanted me to get á drunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit, á but had always been very careful - brought up to believe in á moderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixed á drinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and had á to leave the table to get sick in the loo, and later went home á and was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And I á didn't want to face or tell my other flatmates, or family.
Label: shame

Text: Not accepting hints of intimate relation from a girl.
Label: guilt

Text: In the University we were convoked to a stroll like a freshman I á was still innocent about the manipulation. On seeing the goal of á the exaltation to poor character people, I felt anger on feeling á myself mass of maneuver.
Label: anger

Text: My sister gave birth to twins, healthy ones.
Label: joy

Text: One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the ground á floor, I was often afraid of burglers.
Label: fear

Text: I had a date with my girlfriend, the time and place had not been á fixed.  I asked her to phone me an hour later as it was midnight á and I did not want to disturb her family.  I waited several hours á for her call, she did not call me that night.
Label: anger

Text: My father promised to send me pocket money at the month-end since á I wanted to buy a new pair of shoes when I was at secondary á school, but he didn't.
Label: disgust

Text: [ No response.]
Label: sadness

Text: When I was accepted as a student.
Label: joy

Text: My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then á we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to á refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my á anger.
Label: anger

Text: Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organise á a roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn at á doing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can't á be bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.
Label: anger

Text: My parents came to visit me.
Label: joy

Text: I slandered a person behind his back and he got to know about it.
Label: shame

Text: When I learnt that I had to repeat the first year, I found the á solution immediately but was blocked by many difficulties.
Label: sadness

Text: A good friend, the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me á from the pews (I am in the choir) and shook my hand during the á time for an informal \greeting\" in the church service. She said a á
Label: joy

Text: When I see people with burns I feel sad, actually I can not even á express my feelings as I think that they must suffer a lot.
Label: sadness

Text: I felt disgust with the alcohol, after I happened to see a young á man, who was dead to the world and who wallowed on the pavement. á This \sight\" I watched from the bus."
Label: disgust

Text: Sometime back I was coming from the wards and lice were all over á my uniform since patient's blankets have a lot of lice. It á happened that my boyfriend picked some lice from my white uniform. á I was so ashamed.
Label: shame

Text: I felt a great joy when I knew that my father was going to sell á the apartment from GUARUSA, because in some way we were helded by á it, that means that we didn't go to any other place, because we á had the apartment.
Label: joy

Text: When I learnt that I had been accepted at UNZA.
Label: joy

Text: When I got to know that I had passed the university entrance á exam.  I thought that I had done one of the exams badly.
Label: joy

Text: A friend of mine was hospitalized after having been diagnosed as á having typhoid, he had to forgo his exams and also his ambition á of doing a dissertation at the M.A level.  It was a very sad á event for me and I felt very sorry for him so I volunteered to á stay with him in the hospital.
Label: sadness

Text: When I noticed that I do many things to the pregiudice of myself.
Label: sadness

Text: I promised to join a meeting but did not turn up as I did not á want to do the work.
Label: guilt

Text: I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it á happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I think á I can call it so.
Label: sadness

Text: In May 18th, 1984 my boyfriend went to the U.S.A. In December I á was told he passed away. He had cancer of the Oesophagus.
Label: sadness

Text: I played in a stage play. Suddenly, in front of 200 people, I á could not remember the words I had to say.
Label: shame

Text: My mother always took my side. That brought about quarrels with á my father. I knew she didn't like that and I felt very sorry for á that.
Label: guilt

Text: When I heard that an acquaintance of mine was spreading rumours á about my affair with a close friend.
Label: anger

Text: A drunken friend of mine was beating up another friend, who was á also drunk.
Label: anger

Text: We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and á suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My á friend had to turn the car rapidly.
Label: fear

Text: When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had á failed.
Label: sadness

Text: I experienced this feeling when the doctors found a nodule in one á of my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusion á resulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in my á reason.
Label: fear

Text: I received an unexpected B+ on an engineering midterm. I did not á study nearly as much as I should have and it was a difficult á test.
Label: joy

Text: When I was insulted by a fellow student.
Label: anger

Text: I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell in á love with another man.
Label: guilt

Text: When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic á accident.
Label: sadness

Text: Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody and á difficult to persuade. With this I got angry with her.
Label: anger

Text: Getting back my Psych 140 midterm.
Label: fear

Text: After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to á relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had á finished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.
Label: anger

Text: Being criticized by teacher in public.
Label: shame

Text: When I saw the film \Johnny got his gun\" which deals with the á
Label: sadness

Text: I have been afraid several times. What marked me was that I á almost didn't enter University.
Label: fear

Text: When I had not been accepted to a college which I dreamed of á going to. I felt that I had let myself and my parents down.
Label: shame

Text: The news of the natural calamity, an earthquake in which hundreds  á of Mexican people died.
Label: sadness

Text: I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my á lecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so the á girl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was doing my homework at home, some relatives came and á advised me to help my mother do the house-work.
Label: shame

Text: I get disgusted with the inherent racist attitudes of my á brother-in-law in putting down various ethnic groups and also my á unwillingness to challenge him about these attitudes in order to á keep the peace.
Label: disgust

Text: In September 1984, I was forced to live with someone I did not á like.  The first week we were at loggerheads and our conversation á was like a debate.  The atmosphere was very bad.  When he learnt á that I had got 95 marks in a test he told me \ A failure, You lost á
Label: anger

Text: I had a quarrel with my father, because I was of the opinion that á he decided in an authoritarian way which TV program we should á watch. I became very angry and started throwing things through á the room.
Label: anger

Text: Watching Muldoon act as my P.M.
Label: shame

Text: Death of a parent.
Label: sadness

Text: My cassmate laughed at me when I was being scolded by the á teacher.
Label: anger

Text: While intoxicated I damaged my sister's car in a minor way and á someone elses in a minor way.
Label: guilt

Text: I was in Sierra Nevada, climbing a peak over 3,000 metres high, á without any light and with many other problems.  I was afraid for á my life.
Label: fear

Text: When my boyfriend almost had a relationship with a close friend á of mine.
Label: sadness

Text: Once after falling in love, I imagined that particular girl to be á perfect and completely overshadowing my girlfriend. Afterwards I á realized that this image was not objective. I felt guilty against á both girls.
Label: guilt

Text: When a person saw that I was accused of something I had not done á and did not do anything to defend me.
Label: disgust

Text: Someone called me a disgusting nickname.
Label: anger

Text: When I fought with my friends.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was travelling at night.
Label: fear

Text: [ No response.]
Label: sadness

Text: One of my friends asked me to go shopping with her, another á friend of hers was also coming along.  During the outing they á kept talking to each other and I felt left out, even when I tried á to talk to them they seemed not to listen to me and did not pay á me much attention.
Label: anger

Text: When at school, I threw a duster at another child and hit him in á the head. The blow caused a flesh wound and I was afraid of what á would happen to me when the teacher found out the circumstances.
Label: fear

Text: When mother was very ill, I feared that she would die.
Label: fear

Text: My boat didn't win a race which we were favored to win.
Label: shame

Text: I was camping in an old broken hut which had no lights.  I had á brought along a lamp which was not working very well.  The door á made strange sounds and I was sure that strange things were á happening.  The most terrifying bit was that there were many á wardrobes in the hut and everytime that I looked in the glass of á the wardrobe I felt that there were \objects\" behind me.   The á
Label: fear

Text: I insulted two of my friends because I thought that had been á gossiping about me right under my nose, however I later found out á that they were not doing so.
Label: shame

Text: My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's and á my own behaviour towards him.  His biased (authoritarian) and á ridiculous point of view made us angry.
Label: anger

Text: When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked á quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.
Label: shame

Text: I had worked very hard during my vacations to raise some money á for a few major items (e.g a radio).  but when I arrived at the á inter-city bus terminal, my hard earned money had been stolen á from me.
Label: anger

Text: [ When my performance (homework or other work) is better than others.]
Label: joy

Text: Winning a game after a long time of losing.
Label: joy

Text: Too busy to write letters to friends and they said I had á forgotten about them.
Label: guilt

Text: When I came back to my hostel, my bed was full of newspapers and á dirty clothes.  My room-mate asked me to wash the clothes for him á as he had no time (this was his responsibility).  The food we á shared had been eaten up by him (I ate little).
Label: anger

Text: When I met a friend of mine after several months.
Label: shame

Text: I wanted to borrow lecture notes from a friend and he did not á lend me them.
Label: anger

Text: When I read the diary of the girl with whom I was living, it was á about another boy with whom she had been going around some time back.
Label: sadness

Text: A classmate told me I must have bribed the class leader to let me á go to your English lecture.
Label: anger

Text: When I got a small present form a person I like very much.
Label: joy

Text: When I, for the first time, failed a junior exam, i.e form 3.
Label: disgust

Text: I saw a sort of black worm being attacked by many ants.
Label: disgust

Text: I received a message that my elder brother was involved in a car á accident and was admitted in hospital.
Label: sadness

Text: I was all of the sudden sad when I heard that my cousin who á usually paid school fees had passed away after a very short á illness.
Label: sadness

Text: Whenever I spoke to a female classmate I felt disgusted.  She á said meaningless things and seemed to indicate something to me á but I did not love/like her.
Label: disgust

Text: A young girl tried to put an end to her life because of lover's á grief; not until she was in hospital I heard that I had been the á reason for her action.
Label: guilt

Text: When I was taken to the place where my uncle had defecated in his á pants after having drunk beer.
Label: shame

Text: [ I am joyfull to be alive every night.]
Label: joy

Text: I ride my motorbike in my village and everyone stares at me as if á I was a rare specimen.
Label: shame

Text: It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were to á graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel á disgusted.
Label: disgust

Text: When my dog died.
Label: sadness

Text: Finding that a subordinate at work was still not willing to á cooperate after discussions to try and resolve an attitude á problem.
Label: anger

Text: When my grandfather died.
Label: sadness

Text: Someone ruining someone's property just for the fun of it.
Label: disgust

Text: When I passed the first examination that I had to repeat.
Label: joy

Text: When junior doctors returned to work after bunking them.
Label: disgust

Text: The day the results of the Chinese university was announced I á should have been very happy; however my grandmother, because of  á her prejudice and misunderstanding, started a  quarrel with my á mother.  She expected me to take her side and she deliberately á talked of my mother's wrong doings.  I was very angry because - á one my grandmother was not being reasonable and two because it á should have been a happy day and three we had moved into a new á house that day.
Label: anger

Text: After the first of May, I detested my fiance's friends, who had á piled on to our party and spoilt it completely.
Label: disgust

Text: The price I was charged for work on my car.
Label: disgust

Text: None.
Label: shame

Text: A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medical á school.  Her grades were very good and she should not have been á left out.  Biased judgment !
Label: anger

Text: Quarrel in the family.
Label: anger

Text: As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentioned á for guilt.
Label: fear

Text: When I overtook a car on the mainroad, misjudging the distance of á an oncoming car and this resulted in tooting and flashing from á the other driver (we could have collided), and I had an á acquaintance in the car with me.
Label: shame

Text: I call my mother at least once a week. However last week I á completely forgot. This morning she called me, she thought I felt á ill.
Label: guilt

Text: Misunderstood deliberately by a close friend.
Label: anger

Text: Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.
Label: sadness

Text: When India won the Prudential cup by beating West-Indies in the á final match and became the world cricket champion.  West-Indies á was the strongest of the eight countries which participated in á the competition.
Label: joy

Text: Getting lost in a strange place.
Label: fear

Text: I was unfaithful to my partner once when he was working abroad á for a long period.
Label: guilt

Text: During my birthday party a friend drank too much alcohol. So much á that he had to throw up. Worst of all was that he couldn't leave á my friend alone and that he was molesting her.
Label: disgust

Text: After a serie of facts that occurred between a colleague and me I á started to feel a certain necessity to get apart and I didn't want á to see her anymore.
Label: disgust

Text: I was to meet one of my friends (girl) at the library at 8:00 á already dark. She would be walking alone. She was 45 minutes late á but I kept waiting, calling her room and other places she could á have been.
Label: fear

Text: When I forgot my mother's birthday.
Label: shame

Text: Before an accident, my aunt offered me the front seat of the car, á next to the driver. I declined, she took that seat and was killed á there when the car crashed.
Label: guilt

Text: A lie on the part of a person close to me.
Label: disgust

Text: As a child - stepping on a rusty nail - being told that I might á get tetanus.
Label: fear

Text: I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently, á the pedology lecturer was the cause.
Label: anger

Text: Seeing relations from overseas after a few years.
Label: joy

Text: Climbing a mountain where the rocks were very loose. When we á realized the danger, we were very high up, but still had a long á climb ahead.
Label: fear

Text: I felt very sad when I left home because I could not stand it any á longer. I do not regret it, but I missed my little sister very á much (and she missed me). These feelings wear off over time.
Label: sadness

Text: When my exboyfriend threw me around the dorms because I was á talking on the phone to another guy of whom he was jealous, á after we had an argument in which I thought we broke up.
Label: fear

Text: [ No response.]
Label: disgust

Text: I was furious when the teacher pointed out in class that I á was the quietest girl in class.
Label: anger

Text: I told a lie about someone to someone else and they found out   á and questioned me about it.
Label: shame

Text: When I was young I had gone to an old lift and played with the á antique lift.  The guy discovered me and warned me, I was very á frightened.
Label: fear

Text: Anger at doctors for their treatment of me after giving birth. á They left part of placenta behind and I bled heavily for twelve á weeks - due to this, I felt weak and emotional, and they said I á needed psychiatric treatment and give me no support.
Label: anger

Text: When I forgot the lyrics during a song contest.
Label: sadness

Text: I liked to see off my aunt (from Zaire) to the airport. That á appeared to be impossible because I had to go to school. For long á time I wasn't sure if I could accompany her. Two days before the á departure they told me I was allowed to miss school.
Label: joy

Text: When a close friend took leave of me, because she went to Israel á for one year.
Label: sadness

Text: Being insulted in front of my parents, and they believed other á people (those insulting me).
Label: anger

Text: The way this particular girl spoke, behaved, and reacted the á first time I was introduced to her, I felt certain that something á between us would materialize.
Label: joy

Text: When my boss enrolled in a course to satisfy his own ends - to á trample on his associates.  I have the misfortune to have one of á my superiors in my course.
Label: anger

Text: My father was away from home and he did not come back when he was á expected, he came back several hours later than expected.
Label: fear

Text: My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I brought á another girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober I á felt quite ashamed of myself.
Label: shame

Text: I felt ashamed of my body in spite of knowing that it is more or á less beautiful and also knowing that my boyfriend considers me á beautiful, but this was only in the beginning.
Label: shame

Text: This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the á terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !
Label: fear

Text: When I applied for a false travelling claim allowance and later I á thought that I would be found out.
Label: guilt

Text: Not getting a job.
Label: sadness

Text: Someone had stolen an article from a library journal.
Label: disgust

Text: One of my best friends accused me of giving up to early on á problems. It was only a casual remark on her side, but I was á angry and hurt.
Label: anger

Text: [ I have not felt this emotion in my life.]
Label: shame

Text: When a colleague asked me for help at work, despite the fact á that he had more time to do it than I had.
Label: anger

Text: If a guy one is not interested in makes advances.
Label: disgust

Text: When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had á not expected to do so well.
Label: joy

Text: When I was finally able to return to a job that I enjoyed doing á after several months absence (I was not needed during this time).
Label: joy

Text: My girlfriend who had spent 6 months abroad broke off our á relationship by letter.
Label: sadness

Text: Walking in the dark by myself.
Label: fear

Text: This happened when one of my uncles died just whan I was á planning to go and visit him during the next holidays.
Label: sadness

Text: We were at a hamburger bar and a man at a table nearby started á coughing and spitting into his plate.
Label: disgust

Text: I borrowed money from a friend and did not pay back the debt when á I said I would.
Label: guilt

Text: I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of á practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for \a master of sports\"."
Label: joy

Text: I went to the prayer meeting at night and unfortunately the car á broke down, so my other sister said I had to walk alone from á Ndirande to Chirimba at around midnight. So we reached home at á 1 am. I was afraid of robbers and dardness.
Label: fear

Text: A friend which I hadn't seen for years, sent me a small present.
Label: joy

Text: An argument among friends in which my opinions on the way to á spend spare time were disapproved.
Label: anger

Text: My main disgust is against codfish because I detest even the á smell of it.
Label: disgust

Text: Once while studying for my exam I found so many complicated words á that it disgusted me.
Label: disgust

Text: The smell of garlic in rush-hour bus.
Label: disgust

Text: I got pass marks in the H.S.S compulsory courses while most á people performed well.
Label: shame

Text: I was entrusted with an object and while using it I handled it á carelessly and it broke.
Label: guilt

Text: Failing an examn.
Label: shame

Text: I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and have á to tell them I have failed an exam.
Label: guilt

Text: I was driving and a deer suddenly appeared in front of the á car when there was a lot of traffic behind me.
Label: fear

Text: When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.
Label: sadness

Text: When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been á careless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary á mistakes concerning things I know and understand.
Label: anger

Text: I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music á was a deep pulsing type - not really music. And a light flashed á on and off. It was in the complete darkness of a movie theatre á that was almost empty.
Label: fear

Text: I was in a sanatorium. In front of me a boy fell down from his á invalid's chair. I could help him but I didn't. I felt like being á paralysed.
Label: guilt

Text: Walking on the street passing by an air duct, my skirt went up.
Label: shame

Text: When you told everyone in the last lecture you will do all á lectures again in English and everybody can come (not only á English classes)
Label: joy

Text: Sometimes when I go to work my crazy boss (a hyper Jewish lawyer) á insists I do things his way (filing, typing, etc.). He sometimes á blames me for things I didn't do, and I can't yell back at him.
Label: anger

Text: The day I received the key of my apartment and we could enter in á it, for my fiancT and I had bought it yet in plans, and it seemed á to us that this was almost impossible to happen.
Label: joy

Text: My last genetices midterm - a decent grade.
Label: joy

Text: I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studying á for a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.
Label: guilt

Text: After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt great á joy and relief.  I had been haunted by the thesis during the á whole of my studies.
Label: joy

Text: When my father found me in bed with a girl, we were deep in actioon á when he entered the room.
Label: shame

Text: When I heard of the death of a friend who had just finished her á training I felt very sad for she was young.
Label: sadness

Text: My boy-friend an I seperated on his initiative.
Label: sadness

Text: When I did not buy what I had promised to.
Label: shame

Text: A similar feeling I felt quite recently while travelling in a á taxi. The driver treated me roughly and dishonestly - he chose á the longest route, he overdrawed almost one lev more and he tried á to be intimate with me.
Label: disgust

Text: One of my good friends told people something I had told her á in confidence about someone else.
Label: disgust

Text: My parents do not like my friend and told me not to go out with á him.
Label: anger

Text: After my +2, when I did not get admission in B.E I felt disgusted.
Label: disgust

Text: This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my á trousers without my consent.
Label: anger

Text: [ No response.]
Label: shame

Text: When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university á telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.
Label: joy

Text: When my first child was born.
Label: joy

Text: I was most disgusted when I had to make a nagging three day á journey recently from Calcutta to Bombay.  It was very boring and á tiring.
Label: disgust

Text: I happened to see two boys fighting, one of them fell down and á hurt his head.  The other one used this to spank the head of the  boy on the ground.
Label: disgust

Text: When after a party celebrating a friend's 21st birthday - upon á leaving I found 10 people outside throwing up and further 4 á unconscious.
Label: disgust

Text: When I witnessed a bus accident in which a bus, full of passengers, á  nearly overturned on the Lusaka-Kabwe road.á
Label: fear

Text: I remember the day my father died. I was 11 years old and my á sadness was so great that until today I remember everything á about that day, from the clothes I was wearing to the reactions of people, á the despair of my mother and brother. It marked me a lot and was á the greatest sadness I felt.
Label: sadness

Text: When I don't succeed to fulfill a promise.
Label: shame

Text: One day I was going through the street door of my house, when a á man asked me for a doctor.  He then showed me his genitals and á asked me to cure him myself.
Label: disgust

Text: I was working in a classmate's house with a group. A girl began á to graze her foot against mine under the table.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt disgust about all my friends. After having done a great á effort to organize an evening together, and didn't work out, they á put the blame on me. After this, I feel disgust towards those that á blame me.
Label: disgust

Text: I felt guilty when I was found to be the chief leader of making á noise in class.
Label: guilt

Text: When my father (physically handicapped) asks me to do something á and I raise several objections. Often I can fix it in few á moments.
Label: guilt

Text: I caught a glimpse of a black-beetle.
Label: disgust

Text: Promising to do a task for a friend and just forgetting about it.
Label: guilt

Text: The death of my grandfather.
Label: sadness

Text: A friend told me that he had suffered in love and in academics.  á I shared his sadness.
Label: sadness

Text: I couldn't sleep, and began to remind of my childhood. We are many á sisters and at that time we were spanked a lot and I don't know á why I started to remind of the spanks they and I had had, their á shouts when this happened.
Label: sadness

Text: When I met my mother after months of absence.
Label: joy

Text: A few days back a friend of mine poked me in the ribs for fun's á sake, though I had warned him an infinite number of times that it á really hurts me, he did it again.  I usually ignore this but this á time I flared up for a split second and threatened to bash him á up.  This is the latest incident when I lost my temper, though I á felt very bad about it later.
Label: anger

Text: I was very startled when, at night at 2.00 am, a boy approached á me and yelled \I fuck you\", then however he stopped and laughed at á
Label: fear

Text: My teacher's death.
Label: sadness

Text: When I lied to the physiology teacher.
Label: guilt

Text: When my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and the á rooms were allotted to first year students who were from \Rucher\" á
Label: disgust

Text: Won a prize for effort.
Label: joy

Text: I was angry at the Cafeteria when the cook scolded and said many á bad things about me without reason. He thought I was among the á girls who did him wrong.
Label: anger

Text: My first feeling of falling in love.  Coming across a person who á made me feel love, happiness, joy, giving me a new and beautiful á future, who made me dream.
Label: joy

Text: Before taking an exam.
Label: fear

Text: On our way to France, my girlfriend and I went to Verona. By á chance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets for á the dress-rehearsal of \Aida\". It was a different world for us á
Label: joy

Text: Slaughtering of animals.
Label: disgust

Text: When my brothers had passed all of their exams and were able to  á graduate from their courses.
Label: joy

Text: When I was caught with another man's wife.  I had taken the á opportuinty as this man was abroad but he returned that night.
Label: guilt
